SourceText:
One day Akadeli, Lucy, Acharait, and Mary went to pick wild fruit.

They held hands to cross the big river.
text:
有一天，阿卡黛丽、露西、阿查瑞特和玛丽去采摘野果。

他们手牵手穿过大河。

SourceText: Count the girls together.
text: 数一数女孩们。

SourceText: Describe the patterns you see in their clothing. Do you like to wear solids, patterns, or both?
text: 描述你在她们的衣服上看到的图案。你喜欢穿纯色、图案还是两者都喜欢？

SourceText: Friends sometimes hold hands to keep each other company or show they are friends. Why are these girls holding hands?
text: 朋友们有时会牵手来陪伴对方或表示他们是朋友。这些女孩为什么手牵着手？

SourceText:
The girls found a tree full of ripe fruit.

They agreed to pick the fruit with their eyes closed.
text:
女孩们发现了一棵满是成熟果实的树。

她们同意闭着眼睛摘水果。

SourceText: Name all the colors in the colorful clothes they are wearing.
text: 请列出她们穿的彩色衣服中的所有颜色。

SourceText: Each girl has her arms in a different position. Can you copy their arm positions with your arms?
text: 每个女孩的手臂都处于不同的姿势。你能用你的手臂复制她们的手臂姿势吗？

SourceText: Count together the branches coming off the main trunk of this tree. You will have to decide which ones are big enough to count.
text: 数一数这棵树主干上分支的数量。你将决定哪些足够大到可以被计数。

SourceText:
Lucy, Acharait and Mary did not close their eyes.

Only Akadeli closed hers.
text:
露西、阿查瑞特和玛丽没有闭上眼睛。

只有阿卡黛丽闭上了她的眼睛。

SourceText: Why do you think the other girls did not close their eyes?
text: 你认为其他女孩为什么不闭上眼睛？

SourceText: This is a good climbing tree. Count together the branches that look the strongest.
text: 这是一棵适合攀爬的好树。数一数看起来最结实的树枝。

SourceText: Do you ever do things with your eyes closed, just for fun?
text: 你有没有因为好玩而闭着眼睛做过事情？

SourceText: When they opened their eyes, only Akadeli had picked unripe fruit.
text: 当她们睁开眼睛时，只有阿卡黛丽摘到了未成熟的水果。

SourceText: Estimate how many pieces of fruit there are in one basket. Estimating means making an informed guess. Is your estimate bigger than the biggest number you know?
text: 估计一个篮子里有多少个水果。估计意味着做出有根据的猜测。你的估计比你知道的最大的数字还要大吗？

SourceText: What shapes are there on the two blue dresses?
text: 这两件蓝色连衣裙上有哪些形状？

SourceText: Did you ever play a game where some of the people didn't follow the rules? How did it make you feel?
text: 你有没有玩过有些人不遵守规则的游戏？那会让你有什么感觉？

SourceText:
Lucy, Acharait, and Mary laughed at Akadeli. They left for home.

Akadeli threw away the unripe fruit. She began picking ripe ones.
text:
露西、阿查瑞特和玛丽嘲笑了阿卡黛丽。她们回家去了。

阿卡黛丽扔掉了未成熟的水果。她开始摘熟了的果实。

SourceText: If you have four girls and you take three away, how many are left?
text: 如果有四个女孩，你减去三个，还剩下几个？

SourceText: When people laugh at you, does that make you feel angry or ashamed? Were you able to ignore them knowing they were just being mean?
text: 当人们嘲笑你时，这会让你感到愤怒还是羞愧？你知道他们很刻薄，你能无视他们吗？

SourceText: Why did Akadeli stay behind to pick fruit?
text: 为什么阿卡黛丽留下来摘水果？

SourceText:
Soon, Akadeli filled her basket with ripe fruit.

She set off alone, crossing the big river.
text:
很快，阿卡黛丽的篮子里装满了成熟的水果。

她独自出发了，渡过那条大河。

SourceText: How many splashes can you count when her fruit hits the water?
text: 当她的水果落到水里时，你能数出多少飞溅的水花？

SourceText: Count the larger trees together.
text: 数一数较大的树。

SourceText: Why do you think Akadeli slipped in the river when no one slipped before? Is there another reason for holding hands?
text: 你觉得为什么阿卡黛丽会在没人滑倒过的河里滑倒？牵手还有别的原因吗？

SourceText:
Half way across the river, Akadeli's fruit fell into the water.

She was angry and began to cry.
text:
走到河的一半，阿卡黛丽的水果掉进了水里。

她生气了，哭了起来。

SourceText: Akadeli is standing in the middle of some circles in the water. How many?
text: 阿卡黛丽站在水里的一些圆圈中间。有多少个圆圈？

SourceText: People cry sometimes when they are sad or angry. Have you been sad or angry when you spilled something?
text: 当人们伤心或生气时，有时会哭。当你洒了东西时，你是否感到难过或生气？

SourceText: Count together the dark squares in the checkerboard pattern on her shirt.
text: 数一数她衬衫上棋盘格图案中的黑色方块。

SourceText: Akadeli saw a big fish and grabbed it.
text: 阿卡黛丽看见一条大鱼，抓住了它。

SourceText: Is it okay that Akadeli lost her basket? Do you think her parents will be mad?
text: 阿卡黛丽丢了篮子没关系吗？你觉得她父母会生气吗？

SourceText: The title says this is Akadeli's lucky day. How is Akadeli's day going so far?
text: 标题说这是阿卡黛丽的幸运日。到目前为止，阿卡黛丽今天过得怎么样？

SourceText: Is this fish bigger or smaller than Akadeli?
text: 这条鱼比阿卡黛丽大还是小？

SourceText:
As Akadeli walked home, a hawk snatched the fish.

He flew away with it.
text:
当阿卡黛丽走回家时，一只​​鹰叼走了那条鱼。

他带着它飞走了。

SourceText: The hawk snatched the fish with the talons on its feet. How many talons do you see?
text: 鹰用脚上的爪子抓住了鱼。你看到了多少只爪子？

SourceText: The hawk's wings and Akadeli's shirt look a bit alike -- describe how they are similar and how they are different.
text: 鹰的翅膀和阿卡黛丽的衬衫看起来有点像——描述它们有何相似之处和不同之处。

SourceText: What is Akadeli feeling as she watches the hawk fly away with her fish?
text: 当阿卡黛丽看着鹰带着她的鱼飞走时，她有什么感觉？

SourceText:
The hawk left behind a feather from its tail.

Akadeli picked up the feather and continued walking home.
text:
鹰留下了尾巴上的一根羽毛。

阿卡黛丽捡起羽毛，继续走回家。

SourceText: How many spots are on this feather?
text: 这根羽毛上有多少个斑点？

SourceText: Have you ever found a feather? Was it very colorful?
text: 你找到过羽毛吗？颜色是不是很丰富？

SourceText: There are three kinds of plants in this picture. Point at the tallest and shortest ones.
text: 这张图片里有三种植物。指出最高和最矮的。

SourceText:
She came across a traditional wedding. Dancers were wearing grass on their heads instead of feathers as was the tradition.

They took her feather and gave her a big bull!
text:
她遇到了一场传统的婚礼。舞者们头上戴着的是草，而不是传统的羽毛。

他们拿走了她的羽毛，给了她一头大公牛！

SourceText: Count how many people are wearing yellow grass on their heads.
text: 数一数有多少人头上戴着黄草。

SourceText: Estimate how many people it would take to weigh as much as that bull.
text: 估计需要多少人才能和那头公牛一样重。

SourceText: Surprisingly, Akadeli traded a feather for a bull. Why did the people do that?
text: 令人惊讶的是，阿卡黛丽用一根羽毛换了一头公牛。人们为什么这么做？

SourceText:
Akadeli reached home with her bull. Her parents and relatives were so happy. Lucy, Acharait, and Mary wished they had not lied to Akadeli.

It was a lucky day for Akadeli!
text:
阿卡黛丽带着她的公牛回到了家。她的父母和亲戚们都很高兴。露西、阿查瑞特和玛丽希望自己没有对阿卡黛丽撒过谎。

这对阿卡黛丽来说是幸运的一天！

SourceText: How do you think the other girls feel?
text: 你觉得其他女孩感觉如何？

SourceText: Have you ever lied to someone? If so, did it make you feel sorry or ashamed?
text: 你曾经对别人说过谎吗？如果有，这是否让你感到遗憾或羞愧？

SourceText: Count the number of difficult moments in Akadeli's day. All turned out well in the end. Life can be full of surprises!
text: 数一数阿卡黛丽一天中经历了多少困难时刻。最后一切都好起来了。生活可以充满惊喜！

SourceText: When Akai was a little girl, her mother used to put her to sleep on a beautiful mat. Akai's aunt made this special mat from palm leaves.
text: 当阿凯还是个小女孩时，她妈妈经常把她放在一块漂亮的草席上睡觉。阿凯的阿姨用棕榈叶做的这块特殊的草席。

SourceText: Notice the beautiful colors and patterns everywhere in this room!
text: 注意这个房间里到处都是美丽的颜色和图案！

SourceText: Name and describe as many shapes as you can in this picture.
text: 尽可能多地说出和描述这张图片中的形状。

SourceText: Do you have a favorite blanket or item you like to sleep with?
text: 当你睡觉的时候有喜欢的毯子或其他物品吗？

SourceText: The mat had bright pink, blue, and green colors. It was different from other mats that Akai's mother had in the hut.
text: 草席上有亮粉红色、蓝色和绿色。它与阿凯母亲小屋里的其他草席不同。

SourceText: Discuss the patterns in Akai's mat. The rows alternate between lighter and darker colors. It has pairs of rows of reds, greens, and blues.
text: 讨论阿凯草席上的图案。行之间交替更亮和更暗的颜色。它有成对的红色、绿色和蓝色。

SourceText: A rectangle is a 4-sided shape like this page. This mat is a rectangle and it has 30 rows of 9 rectangles.
text: 矩形是像这页纸一样的 4 边形。这个草席是一个矩形，有 30 行 9 个矩形。

SourceText: 30 rows of 9 rectangles makes 270 rectangles for the mat. Can you skip count by 30's to 270? If not, perhaps you can skip count by 3's to 27.
text: 30 行 9 个矩形总共是 270 个矩形。你能间隔计数到 270 吗？如果不行，也许你能间隔计数到 27。

SourceText: The land around Akai's home was very dry, hot, and full of stones. There were many scorpions, spiders, and snakes too. But Akai was never in danger of being bitten by these dangerous creatures.
text: 阿凯家周围的土地非常干燥、炎热，到处都是石头。还有很多蝎子、蜘蛛和蛇。但是阿凯从不会被这些危险的生物咬伤。

SourceText: Find all the little creatures around Akai on the ground. Do you think her mat protected her somehow from these dangerous creatures?
text: 找到阿凯周围地上所有的小生物。你认为她的草席以某种方式保护她免受这些危险生物的伤害吗？

SourceText: If you were surrounded by dangerous things, do you think you would be as happy as Akai looks in this picture?
text: 如果你被危险的东西包围，你觉得和阿凯在这张图片里看起来一样开心吗？

SourceText: Notice that the hills that are farther away are fainter and lighter than the closer hills. You can often use the degree of faintness to help you tell what is closer and what is farther away in a picture.
text: 注意，更远的山丘比近处的山丘更模糊、更浅。你通常可以用模糊的程度来帮助你判断什么更近，什么更远。

SourceText: Her mother said, "Her special mat protects Akai from any harm."
text: 她妈妈说：“她的特殊草席保护阿凯免受任何伤害。”

SourceText: Do you believe that objects, such as a mat, can have special, magical powers?
text: 你相信物品，比如草席，能有特殊的、神奇的力量吗？

SourceText: Do you have anything that you believe helps you in a magical way?
text: 你相信有能帮助你的神奇东西吗？

SourceText: There are many shapes here in addition to the rectangles. Find the triangles and the round shapes in this picture.
text: 除了矩形，这里还有很多形状。在这张照片中找出三角形和圆形。

SourceText: Akai was a clever child. She discovered where the nearest shallow well was.
text: 阿凯是一个聪明的孩子。她发现了附近最浅的水井在哪里。

SourceText: In a very dry place, finding a shallow well would be very important to her village. They must have all thought very highly of Akai.
text: 在一个非常干旱的地方，找到浅水井对她的村庄来说非常重要。他们一定都非常看重阿凯。

SourceText: There are many different beautiful colors in their clothes. Do you know which of the seven colors of the rainbow are missing in this picture?
text: 他们的衣服上有许多不同的漂亮颜色。你知道这张图片中缺少哪些彩虹的七种颜色吗？

SourceText: You  can count all their legs by counting by 2's. You can count their arms the same way. How would you count their arms and legs together? Would you count by 2's or by 4's?
text: 你可以通过计算 2 来计算所有的腿。你可以同样的方式计算他们的胳膊。计算他们的胳膊和腿你会间隔计数2 还是 4？

SourceText: Akai also knew where her grandmother's manyatta was located. She often went to drink camel milk with her grandmother.
text: 阿凯也知道她祖母的牧民区在哪里。她经常去和祖母一起喝骆驼奶。

SourceText: A manyatta is a small village. Akai was very good at finding her way around the area where she lived. How are you at finding things around the area where you live?
text: 牧民区是一个小村庄。阿凯在她生活的地区非常善于寻路。你在生活的地区如何寻路？

SourceText: Some people have a strong sense of direction, and others can get easily confused. Which are you?
text: 有些人有很强的方向感，有些人很容易迷路。你是哪一种？

SourceText: Her grandmother's mat looks very similar to Akai's mat. Describe some differences you see between the two mats.
text: 她祖母的草席看起来很像阿凯的草席。描述你看到两块草席之间的一些差异。

SourceText: One day, Akai was not so lucky. She left to go to her grandmother's manyatta, but she got lost in the hills. Akai was afraid.
text: 有一天，阿凯不是那么走运。她离开去她祖母的牧民区，但在山里迷路了。阿凯很害怕。

SourceText: No matter how good we are at things, everyone can make a mistake. Can you think of a time recently when that happened to you?
text: 无论我们多擅长某些事情，每个人都会犯错误。你记得最近什么时候犯过错误吗？

SourceText: As much as we may not like our own mistakes, we should not ignore them. Mistakes are often very interesting and have a lot to teach us about ourselves.
text: 尽管我们可能不喜欢自己的错误，但我们不应该忽略它们。错误通常非常有趣，能教会我们很多关于自己的东西。

SourceText: What about the way Akai looks in this picture tells you that she is afraid?
text: 这张图片中阿凯的样子告诉你她在害怕什么？

SourceText: She sat under an edome tree and waited for help. Soon she fell asleep and had a dream.
text: 她在一棵埃都梅树下坐着等待帮助。不久她就睡着了，做了一个梦。

SourceText: If you are lost on a hot day, it is wise to find a cool, shady place and hope to be rescued. High heat can be a very dangerous thing and it should be handled carefully.
text: 如果在炎热的日子里迷路，找到一个凉爽、阴凉的地方并是明智的选择。高温可能非常危险，需要小心处理。

SourceText: People have many kinds of dreams. Some are scary, some are fun, some seem ridiculous, and some seem very real. What kinds of dreams do you have?
text: 人们有许多种梦。有些令人恐惧，有些很有趣，有些似乎荒谬，有些似乎很真实。你做过什么样的梦？

SourceText: As they go up, most of these branches split into two branches. So, 1 branch becomes 2, and those become 4, and so on. How high can you keep doubling before it gets to be too big a number?
text: 随着视线向上，大多数这些树枝分成两枝。所以，1 枝变成 2 枝，那些变成 4 枝，等等。你能计算多少次加倍数会变得太大？

SourceText: This is what Akai dreamed. She was lying on her special mat. A woman who looked like her grandmother was watching over her. The old woman smiled and gave her a bowl of camel milk. Just when Akai stretched out her hand to take the milk, she woke up.
text: 这就是阿凯梦见的。她躺在特殊的草席上。一个看起来像她祖母的女人在照看她。老太太笑了，给了她一碗骆驼奶。就在阿凯伸手要拿奶的时候，她醒了。

SourceText: Do you think you can receive a message from a dream, or are they meaningless? What do you think this dream was trying to tell Akai?
text: 你认为能从梦中得到启示吗，还是它们并没有意义？你认为这个梦在试图告诉阿凯什么？

SourceText: Notice the circles of color centered just in front of grandmother's face. When circles have a common center they are called concentric circles.
text: 注意祖母脸前面的颜色圆圈。当圆圈有共同的中心时，它们称为同心圆。

SourceText: Which colors are repeated in her clothing and jewelry, and which appear only once?
text: 哪些颜色在她的衣服和首饰中重复出现，哪些只出现一次？

SourceText: Akai opened her eyes slowly. When she looked up, she saw a small blue bird on a branch above her.
text: 阿凯慢慢睁开眼睛。当她仰头望去时，她看见树枝上有一只小蓝鸟。

SourceText: Sometimes writers use special things in stories as symbols. Do you think the blue bird symbolizes something special in this story, or is it just a blue bird with no special meaning?
text: 有时作家在故事中使用特殊的东西作为象征。你认为小蓝鸟在这个故事中象征着什么特殊的东西，还是它只是一个没有特殊意义的小蓝鸟？

SourceText: Two pages ago we saw that same tree, but there are a few differences between the two pictures of the tree. How many differences can you find?
text: 在前两页我们看到同一棵树，但两张树的图片之间有一些不同。你能找到多少不同？

SourceText: Akai and the bird are looking at each other. If they could talk to each other, what would they say?
text: 阿凯和小鸟互相看着对方。如果他们能互相说话，他们会说什么？

SourceText: When Akai got up, the small blue bird flapped its wings and led the way for Akai. She followed the bird.
text: 当阿凯起身时，小蓝鸟拍打翅膀，为阿凯带路。她跟着小鸟走。

SourceText: Birds can be fast and hard to follow. Have you ever tried to follow a wild animal to see where it was going?
text: 跟着野生动物看它要去哪儿很难。你曾经试过跟着野生动物看它要去哪里吗？

SourceText: If you were lost in a dangerous place, would you trust your safety to an unusual animal? Akai is being very trusting.
text: 如果你在一个危险的地方迷路，你会觉得和一只不寻常的动物在一起安全吗？阿凯非常相信它。

SourceText: How do you think this will turn out? Will the bird lead Akai to safety or will she get even more lost following this silly bird?
text: 你认为这会有什么结果？小鸟会领阿凯到安全的地方，还是她跟着这只傻鸟会迷路的更厉害？

SourceText: Akai came to a place where the path went in two directions. The blue bird dropped a piece of a mat that was like Akai's own mat.
text: 阿凯来到一处岔路。小蓝鸟扔下一片像阿凯自己草席的碎片。

SourceText: Dropping a piece of mat is quite an unusual thing for any bird to do. Maybe trusting this bird is not such a bad idea after all. What do you think?
text: 任何鸟扔下一片草席都非常不寻常。也许相信这只小鸟并不是一件坏事。你觉得呢？

SourceText: We didn't see that piece of mat in any other pictures of the bird. Where did that piece of mat come from and how did the bird get it?
text: 我们在小鸟的其他图片中没有看到那块草席。那块草席片从哪里来的，小鸟是怎么得到它的？

SourceText: Look at Akai's face. What does her expression tell you about how she is feeling?
text: 看看阿凯的表情。她的表情告诉你她的感受如何？

SourceText: Picking up the piece of mat, Akai saw footprints that she knew were her mother's. Soon she saw the shallow well from where they fetched water.
text: 捡起草席碎片，阿凯看到她认出是母亲的脚印。不久她看到她们打水的浅水井。

SourceText: It's good she trusted that strange bird. She ended up being taken to safety by following her instincts and trusting the bird.
text: 相信那只奇怪的小鸟是对的。通过遵循直觉和相信小鸟，她最终被带到安全地方。

SourceText: Have you ever had to trust something or someone in an unusual situation? You have to be very careful about the people you choose to trust.
text: 你是否曾在一个不寻常的情况下不得不相信某人或某事。选择相信他人需要非常小心。

SourceText: Do you know what anyone else's footprints look like? When you live where it is important to be able to follow paths, do you suppose you get good at recognizing tracks made by various people and animals?
text: 你知道其他任何人的脚印看起来怎么样？当你生活在一个需要循迹而行的地方时，你觉得你会善于辨认不同的人和动物留下的足迹吗？

SourceText: Akai's family sang and danced to welcome her home. They made a feast to celebrate their child's safe return.
text: 阿凯的家人唱歌跳舞欢迎她回家。他们准备了一场盛宴来庆祝孩子安全归来。

SourceText: Look at how happy they all are with Akai's safe return. How can you tell that they are happy?
text: 看看他们都为阿凯的安全归来感到高兴。你如何判断他们很高兴？

SourceText: Their clothes have beautiful colors and patterns. Which of these do you like the most?
text: 他们的衣服有漂亮的颜色和图案。你最喜欢这些中的哪一个？

SourceText: Akai likes to go barefoot a lot, while many of the other people in this story wear sandals. Which do you prefer?
text: 阿凯喜欢经常赤脚，而这个故事中的许多其他人都穿凉鞋。你更喜欢哪一个？

SourceText: Akai sat on her special mat and enjoyed eating some delicious food.
text: 阿凯坐在特制的草席上，享受吃一些美味的食物。

SourceText: At the end of a scary day, she looks very happy. After a disturbing incident, it can be wonderful to be back in a familiar and safe place.
text: 在可怕的一天结束时，她看起来非常开心。在令人不安的事件后，回到熟悉和安全的地方可能会很美好。

SourceText: Do you have a favorite place where you feel particularly safe and comfortable?
text: 你有最喜欢安全舒适的地方吗？

SourceText: Does her happiness come from her mat or from herself?
text: 她的快乐来自她自己还是来自草席？

SourceText: Long ago, in a town call Sunland, lived a girl with very long legs. Aku was her name.
text: 很久以前，在一个叫太阳岛的小镇里，住着一个腿特别长的女孩。她叫阿库。

SourceText: There are three round houses with thatched roofs. Thatch is a mix of dead and living plant material, usually grass. A thatched roof can help keep a house cool or warm. From the distance, those roofs look like triangles.
text: 这里有三座圆屋顶的草房。草房的屋顶是由干的和湿的植物材料制成的，通常是草编织而成的。草编的屋顶可以帮助房屋保持凉爽或温暖。远看，这些草房的屋顶像三角形。

SourceText: Think of some reasons why these houses with thatched roofs are round.
text: 想一想为什么这些草房都是圆顶的。

SourceText: Notice Aku's face and the position of her arms. We can learn a lot about how someone is feeling by their body position. What do you think she is feeling?
text: 注意阿库的表情和她的手臂位置。通过一个人的身体姿势，我们可以了解很多关于他们感受的信息。你认为她现在是什么感觉？

SourceText:
Aku wondered about a lot of things.

Sometimes Aku's father, Ataa Ankra, a fisherman, let her go to the river with him to fish in his canoe. While Aku fished with her father, she wondered why the sun always looked at her from the sky.

Sometimes Aku helped her mother, A'anua, to cook. Aku wondered why palm oil looked red in calabash but yellow in yam pottage.
text:
阿库对很多事情都感到好奇。
有时候，阿库的父亲，阿塔·安克拉，是一名渔夫，会让她陪同他一起划独木舟去河边捕鱼。当阿库和她的父亲一起钓鱼时，她想知道为什么太阳总是从天空中看着她。
有时候，阿库也会帮助她的母亲，阿努瓦，做饭。阿库想知道为什么棕榈油在葫芦里是红色的，但在山药煮粥里是黄色的。

SourceText: Being curious and asking questions is an important way we learn new things. What are some things you are curious about right now?
text: 对事物充满好奇并提出问题是我们学习新事物的重要途径。你现在对一些事情好奇吗？

SourceText: Aku feels a special connection to the sun. Some people feel a connection to the moon or a star. Do you notice things about the sun, such as where it is in the morning or evening?
text: 阿库总觉得自己与太阳有一种特殊的联系。有些人觉得自己与月亮或星星有联系。你有没有注意到太阳的一些特点，比如它在早上或傍晚的时候在哪个位置？

SourceText: One thing about the sun is what happens when it shines through rain. This creates a beautiful arc, which is part of a circle, in the sky. Can you name the colors of the rainbow?
text: 关于太阳，有一件很美的事情就是当它的光穿过雨幕时。这会在天空中形成一个美丽的弧线，是圆的一部分。你能说出彩虹的颜色吗？

SourceText:
And Aku wondered why Oti, her brother, and the other boys would not let her play football (soccer) with them. Once, Aku asked the boys why. They only laughed and told her to go and play with the girls.

The girls too would not play with Aku. "Your legs are too long," they always said.

Aku was left lonely. She had no one to share her many thoughts with.
text:
而阿库想知道为什么她的弟弟奥蒂和其他男孩不让她和他们一起踢足球。有一次，阿库问男孩们为什么。他们只是笑而不答，告诉她去和女孩们一起玩。
女孩们也不和阿库玩。“你的腿太长了，”她们总是这么说。
阿库感到孤独，没有人能让她分享她的许多想法。

SourceText: Is football (soccer) a game that only boys can play? Are there any sports that only boys or only girls can play?
text: 足球是只有女孩才能玩的游戏吗？有哪些运动是只有男孩或只有女孩才能玩的吗？

SourceText: Point at matching colors in the clothes in this picture. Are there any colors that don't have a match?
text: 指出这张图片中衣服上颜色相匹配的部分。有没有颜色找不到匹配的？

SourceText: Many time people get excluded from a group because there are different in some way. Did you ever see someone excluded like this? It's a mean thing to do!
text: 许多时候，人们会因为某种原因而被排斥在一个群体之外。你有没有见过有人像这样被排斥？这是一种不好的行为！

SourceText:
But Aku soon became friends with the sun.

She looked forward to seeing the sun every morning when she woke up. The cocks crowed to announce sunrise. Aku loved to dance in the early morning sun, her shadow dancing with her. The tweeting of birds made the cock crow music sweeter.

Then sun filled Aku with happiness. The sun made Aku smile a lot.
text:
但阿库很快与太阳成了朋友。 
她期待着每天早上醒来时能见到太阳。公鸡啼叫宣告着日出。阿库喜欢在早晨的阳光中跳舞，她的影子与她一同舞动。鸟儿的鸣唱使公鸡的啼叫变得更加美妙。
太阳让阿库充满了幸福，太阳让阿库心情愉悦。

SourceText: Birds often chirp and roosters crow right before the sun rises. Have you noticed special morning sounds when you wake up early?
text: 鸟儿常在日出前鸣叫，公鸡也会在这个时候啼叫。如果你很早起床，你注意到过特别的早晨声音吗？

SourceText: Notice the shadows that the sun makes on this page and many of the other pages.
text: 留意太阳在这一页和其他许多页上投下的影子。

SourceText: The sun creates longer shadows in the morning and late afternoon, and very short shadows at midday. Have you played with your own shadow as it copies you and follows you?
text: 太阳在早上和傍晚会产生较长的影子，在中午会产生非常短的影子。你有没有和自己的影子玩过，看着它模仿你并跟随你？

SourceText:
But one day, the sun did not rise. Aku waited for the cocks to crow. They did not. The birds too did not tweet.

And without the sun in Sunland, people could not go about their daily activities. Farmers could not go to tend their crops. And the sky was grey and sad. Ataa Ankra could not go fishing. Children too could not prepare for school. And women could not go to the market to haggle over the prices of soap and kerosene.

Aku missed all these. She missed the cock crows and bird tweets too. And she missed the sunrise more.
text:
但有一天，太阳没有升起。阿库等待着公鸡的啼叫，它们没有啼叫。鸟儿也没有鸣唱。没有了太阳，太阳岛的人们无法进行日常活动。农民无法去照顾庄稼。天空灰蒙蒙的，很悲伤。阿克拉无法去钓鱼。孩子们也无法准备上学。妇女们也无法去市场讨价还价买肥皂和煤油。
阿库想念这一切。她也想念公鸡的啼叫和鸟儿的鸣唱。最想念的还是日出。

SourceText: A rectangle is a shape with four straight sides, like this page. How many rectangles can you find in this picture?
text: 矩形是四条直边的形状，就像这页书。你能在这张图片里找到多少个矩形？

SourceText: If it is dark when you get up, what kinds of things can you do without the sun in the sky?
text: 如果你起床时天还黑，没有太阳，你能做哪些事情？

SourceText: If you didn't see the sun one dark morning, what would you think?
text: 如果有一天阴暗的早晨你没有看到太阳，你会怎么想？

SourceText:
Everyone wanted to know where the sun went. "Maybe the sun is dead," some people said. "The sun has travelled," said others.

Aku disagreed, "No, the sun is not dead. And the sun has not travelled. Or it would have first told me."

Some people chuckled at what Aku said. She continued anyway, "I tell the truth. The sun is my friend. The sun is not dead. It is only —". But no one would hear anymore. Everyone forgot about the sun. They laughed hard at Aku. The children laughed too. The children's laughter pained Aku the most.
text:
每个人都想知道太阳去哪了。"也许太阳死了，”有些人说。"太阳离开了，”另一些人说。
阿库不同意；“不, 太阳没有死。太阳也没有离开。要离开它会先告诉我的。”
有些人嗤之以鼻，认为阿库说的很荒唐。但她继续说：“我说的是真的。太阳是我的朋友。它没有死。它只是——” 但没人再听她说下去。所有人都忘记了太阳。他们嘲笑阿库。孩子们也嘲笑她。孩子们的嘲笑最伤阿库的心。

SourceText: There are 6 children in this picture. How many of their limbs (arms and legs) can you see?
text: 这张图片里有6个小孩。你能看到他们多少条肢体(手臂和腿)？

SourceText: Skip count by 4's six times to count how many limbs these 6 children have. You can also skip count by 6's four times to get this same number. Why does that work?
text: 用4进行六次跳跃计数，计算这6个小孩一共有多少条肢体。你也可以用6进行四次跳跃计数，得到相同的结果。为什么这两种方法都可以呢？

SourceText: How many more limbs do they have than the number you can see?
text: 除了你看到的，他们还有多少条肢体？

SourceText:
Sad like the sky, Aku hastened into her house.

On the way, she accidentally kicked her brother's football. The ball rolled into the kitchen. There was a calabash of palm oil in a corner of the kitchen. The ball hit the calabash. The calabash was toppled.

The palm oil on it spilled. The palm oil soiled the ball.
text:
阿库像天空一样有着悲伤的心情，她急忙跑进自己的家。 
在路上，她不小心踢到了弟弟的足球。那个球滚进了厨房。厨房的一个角落里有一个装着棕榈油的葫芦。球撞到了那个葫芦，把它打翻了。
上面的棕榈油洒了出来。棕榈油弄脏了足球。

SourceText: What do you think Aku's brother will do when he sees that his ball has oil all over it?
text: 你认为阿库的弟弟看到他的球被油弄脏了会做什么？

SourceText: The calabash is the bowl that was holding the oil. How did all that oil fit in that calabash?
text: 那个葫芦就是装油的碗。那么多油怎么能装进那个葫芦里呢？

SourceText: Did you ever spill a small glass of water or milk and watch it spread out on the floor? A little bit can cover a lot of floor!
text: 你有没有见过打翻一小杯水或牛奶，看它在地板上扩散开来？一点点液体就可以覆盖很大一块地板！

SourceText:
Oti came into the house with one of his friends to fetch his ball. He saw the toppled calabash, the spilled palm oil. He saw his soiled ball too.

Before he could run out to tell A'anua what Aku had done, Aku picked up the ball and ran off. The boys followed Aku. They all met A'anua outside the house. A'anua saw Aku holding the ball. Before she could call Aku and scold her, Aku ran past her.

Oti, A'anua and all the people of Sunland watched Aku run away. They wondered what she would do with the soiled ball.
text:
奥蒂和他的一个朋友一起进了屋子，想要找他的球。他看到了倒下的葫芦，洒在地板上的棕榈油。他还看到了沾满油的球。
奥蒂和他的一个朋友一起进了屋子，想要找他的球。他看到了倒下的葫芦，洒在地板上的棕榈油。他还看到了沾满油的球。
奥蒂、阿努阿和所有太阳岛的人都看着阿库跑开。他们想知道她会怎么处理那个弄脏的球。

SourceText: Many ten-year olds can run a mile in ten minutes. Aku is extra fast. How many minutes do you think it takes her to run a mile? 2 minutes? 5 minutes? 8 minutes?
text: 很多10岁的孩子可以在10分钟内跑完一英里。阿库跑得非常快。你认为她跑一英里需要多少分钟？2分钟？5分钟？8分钟？

SourceText: What about Aku allows her to run so fast?
text: 是什么让阿库能够跑得这么快？

SourceText: The sun is gone, people are laughing at Aku, and Aku has a dirty ball. How do you think the story will resolve all these problems?
text: 太阳已经落山，人们嘲笑阿库，阿库的球也弄脏了。你认为故事会如何解决这些问题？

SourceText:
Aku stopped when she got to the middle of the town square. She put the ball on the ground.

With a mighty swing of her hands and a swift pull of one long leg behind the other, Aku kicked the ball. The ball turned round on the ground, spinning towards the edge of the town square. It hit the roots of the palm tree at one end of the town square.
text: 阿库走到镇广场中间时停了下来。她把球放在地上。\Para\thinspace 阿库挥动她的手，迅速将一条长腿拉到另一条腿后面，然后踢了一脚。球在地上转了一圈，朝着广场边缘旋转。它撞到了广场一端的棕榈树的根部。

SourceText: What in the picture tells you that the ball is flying fast?
text: 图片中有什么让你知道球在快速飞行？

SourceText: Why is the path of the ball curved instead of straight?
text: 为什么球的路径是弯曲的而不是直的？

SourceText: Why did Aku need to swing her hands to kick the ball hard? Notice how many other parts of your body are involved with action of just one part.
text: 为什么阿库需要挥动她的手来猛踢球？注意一下你的身体的多少其他部分都参与了这个动作。

SourceText:
The ball shot into the sad sky. With mouths opened wide, the people of Sunland gazed after the flying ball. The ball flew beyond the clouds, beyond the gaze of the eyes.

Everything was still. All was quiet.

Suddenly, the sky cleared. The clouds became white, round and fluffy. Then a big ball came from behind the clouds. The ball was bright. And it was red and yellow like palm oil. The ball was the sun. Aku's sun.

Everything stirred. The quietness left.
text:
然后，球射向阴暗的天空。太阳岛的人们凝张大嘴巴视着飞行的球。球飞越云层，超越了视线的范围。
一切都静止了, 一切都是安静的。
突然间，天空放晴了。云朵变得白色、圆润而蓬松。然后，一个大球从云后出现。这个球很明亮。而且它是红色和黄色的，就像棕榈油一样。这个球是太阳。阿库的太阳。
一切都生动起来，声音也都回来了。

SourceText: How many different colors of clothes do you see here? Which colors of the rainbow are missing?
text: 你在这里看到了多少种不同颜色的衣服？彩虹的哪些颜色缺失了？

SourceText: Do the colors of the clothes you are wearing match any of these clothes?
text: 你穿的衣服的颜色是否与这些衣服中的任何一种相匹配？

SourceText: Finding what is the same and what is different is an important way we understand the things in our world.
text: 找到相同和不同之处是我们理解世界中事物的重要方式。

SourceText:
Soon, everyone was rushing home to prepare for their daily activities.

Ataa Ankra looked for his fish bucket. Farmers took their hoes. Children bathed and dressed, ready to go to school. Women tied monies at the ends of their cover cloths. They carried their basins and baskets and hurried to the market.
text:
很快，每个人都赶回家准备他们的日常活动。
阿塔·安克拉找到了他的捕鱼桶。农民拿起锄头。孩子们洗澡、穿衣，准备上学。妇女在头巾的两端系上钱币。她们提着水盆和篮子，匆匆赶往市场。

SourceText: It is dangerous to look at the sun, but we can still notice its changes. Depending on the weather and the time of day, the sun can look glowing yellow, hot white, orange, and even brown.
text: 直视太阳是危险的，但我们仍然可以注意到它的变化。根据天气和时间的不同，太阳可能呈现出发光的黄色、炽热的白色、橙色，甚至是棕色。

SourceText: What do you do during the day that you can't do at night?
text: 什么事情是你白天可以做而晚上做不了的？

SourceText: The story mentioned farmers working, people going to market, and children going to school. What other adult things only happen when the sun is out?
text: 故事提到了农民劳作，人们去市场，孩子们去上学。除此之外，还有哪些成年人的事情只有在太阳出来的时候才能做？

SourceText: The sun returned to Sunland. Aku made it. A new day began ...
text: 太阳回到了太阳岛。是阿酷做到了这一点。一个新日子开始了......

SourceText: Why did Aku kick the ball into the sky? Did she do it to make the sun come out, or did she do it for some other reason?
text: 阿库为什么把球踢向天空？她是为了让太阳出来吗，还是出于其他原因？

SourceText: The sun was Aku's only friend. She paid the sun a lot of attention, and the sun stayed with her without making fun of her long legs. Which things do you think make friendships work?
text: 太阳是阿库唯一的朋友。她非常关注太阳，而太阳也陪伴着她，没有嘲笑她的长腿。你认为哪些因素使友谊长久保持？

SourceText: Sometimes, when some experience bothers two friends, it can get between them so they can't see each other. Has that happened to you with one of your friends? Did you find a way to fix things?
text: 有时候，当一些经历困扰两个朋友时，它可能会成为阻碍，使他们无法看到彼此。你和你的朋友有过这样的经历吗？你找到了解决问题的办法吗？

SourceText: Once upon a time on a little farm near a little village.
text: 从前，在一个小村庄附近有一个小农场。

SourceText: Farms can grow crops and raise animals, such as chickens. What are some things on a farm that you are curious about?
text: 农场可以种植农作物，养育动物，比如小鸡。你对农场上的哪些事物感到好奇？

SourceText: There are some groups of three things here. What do you see?
text: 这里有三个组。你看到什么了？

SourceText: What are the different things these chickens are doing?
text: 这些小鸡都在做不同的事情。它们在做什么？

SourceText: There lived a little chicken called Daisy.
text: 这里住着一只叫黛西的小母鸡。

SourceText: Count together the claws that Daisy has on each leg and all together.
text: 一起数数黛西每只腿上的爪子数目和总共数目。

SourceText: Daisy's claws spread out to help her balance. How long can you balance on one leg?
text: 黛西让爪子张开来帮助她保持平衡。你可以单脚站立多久？

SourceText: Can you balance on one leg long enough to count to five? To ten?
text: 你可以单脚站立长并数到五吗？十呢？

SourceText: "When I grow up, I want to fly high, high into the sky," Daisy said.
text: “当我长大了, 我想飞到高高的天空。” 黛西说。

SourceText: Count together all the circles on their faces. Don't forget to count the pupils in the middle of the eyes.
text: 一起数他们脸上的圆圈数目。别忘了数眼睛中间的瞳孔。

SourceText: How can you tell that the other chickens are not as happy as Daisy?
text: 你怎么知道其他小鸡不像黛西那么开心？

SourceText: What are these other chicken's thinking?
text: 其他小鸡在想什么呢？

SourceText: But all the other chickens laughed at her.
text: 但其他的小鸡都在嘲笑她。

SourceText: Their eyes are now closed. We close our eyes when we are asleep and at other times. Why are these chicken's eyes closed?
text: 现在它们眼睛闭上了。我们睡觉时还有其他时候会闭上眼睛。这些鸡为什么闭着眼睛？

SourceText: Sometimes people laugh AT other people, and sometimes they laugh WITH other people. What is the difference?
text: 有时候人们嘲笑别人，有时候他们和别人一起笑。区别是什么？

SourceText: Do you think the shape of the big cloud looks like their mouths?
text: 你认为云朵的形状看起来像它们的嘴巴吗？

SourceText: "You are so weird," they said. "We won't play with you anymore."
text: “你真奇怪，”他们说。“我们不和你玩了。”

SourceText: Now that their mouths have changed, do you think the cloud changed shape too?
text: 现在它们的嘴巴变了，你觉得云也改变了形状吗？

SourceText: Can you use your mouth to copy the shape of each chicken's mouth? Can you guess and copy the sound each chicken is making?
text: 你可以用嘴模仿每只鸡嘴巴的形状吗？你可以猜测并模仿每只鸡发出的声音吗？

SourceText: Why are they calling Daisy a mean name?
text: 为什么他们给黛西一个不好的绰号？

SourceText: "Daisy, we can all flap our wings, but it's very difficult for chickens to fly," Mama told her.
text: “黛西, 我们都可以拍打翅膀，但鸡飞翔非常困难，” 妈妈告诉她。

SourceText: Discuss what is similar about Daisy and her mother, and how they look different from the other chickens.
text: 讨论黛西和她妈妈的相似之处，以及她们和其他鸡的不同之处。

SourceText: What is Daisy's mother doing to help Daisy feel better?
text: 黛西妈妈在做什么来帮助黛西感觉好一点？

SourceText: Sometimes we feel better when someone pats us or holds our hand. Have you ever tried to help a friend feel better with a friendly touch?
text: 有时候当有人拍拍我们或握着我们的手时，我们会感觉好一些。你试过用友好的接触来帮助一个朋友感觉好一些吗？

SourceText: Daisy wouldn't give up. Every day she practiced by herself, flapping her wings. Flap, flap, flap, she would flap her wings but she couldn't lift off the ground.
text: 黛西不会放弃。每天她自己练习，扇动翅膀。拍，拍，拍，她会拍打翅膀，但她无法离开地面。

SourceText: So far, this is a sad story for Daisy. Make up your own ending. Is it a happy or sad ending?
text: 到目前为止, 对黛西来说这是一个悲伤的故事。想出你自己的结局。是快乐还是悲伤的结局？

SourceText: Is Daisy too heavy to fly? Think of something that is as heavy as Daisy looks. Do you think that thing is too heavy to fly?
text: 黛西太重不能飞吗？想想和黛西一样重的东西。你认为那些东西太重不能飞？

SourceText: A rectangle is a shape with four straight sides and corners like the corners of this page. Although they are slanted, find and point to the many rectangles on this page.
text: 矩形是一种形状，有四条直边和像这页边角的角。虽然倾斜, 找并指出这页上的许多矩形。

SourceText: While she practiced, she imagined herself flying high into the sky and looking at the chickens below. She imagined herself flying past the sparrows and past the swallows. "Wow!" The birds would say, "A chicken that can fly!"
text: 当她练习时, 她想象自己飞到高高的天空, 往下看鸡。她想象自己飞过麻雀, 飞过燕子。“哇！” 鸟会说，“一只会飞的鸡！”

SourceText: Count together the birds in this picture. Don't forget the ones on the ground.
text: 一起数这幅画中的鸟数目。别忘了地上的。

SourceText: What effect is caused by having some of the birds drawn so small?
text: 把一些鸟画的这么小有什么效果？

SourceText: Describe a memory of looking at something big that was far away and looked tiny.
text: 描述一下看遥远的大物体看起来很小的记忆。

SourceText: So flap, flap, flap, every day Daisy would flap her wings.
text: 所以拍，拍，拍，每天黛西都会扇动翅膀。

SourceText: Count together the little lines coming from Daisy showing her squawking.
text: 数一起从黛西身体冒出的小线条数目，这表示她在叫。

SourceText: Daisy has too many red speckles to count, but you can count together the groups of speckles all over her body.
text: 黛西身上的红色斑点太多数不完，但你可以一起数她身体上斑点组数。

SourceText: Daisy looks surprised. What do you think will happen next?
text: 黛西看起来很惊讶。你认为接下来会发生什么？

SourceText: She would lift off the ground but fall down again.
text: 她会离开地面但又落下。

SourceText: How high do you think she got? A grownup is often 5 to 6 feet tall -- do you think she got that high?
text: 你认为她飞多高了？成人通常有5到6英尺高 -- 你认为她飞那样高了吗？

SourceText: How many lines are there above her and below her? When you combine them, how many are there in all?
text: 她上面和下面有多少线？加在一起总共有多少？

SourceText: What do the lines below her show?
text: 下面的线表示什么？

SourceText: "I'm never going to fly!" Daisy cried to Mama. "The others are right."
text: “我永远也飞不起来！” 黛西对妈妈哭诉。“其他人都对了。”

SourceText: Describe some times when you got discouraged like Daisy.
text: 描述你像黛西一样灰心丧气的时刻。

SourceText: Daisy is trying the same thing over and over. Is she showing strong will or is she being stubbornly foolish?
text: 黛西一次次重复同样的事。这显示她有坚强的意志，还是说她顽固愚蠢？

SourceText: What new ideas might Daisy try to figure out how to fly?
text: 黛西可以尝试什么新想法来弄明白如何飞行？

SourceText: "Daisy, you are different from the other chickens. They don't want to fly but you do! You can do it." Mama said.
text: “黛西, 你和其他鸡不一样。他们不想飞，但你想！你可以的。”妈妈说。

SourceText: How can you tell from Daisy's face that she is getting a new idea?
text: 从黛西的脸上你怎么看出她有了新想法？

SourceText: Think of a problem you solved by coming up with a new way to do it after the old way kept failing.
text: 想想你通过在旧的方式持续失败后想出新的办法解决过的问题。

SourceText: Daisy's body is made up of pairs of things, such as her eyes, and single things, such as her tail. Name all the pairs you can and then all the singles you can.
text: 黛西的身体由成对的东西组成，比如她的眼睛，以及单个的东西，比如她的尾巴。叫出你能叫出的所有成对的和所有单个的部位。

SourceText: The following day Daisy climbed to the top of the chicken coop and flap, flap, flap, she flapped her wings. She flew into the air and flapped her wings and flapped her wings and flapped her wings and ...
text: 第二天, 黛西爬到鸡舍顶部，拍，拍，拍，她扇动翅膀。她飞向空中扇动翅膀，扇动翅膀，扇动翅膀，并且…

SourceText: There are lots of straight lines here. Some are vertical -- they go up and down. Some are horizontal -- they go side to side. Find some vertical and horizontal lines where you are.
text: 这里有很多直线。有些是垂直的 -- 上下走。有些是水平的 -- 左右走。找一些你周围的垂直和水平线。

SourceText: What do the curved lines next to Daisy's body indicate?
text: 黛西身体旁的曲线表示什么？

SourceText: Daisy's face is very expressive. What does her face show this time?
text: 黛西的表情非常丰富。这次她的表情表现了什么？

SourceText: BAM!
text: 砰！

SourceText: How is Daisy feeling right now?
text: 黛西现在感觉如何?

SourceText: What is the other chicken doing?
text: 其他鸡在做什么?

SourceText: A kind and thoughtful chicken might go over and console and cheer Daisy up. Why isn't this chicken doing that?
text: 一只善良体贴的鸡可能过去安慰和鼓励黛西。为什么这只鸡不这么做?

SourceText: The other chickens laughed out loud. "Ha ha ha! We told you! Chickens can't fly!"
text: 其他鸡大声笑起来。“哈哈哈！我们告诉过你！鸡不能飞！”

SourceText: There is one thick vertical line in this picture. Do you see any other vertical or horizontal lines?
text: 这幅画中有一条粗的垂直线。你看到其他垂直或水平线吗?

SourceText: Is the laughing chicken walking or running? How can you tell?
text: 笑的鸡在走路还是跑步？你是怎么判断的？

SourceText: Do you think Daisy will give up after this bad fall? When you have a failure, is it hard for you to keep trying?
text: 在这次失败后, 你认为黛西会放弃吗？当你失败时，再次尝试对你来说难吗？

SourceText: But the next day Daisy climbed even higher, right up to the top of the hut. Flap, flap, flap, Daisy flapped her wings.
text: 但是到了第二天，黛西爬得更高，直接爬到茅棚的顶端。拍，拍，拍，黛西扇动着翅膀。

SourceText: Daisy is determined. Can you think of a time when you kept trying even after several failures?
text: 黛西很坚决。你能想起即使失败多次仍然不断尝试的时刻吗？

SourceText: Daisy is trying to solve her problem. What have been some of her new ideas for this problem?
text: 黛西正在尝试解决她的问题。她对这个问题的一些新想法是什么？

SourceText: Why did they show Daisy twice in this picture? Why does Daisy look big and the other chickens look so small?
text: 为什么在这幅画中画了两次黛西？为什么黛西看起来很，其他鸡看起来很小？

SourceText: She flew into the air and flapped her wings and flapped her wings and flapped her wings and ...
text: 她飞向空中，拍打翅膀，拍打翅膀，拍打翅膀，并且...

SourceText: At last, Daisy is successful! How does that make you feel? It feels good to share the successes of others.
text: 终于，黛西成功了！这让你感觉如何？分享他人的成功感觉很好。

SourceText: How can you tell from the drawing that she is flying upward?
text: 从图画上你怎么看出她正在向上飞？

SourceText: Look at the movement lines drawn around her body. How are the movement lines in this picture different from the ones on the last page?
text: 看围绕她身体的运动线。这页的运动线和上一页相比有什么不同？

SourceText: She kept flying! The wind beneath her wings grew stronger and she flew higher and higher! The sparrows and the swallows said, "Amazing! A flying chicken!"
text: 她继续飞翔！她翅膀下的风越来越强，她飞得越来越！! 麻雀和燕子说：“太神奇了！一只会飞的鸡！”

SourceText: How does Daisy's flying body look different from the other birds in the sky?
text: 和天空中的其他鸟相比，黛西飞行的身体看起来有什么不同？

SourceText: How is Daisy feeling now that all of her hard work has paid off?
text: 黛西感觉怎样，因为她的辛勤工作终于得到了回报？

SourceText: What are the other chickens thinking now?
text: 其他小鸡现在在想什么？

SourceText: And the other chickens wanted to be just like her.
text: 其他小鸡都想变得和她一样。

SourceText: Use your arms to copy the positions of the wings of these chickens.
text: 用你的手臂模仿这些鸡翅膀的位置。

SourceText: What are these chickens feeling now that Daisy is successful?
text: 现在黛西成功了，其他鸡感觉怎样？

SourceText: Do you think the other chickens will learn to fly someday?
text: 你认为其他鸡有朝一日也会学会飞翔吗？

SourceText: They said, "Oh Daisy, you're amazing!"
text: 它们说：“哦, 黛西, 你太棒了！”

SourceText: What happens next in Daisy's story after this book?
text: 在这本书之后，你觉得黛西的故事会怎么继续？

SourceText: Have you ever wished that you could fly?
text: 你曾经希望自己会飞吗？

SourceText: Where would you go if you could fly? What would you like to look at if you could get way up in the sky above it?
text: 如果你可以飞的话，你会去哪里？如果你可以飞到空中很高的地方看下面，你会想看什么？

SourceText: Once upon a time, in Joburg's Orange Grove, a little girl called Phyllis was born into the world. Two people in love, hugged their sweet little babe. No one knew then, what a dancer they'd made.
text: 从前，在约翰内斯堡的奥兰治格罗夫，一个叫菲丽丝的小女孩出生了。两位相爱的人紧紧拥抱着他们可爱的小宝贝。当时没有人知道，他们培养了一位多么出色的舞蹈家。

SourceText: There are three people here. Which one is the smallest? Count their eyes together. If there are three people, how many eyes will they have?
text: 这里有三个人。其中哪一个是最小的？将他们的眼睛加在一起来数。如果有三个人，他们一共会有多少只眼睛？

SourceText: There are some circles and partial circles in this picture. Partial circles are called arcs. Point to some of the arcs and make an arc with your arms.
text: 这张图片上有一些圆圈和部分圆圈，部分圆圈被称为弧。指出其中一些弧，然后用你的手臂画出一个弧。

SourceText: This story is a biography -- it is a true story about the life of a real person. Pick a person you know and tell a biography story about them -- talk about their family and some things they have done.
text: 这个故事是一篇传记——讲述一个真实人物的真实经历。选择一个你认识的人，讲述他们的传记故事——谈论他们的家庭和一些他们已经做过的事情。

SourceText: By the time she was four, she had learned very quick. She impressed all her teachers, with her ducky feet flicks! Before school and after, she danced every day. Nothing pleased Phyllis, more than ballet.
text: 在菲丽丝四岁的时候，她学东西非常快。她用她灵巧的脚步使所有的老师们印象深刻! 在上学前和放学后，她每天都跳舞。没有什么能比芭蕾舞更能让菲丽丝开心了。

SourceText: This story has lots of words that rhyme -- the ends of the words sound the same. On each page, find some of the rhyming words.
text: 你是否有一件你喜欢做的事情，尽管它需要付出艰苦的努力？

SourceText: Phyllis' face looks full of joy! What do you think she is feeling as she dances?
text: 菲丽丝的脸上写满了快乐！你认为她在跳舞时感受到了什么样的情感？

SourceText: Think of a time when you were moving that made you feel such joy. Perhaps you were running, dancing, jumping, or riding a bike.
text: 想想你曾经有过什么运动让你感到非常快乐。也许你在奔跑、跳舞、跳跃或骑自行车的时候。

SourceText: When the world was ready for Phyllis at fifteen, she arrived in big, old London, ready to live her dream. She said goodbye to all her friends. She was ready to start fresh. Watch out Royal Ballet School! Phyllis is here to impress.
text: 当菲丽丝15岁的时候, 她准备好面对这个世界了，她来到了伦敦这座古老的大城市，准备追逐她的梦想。她向所有的朋友告别，准备开始新的生活。皇家芭蕾舞学院，准备好欢迎菲丽丝的到来吧！她会给你们留下深刻的印象。

SourceText: In a real sky, there are too many stars to count. Point to the stars in this picture as you count them.
text: 在真实的天空中，星星多得数不过来。当你数星星的时候，指着图片中的星星。

SourceText: A rectangle is a shape with four straight sides like this page. Find all the rectangles on this page. Point to all the rectangles around where you are.
text: 矩形是一个有四条直边的形状，就像这一页一样。找出这张纸上的所有矩形。用手指指出你所在位置周围的所有矩形。

SourceText: It takes 11 hours to fly from Johannesburg in the south of Africa to London on the western side of Europe. Compare that to how long it takes to go to the store or to visit a friend or relative. Which of these is shortest and which is longest?
text: 从南非的约翰内斯堡飞往欧洲西部的伦敦需要11个小时。将这段时间与去商店购物或拜访朋友或亲戚所需的时间相比。哪一个最短，哪一个最长？

SourceText: When Phyllis danced Swan Lake, it was fit to show the Queen! After years of pirouetting, she was ready to be seen. Dancing for the audience, she turned and twirled about. Look! Everyone is smiling! See how they clap and shout!
text: 当菲丽丝跳《天鹅湖》时，那场演出堪称是为女王而准备的！经过多年的脚尖舞，她已经准备好展现给观众。为观众跳舞，她转身旋转。看！每个人都在微笑！看他们如何鼓掌和欢呼！

SourceText: Body position is important in ballet. Notice the male dancer's upper arm and opposite leg point in opposite directions almost making a straight, diagonal line.
text: 在芭蕾中，身体的姿势非常重要。请注意男舞者的上臂和另一侧的腿几乎呈相反方向，几乎形成一条直的对角线。

SourceText: Notice how Phyllis' legs almost make a straight line. Can you make a straight line with your arms or legs?
text: 请注意菲丽丝的腿几乎呈一条直线。你能用你的手臂或腿做成一条直线吗？

SourceText: Phyllis has become a very good dancer at this point in the story. What do you think will happen next? Make your own version of the second half of this story.
text: 在故事的这一部分，菲丽丝已经成为了一位非常出色的舞者。你认为接下来会发生什么？创作你自己的版本，来讲述这个故事的下半部分。

SourceText: From Mexico to Canada. From the USA to France. Phyllis travelled far and wide, so the world could see her dance. With the Royal Ballet Company, and her ballerina friends, she spread her love for ballet. She never wanted it to end.
text: 从墨西哥到加拿大，从美国到法国。菲丽丝周游世界，让全世界都能看到她的舞蹈。在皇家芭蕾团和她的芭蕾舞者朋友们一起，她传播着对芭蕾的热爱。她永不希望它结束。

SourceText: Do you see a diagonal line in Phyllis' body position? Trace that line with your finger.
text: 你看到菲丽丝的身体姿势中有一条对角线吗？用手指跟随那条线。

SourceText: There are lots of rectangles in this picture. Point to as many as you can and count them together.
text: 这张图片中有很多矩形。尽量多地指出并一起数数。

SourceText: Some of the rectangles are flags on the bottom of Phyllis' dress. What are the colors on those flags? Do you recognize the flag of any country you know?
text: 一些矩形是菲丽丝裙子底部的旗帜。那些旗帜上的颜色是什么？你认出其中任何一个国家的旗帜吗？

SourceText: Phyllis always knew, that dance was in her heart. But she longed to return home again, and make a fresh new start. So she leaped and bounded, back to her beautiful land. Her ballerina roots were regrown. She was once more South African.
text: 菲丽丝一直知道，舞蹈深植于她的内心。但她渴望重返家园，开始崭新的生活。于是她跃然腾空，回到了她美丽的土地。她的芭蕾根基重新生长，她再次成为南非人。

SourceText: Phyllis has the flag of South Africa. How many colors are on this flag? Can you see some of those colors where you are?
text: 菲丽丝手中拿着南非国旗。这面国旗上有多少种颜色？你能在你周围看到这些颜色吗？

SourceText: Point to the triangle on the flag. What shape is the green region on the flag?
text: 指出国旗上的三角形。这面旗帜上的绿色区域是什么形状？

SourceText: Have you ever traveled away from home? Was it exciting to be away, or did you miss your home?
text: 你曾经离开过你的家吗？远离家乡是令人兴奋的，还是令你想念家呢?

SourceText: Dancing wasn't just for fun, as Phyllis always knew. She'd work at dancing day and night, and with hard work she grew. Always smiling, always trying, through good times and through tough, Phyllis always did her best. She couldn't get enough.
text: 跳舞不仅仅是娱乐，菲丽丝一直知道这一点。她日以继夜地努力练舞，通	过努力来获得进步。她总是微笑着，总是尝试着，无论是美好的时光还是艰难的时刻，菲丽丝总是尽力而为。她总是追求更多。

SourceText: Phyllis' legs are at a right angle to each other -- they make an angle like the corner of this page. Make a right angle with your arms or legs.
text: 菲丽丝的腿之间的形状是直角——它们的角度就像本页的页角。用你的手臂或腿也做一个直角。

SourceText: Phyllis and her partner are performing in this picture. How can you tell?
text: 这张图片中，菲丽丝和她的舞伴正在表演。你怎么看出来的？

SourceText: Have you ever worked really hard at something? How did you feel about doing that?
text: 你是否也曾在某件事上付出过巨大努力？那种感觉是怎样的？

SourceText: Romeo and Juliet, Swan Lake and Giselle. Phyllis danced these for the people: graceful, tireless, well. With partners Gary Burne and Eduard Greyling too, her magnificence inspired the audience. To her, flowers they threw.
text: 罗密欧与朱丽叶，天鹅湖和吉赛尔。菲丽丝为人们跳这些舞蹈：她优雅、不知疲倦、出色。与搭档加里·伯恩和爱德华·格雷林一起，她娴熟优雅的演出激发了观众的灵感。观众向她抛洒鲜花。

SourceText: Phyllis' body is pictured inside a clock. Go around the clock saying and pointing at each number.
text: 菲丽丝的身体被如同一个时钟。沿着时钟指向并说出每个数字。

SourceText: The numbers on the clock increase from 1 to 12 in what is called the clockwise direction.
text: 时钟的数字按顺时针方向从1增加到12。

SourceText: Each of Phyllis' hands and feet point at a number. What are they?
text: 菲丽丝的每只手和脚指向一个数字。它们分别是什么？

SourceText: Reward comes easily, when you put yourself to the test. Phyllis came to realize this, once she was called 'The Best.' She was awarded 'Prima Ballerina Assoluta.' The greatest dancer of them all! Phyllis would be forever known. She wanted nothing more.
text: 当你勇于让自己接受考验时，奖励会轻而易举地到来。菲丽丝一度被誉为'最好'，她就认识到了这一点。她被授予了'普里玛芭蕾女王'的荣誉称号。她是所有舞者中好的！菲丽丝将永远被人铭记。她再无他愿。

SourceText: The story rhymes "test" with "best." It doesn't rhyme any word with "more." Think of some words that rhyme with "more."
text: 菲丽斯通过她的努力成为了最优秀的芭蕾舞者之一。对你来说，成为你喜欢做的事情中的佼佼者有多重要？

SourceText: She is standing on her toes. Ballerinas wear special shoes, toe shoes, to help them do that.
text: 她正在用脚尖站立。芭蕾舞者穿特制的芭蕾舞鞋以帮助她们完成这种动作。

SourceText: If you try to stand on your toes, do your toes curl under? It is very hard to be on your toes.
text: 如果你试用脚尖站立，你的脚趾会不会弯曲？用脚尖站立是非常困难的。

SourceText: Goodness! What a catch! Phyllis met her loving partner. His name was Phillip Boyd. He was another dancer. Together they were married. And together they would dance. No one could be better matched, given half the chance!
text: 天哪！多么美好的相遇！菲丽丝遇到了她深爱的伴侣。他的名字叫菲利普·博伊德。他也是一名舞者。他们一起结婚了。而且他们将一起跳舞。不会有比他们更般配的伴侣了！

SourceText: The word "catch" has two meanings here. A ballerina might leap or spin and her partner would catch her. It can also mean that romantic partners catch each other and become a couple.
text: 这里“catch”一词有两层意思。芭蕾舞者可能会跳跃或旋转, 而她的伴侣会接住她。它也可以意味着罗曼蒂克的伴侣互相“遇见”，成为一对。

SourceText: There are a lot of red flowers. How many do you see?
text: 这里有很多红色的花朵。你看到多少朵？

SourceText: The green leaves are in the shape of a heart. Which side of the heart has more red flowers?
text: 绿叶形成一个心形。心形的哪一边有更多红花？

SourceText: Though they had no children, Phyllis and Phillip were never sad. The two of them found another way to help other Mums and Dads. They started Dance for All, a special school for dance. So that children with no money, could also learn to prance!
text: 虽然菲丽丝和菲利普没有孩子，但他们从未对此感到伤心。这对伴侣找到了另一种方式来帮助其他的爸爸妈妈。他们创立了名为“舞蹈为众”的舞蹈学校，这样，即使没有钱的孩子也能学会跳舞！

SourceText: How many arms and legs can you count all together in this picture?
text: 在这张图片中，你能一共数到多少只手和腿？

SourceText: Phyllis and Phillip helped children learn to dance even when their families couldn't pay. It's a good feeling helping others.
text: 菲丽丝和菲利普帮助孩子们学习跳舞，即使他们的家庭无法支付。帮助他人会有一种美好的感觉。

SourceText: Have you ever helped a person or animal that needed something? Even little things count, like opening a door or sharing some food. How did you feel?
text: 你是否曾经帮助过那些需要帮助的人或动物？即使是小事也很重要，比如打开一扇门或者和他们分享食物。你当时感觉怎么样？

SourceText: She left a legacy of dance, and incredible success. Her magic was passed on to others to help them become their best. Her students spread across the world, inspired by her ducky feet. They dance on while we watch, dreaming from our seats.
text: 她留下了舞蹈的遗产和令人难以置信的成功。她的热情传递给了其他人，帮助他们变得更好。她的学生遍布全球，受到她那双灵活的舞步的启发。当我们坐着观看时, 他们继续跳舞, 我们则在座位上幻想。

SourceText: How many dancers do you see here? Don't forget to count Phyllis.
text: 在这里你看到多少舞者？不要忘记数菲丽丝。

SourceText: Describe all the different body positions you see. Make some of these shapes with your body.
text: 描述一下你看到的不同的身体姿势。试试用你的身体做出其中一些形状。

SourceText: Ballet is not a sport. However, dancers are athletes, and they form a team, and their teachers are like coaches. Did this story make you want to become a dancer?
text: 芭蕾舞不是一项体育运动。然而，舞者是运动员，他们组成一个团队，他们的老师就像教练。这个故事是否让你也想成为一名舞者？

SourceText: One special Friday, Yusuf's father gets dressed before a flicker of light brightens the sky. He pulls on his heavy weather-proof jacket and the green woolen cap that covers his ears. He waves his boy goodbye. Yusuf's eyes brighten when Papa says, "Today is the day I will catch a fish and bring a gift for you."
text: 在一个特别的星期五，约瑟夫的爸爸在一丝光亮照亮天空之前就穿好了衣服。他穿上了厚实的防风外套和绿色的毛线帽子，遮住了他的耳朵。他向儿子挥手告别。当爸爸说：“今天是我会钓鱼并给你带礼物的日子”时，约瑟夫的眼睛闪亮了起来。

SourceText: His father got up while it was still dark. Daylight starts much earlier in the day during the summer than in the winter.
text: 他的父亲在天还很黑的时候就起床了。在夏季，白天开始得比冬季早得多。

SourceText: Have you gotten up while it was still dark? Was it in summer or in winter?
text: 你有没有在天还很黑的时候起床过？是在夏季还是冬季？

SourceText: What do you think the gift will be?
text: 你认为这个礼物会是什么？

SourceText: A fish and a gift? Oh, what will it be? Papa cycles down to Muizenberg Beach. Squeak squeak go the wheels all the way to Surfer's Corner. Gulls circle the sky. "Whaaat? Whaaat? Whaaat?" they cry. "What will you bring back for Yusuf?" Papa rings his bell. "Wait and see what it will be!"
text: 一条鱼和一件礼物？哦，会是什么呢？爸爸骑车前往慕尼兹堡海滩。车轮“吱吱”吱吱地一路转向冲浪者角。海鸥在天空盘旋。“咿呀！咿呀！咿呀！”它们叫道。“你要给约瑟夫带回什么呢？”爸爸拨动车铃。“等着瞧，会是什么！”

SourceText: Papa is riding downhill to the beach. Going downhill he might end up going faster and faster. He might need to use his brakes so he doesn't go into the water!
text: 爸爸正在下坡骑车去海滩。下坡的时候，他可能会越来越快。他可能需要使用刹车，以免掉进水里！

SourceText: How many gulls do you see? If you take away the one gull on the beach, how many are left?
text: 你看到了多少只海鸥？如果去掉沙滩上的那只海鸥，还剩下多少只？

SourceText: The gulls in the sky sound like they are asking Papa questions. What do you think they are doing as they are circling in the sky?
text: 天空中的海鸥听起来好像在问爸爸问题。你认为它们在天空中盘旋的时候在做什么？

SourceText: The fishermen watch the sun rise. They check their nets. They check their oars. They listen to the wind. They drag their boats down to the water. Yusuf's grandfather, Oupa Salie was a treknet fisherman. Before him his father, Oupagrootjie Ridwaan, knew the sea too.
text: 渔夫们观看着太阳升起。他们检查渔网，检查桨，聆听风声。他们把船拖到水边。约瑟夫的祖父，奥巴·萨里，是一名跋网渔夫。在他之前，他的父亲，奥巴格鲁特杰·里德万也熟知大海。

SourceText: In this view, the line where the sea meets the sky is called the horizon. A horizontal line is like the horizon line, it goes straight across from side to side. Point out some horizontal lines near you.
text: 在这个视野中，大海与天空相交的那条线被称为地平线。水平线就像地平线一样，从一边直通到另一边。指出你附近的一些水平线。

SourceText: Yusuf's father, grandfather, and great-grandfather were all fishermen. Do you know anyone who does the same job as one of their parents?
text: 约瑟夫的父亲、祖父和曾祖父都是渔夫。你认识有人与他们的父母从事相同职业的吗？

SourceText: People are many different ages. Suppose Papa is 25, Papa's father is 50, and Papa's grandfather is 75. How old are you? How many years until you are 25?
text: 人们有各种年龄。假设爸爸今年25岁，爸爸的父亲50岁，爸爸的祖父75岁。你多大了？还有多少年才到25岁？

SourceText: The boat rides into the waves. Papa's arms stretch to the oar. His leg braces against the side. His neck strains, his back muscles ripple. Papa sings as he works: "Drop and swish. Find a fish. Pull and plop. Don't you stop."
text: 小船冲进海浪中。爸爸伸手够桨。他的腿抵住船边。他的脖子绷紧, 后背的肌肉起伏波动。爸爸一边工作一边唱着：“落下又荡起，找到一条鱼，拉起又扔下，永远不要停。”

SourceText: People sit backwards in rowboats when they row. The pointed end of this boat is much higher than the flat end -- it looks like a pretty rough ride!
text: 人们在划船时常常坐在船尾，划船时面朝后方。这艘船的尖端比平坦的一端高得多，看起来会是一次相当颠簸的航行！

SourceText: Papa's muscles are working very hard. Have you ever felt your muscles strain trying to lift or pull something?
text: 爸爸的肌肉正非常努力地工作着。你是否也曾感觉到肌肉因为试图提起或拉动某物而绷紧过？

SourceText: The words "fish" and "swish" rhyme. Think of some other words that rhyme with those words (dish, wish, squish).
text: 两个人用桨划船前行。第三个人握着一根长条木杆伸入水中。这被称为舵，它可以引导船朝着正确的方向行驶。

SourceText: All day long Yusuf looks at the sky. It is bright and clear and windless. A fish and a gift! What will Papa bring home from the sea? Sometimes he brings a beautiful shell. Sometimes he brings a jewel green bottle rinsed by the waves.
text: 一整天，约瑟夫一直看着天空。天空明亮而晴朗，没有风。一条鱼和一个礼物！爸爸会从海上带回什么呢？有时他会带回一个美丽的贝壳，有时他会带回被海浪冲刷过的翡翠绿色的瓶子。

SourceText: Yusuf has many gifts. There is a connection between one of his gifts and something outside the window -- can you figure out what it is?
text: 约瑟夫有很多礼物。其中一个礼物与窗外的某物有联系，你能猜出是什么吗？

SourceText: Count together all the horizontal lines in this picture.
text: 数一数这幅图片中的所有水平线。

SourceText: Which horizontal line is the longest?
text: 哪一条水平线最长？

SourceText: Some days Yusuf's father brings a story. Like the time they found sea turtles on the sand, hundreds washed up in a storm. "Whaaat? Whaaat? Whaaat?" cried the gulls. "What will you do to help the turtles?" Papa said, "We saved those turtles, I tell you straight. We sent them back to the ocean, every last one."
text: 有时候约瑟夫的父亲会带回一个故事。比如有一次他们在沙滩上发现海龟，数以百计的海龟被风暴冲上岸。 “咿呀! 咿呀! 咿呀!”海鸥叫道，“你要怎么帮助这些海龟？” 爸爸说：“我跟你说, 我们救了那些海龟，把每一只都送回大海了。”

SourceText: Sea turtles come out of the sea to lay eggs on the shore. Every turtle has four flippers. How many flippers do you see?
text: 海龟会从海里爬上岸产卵。每只海龟有四只鳍。你看到了多少只鳍？

SourceText: Can you skip count by 4's to figure out how many flippers these turtles have?
text: 你能以每4个为一个单位来计算这些海龟一共有多少只鳍吗？

SourceText: A grown turtle can weigh up to 100 pounds. These turtles probably weigh 10 pounds each. Skip count by 10's to see how much these turtles weigh all together.
text: 一只成年海龟的重量可以达到100磅。这些海龟可能每只重约10磅。你能10为一个单位来数数看这些海龟一共有多重吗？

SourceText: Always Papa brings a song. He sings the song while he pulls the oars. He sings the song while he pulls the nets. He sings the song as he winds the ropes. He sings the song as he cycles home. "Drop and swish. Find a fish. Pull and plop. Don't you stop."
text: 爸爸总是带着一首歌。他一边划桨，一边唱着这首歌。他一边拉网，一边唱着这首歌。他一边绕绳，一边唱着这首歌。他一边骑车回家，一边唱着这首歌：“落下又荡起，找到一条鱼，拉起又扔下，永远不要停。”

SourceText: People often sing or hum as they do something. Do you do this?
text: 人们常常在做事情时唱歌或哼曲子。你是否也这样做过？

SourceText: It is hard work pulling a wet fishing net out of the water. How many fishermen are pulling? Do they all pull together or take turns?
text: 将湿漉漉的渔网从水中拉出来是一项很辛苦的工作。有多少渔夫在拉网？他们是一起拉还是轮流？

SourceText: Are there more gulls or fishermen in this picture? How many more?
text: 在这张图片中，海鸥和渔夫哪个更多？多了多少？

SourceText: Ouma Safiya wants a nice fat yellowtail for her supper. "But we'll be lucky if they catch even a tiny crab. More likely it will be fish tail Friday. There's not so many fish left in the sea," says Ouma shaking her head. Yusuf holds Ouma's hand. They cross the road at the bathing cabins. "Whaaat? Whaaat? Whaaat?" cry the gulls perched on the bright rooftops. "What is for supper?"
text: 奶奶莎菲亚想要一条肥美的黄尾鱼作为晚餐。 “但我们能抓到一条小小的螃蟹就算走运了。估计又要吃鱼尾巴做周五晚餐了。海里的鱼已经所剩无几了。”奶奶一边摇头一边说。约瑟夫握着奶奶的手，他们在海滨小屋处过马路。“咿呀！咿呀！咿呀！”栖息在明亮屋顶上的海鸥叫道。“晚餐吃什么？”

SourceText: Ouma means grandmother. Do you have favorite names for people you are close to?
text: “奶奶”意思就是祖母。你对亲近的人有常用的昵称吗？

SourceText: The people and the seagulls want the same things for dinner -- maybe a yellowtail or a crab. How many different kinds of fish do you know?
text: 人们和海鸥都希望晚餐能有相同的东西——也许是黄尾鱼或螃蟹。你知道多少种不同的鱼？

SourceText: A rectangle is a shape with four straight sides like this page. The doors and roofs of the buildings are rectangles. How many rectangles do you see in this picture? How many rectangles do you see where you are?
text: 矩形是一种四条边都是直线的形状，就像这页纸。建筑物的门和屋顶是矩形的。你在图片中看到多少个矩形？你在周围看到多少个矩形？

SourceText: Last year the fishermen fought with the surfers. Angry fists and shouting words. "Whaaat? Whaaat? Whaaat?" cried the gulls. "There's enough sea for everybody," said Yusuf's father. He showed them the fishing license that had been Oupa Salie's. "Waves for all. Water for free."
text: 去年, 渔夫与冲浪者发生争执。愤怒的拳头和大声的话语。“咿呀！咿呀！咿呀！”海鸥叫道。“海洋足够大家分享，”约瑟夫的父亲说。他拿出了属于萨利祖父的渔业许可证。“浪花无边, 海水免费。”

SourceText: What were the fishermen and surfers arguing about? What bad things might happen if they are in the same place?
text: 渔夫和冲浪者为什么争吵？如果他们在同一地方，可能发生什么坏事？

SourceText: People have disagreements, and then they find ways to resolve them. Think of a disagreement you had with someone. How did you solve that problem?
text: 人们之间会发生分歧，然后找到解决方法。想想你曾经与某人发生争执的情况。你是如何解决这个问题的？

SourceText: What feelings do you have when you get into an argument with someone?
text: 当你与某人发生争论时，你会有什么感觉？

SourceText: Ouma Safiya watches through her binoculars, her fingers curled in curiosity. The shark siren sounds. Swimmers run back to the sand and grab their towels. Surfers rush to the shore, carrying their boards under their arms. Under the showers they strip off their wetsuits. "Whaaat? Whaaat? Whaaat?" cry the gulls. "What will Yusuf's father bring from the ocean?"
text: 莎菲亚奶奶透过双筒望远镜观察，她的手指充满好奇地弯曲着。鲨鱼警报响起。游泳者跑回沙滩，抓起他们的毛巾。冲浪者急忙冲向岸边，胳膊下夹着他们的冲浪板。在淋浴间里，他们脱下他们的潜水服。“咿呀！咿呀！咿呀！”海鸥叫道。“约瑟夫的父亲会从海洋带回什么？”

SourceText: There are hundreds of kinds of sharks in the world. Here are a few of those kinds: Great White Shark, Tiger Shark, Hammerhead Shark, Lemon Shark, and Nurse Shark.
text: 世界上有数百种鲨鱼。以下是其中的一些种类：大白鲨、虎鲨、锤头鲨、柠檬鲨和护士鲨。

SourceText: Some sharks are dangerous. Others have no interest in people, such as nurse sharks. A leopard shark has never attacked a person and they just hunt for crabs.
text: 一些鲨鱼是危险的，而另一些对人类没有兴趣，比如护士鲨。豹纹鲨从未攻击过人类，它们只是捕猎螃蟹。

SourceText: Goblin sharks are not very aggressive. They have not attacked a person, partly because they are so far out in the deep ocean.
text: 妖精鲨并不是非常具攻击性的鲨鱼。它们之所以不攻击人，部分原因是它们生活在深海的远离地方。

SourceText: Yusuf's father and uncle and cousins heave and pull. A little shark has been caught. Yusuf's father untangles the nets, singing to the shark: "Drop and swish. Find a fish. Pull and plop. Don't you stop." When the shark at last is free it streaks back into the waves, leaving only one fat yellowtail in the net. Ouma Safiya will be pleased.
text: 约瑟夫的父亲、叔叔和堂兄弟们一起用力拉扯。一只小鲨鱼被捉住了。约瑟夫的父亲解开渔网，一边对着鲨鱼唱着：“落下又荡起，找到一条鱼，拉起又扔下，永远不要停。”当鲨鱼最终被释放时，它迅速闪回到海浪中，只留下渔网里的一条肥美的黄尾鱼。奶奶莎菲亚会很高兴的。

SourceText: Why does Yusuf's father let the little shark go free?
text: 约瑟夫的父亲为什么要放走小鲨鱼呢？

SourceText: The fin in the shape of a triangle on a shark's back is called a dorsal fin. It helps keep the shark upright in the water and it also helps it make quick turns.
text: 鲨鱼背部呈三角形的鳍叫做背鳍。它有助于使鲨鱼在水中保持垂直，并帮助它迅速转弯。

SourceText: The net in the picture has circular objects shaped like donuts on its edge. They're not donuts! What do you think they are for?
text: 图片中的渔网边缘有类似甜甜圈形状的圆形物体。它们并不是甜甜圈！你认为它们是用来做什么的？

SourceText: The men pull the boat in and coil up the cables. A hard white triangle catches Papa's finger. "Whaaat? Whaaat" Whaaat?" cry the gulls. "What did you bring back for Yusuf?" As the sun goes down, Papa answers the gulls. "A lucky shark tooth for my boy." At home Yusuf holds his gift up to the stars.
text: 渔夫们拉着船靠岸, 卷起缆绳。一块白色坚硬的三角形的东西扎了爸爸的手指。“咿呀！咿呀！咿呀！”海鸥叫道，“你为约瑟夫带回了什么？”当太阳落山时，爸爸回答海鸥说：“一枚幸运的鲨鱼牙齿送给我的孩子。” 在家里，约瑟夫把这份礼物举向星星。

SourceText: The shark's tooth is a hard, white triangle. Do you remember another triangle on the shark's body? Do you see any triangles around you now?
text: 鲨鱼牙是坚硬的、白色的三角形。你记得鲨鱼身上还有另一个三角形吗？你现在身边看到了什么三角形吗？

SourceText: Do you remember what some of the other gifts were from earlier in the story?
text: 你记得故事前面提到的其他礼物吗？

SourceText: Do you have special things you've found that you like to keep? Perhaps you found a pretty rock or a bird's feather that you liked a lot?
text: 你有没有特别留着的找到的东西？可能是你很喜欢的漂亮石头或鸟类羽毛？

SourceText: His hoe was too short.
text: 他的锄头太短了。

SourceText: Point out the vivid colors -- the yellow sun, the blue sky, the green bushes, and the red shoes.
text: 请指出鲜艳的颜色--黄色的太阳、蓝色的天空、绿色的灌木丛和红色的鞋子。

SourceText: Count the two bushes and the two red shoes with your child.
text: 和你的孩子一起数一数：两个灌木丛和两只红鞋子。

SourceText: Point out how uncomfortable the man looks bending over so far to hoe.
text: 指出这个人如何看起来非常地不舒服的弯着腰去锄地。

SourceText: His doorway was too low.
text: 他的正门太低了。

SourceText: Comment that the doorway is too low -- the man is taller than the door.
text: 评论一下大门对于这个男人来说实在太低了 -- 这个男人比门还高

SourceText: Look how much the man stoops down to talk to the boy -- he is much taller than the boy, and the boy is much shorter than the man!
text: 看看这个人是如何弯下腰来和男孩说话的 -- 他比男孩高很多很多，男孩也比男人矮很多很多。

SourceText: Count the bushes together.
text: 一起数数灌木丛吧。

SourceText: His bed was too short.
text: 他的床太短了。

SourceText: The man's legs stick far out of the bed. He is much longer than his bed.
text: 他的腿伸出床脚外很远- 他比床长很多。

SourceText: Point to the bird and the boy and how puzzled they look by the short bed.
text: 指向小鸟和男孩，以及他们脸上显示对矮床的疑惑。

SourceText: Count together the toes on each of the man's feet.
text: 一起数一下这个男人每只脚上的脚趾头。

SourceText: His bicycle was too short.
text: 他的脚踏车太矮了

SourceText: The tall man is much too big for his bicycle. Look how far his leg sticks out!
text: 这个高个子男人对他的自行车来说太大了。 看看他的腿伸出去多远！

SourceText: Point out that the bird has changed color from yellow to orange!
text: 指出这只鸟的颜色从黄色变成了橙色!

SourceText: Where is the boy in this picture?
text: 这张照片中的男孩在哪里？

SourceText:
This man was too tall!

What can he do to solve his problem and fit into his world?
text:
这个男人实在太高了! 
他能做什么来解决他的问题并且适合他的世界？

SourceText: Maybe the man is not too tall -- maybe he just needs to solve his problems!
text: 也许这个人并不是太高 -- 也许他只是需要解决他的问题！

SourceText: The man has a problem and he is feeling sad about it.
text: 请指出这个人现在面临问题，而且他正为这个难题感到难过。

SourceText: Notice that this man is much taller than the other people.
text: 请注意，这个人比其他人高得多。

SourceText: He made a very long handle.
text: 他做了一个很长的把手。

SourceText: He solved his problem with the hoe! He made his hoe bigger!
text: 他用他的锄头解决了问题，他把锄头变长了！

SourceText: Which one is bigger, the hoe or the man?
text: 哪一个比较大， 是锄头还是男人?

SourceText: Do you see the man's red shoes? They disappeared!
text: 你看见男人的红色鞋子了吗？他们去哪里了？他们消失了！

SourceText: He made very high door frames.
text: 他制作了一扇非常高的门框。

SourceText: Which is higher -- the door or the man?
text: 哪个更高 -- 是门还是这个男人？

SourceText: The sun in the sky is round. Point to round things where you are.
text: 天上的太阳是圆的。请指出你周围的圆形事物。

SourceText: Which is longer and which is shorter -- the man's legs or his upper body?
text: 哪个比较长以及哪个比较短--男人的腿还是他的上半身？

SourceText: He made a very long bed.
text: 他制作了一个很长的床

SourceText: We can't see the man's feet now. His bed is longer than he is.
text: 我们现在看不到这个人的脚了。现在他的床比他人还长。

SourceText: The man looks very comfortable and happy in his big bed.
text: 这个男人看起来非常舒适和快乐的在他的床上。

SourceText: Look at how small the boy looks next to the bed!
text: 现在看看这个在床边的男孩有多小!

SourceText: He bought a very high bicycle.
text: 他买了一辆很高的脚踏车。

SourceText: Notice that the boy and the bird are inside the basket now.
text: 请注意，男孩和小鸟现在都在篮子里。

SourceText: Everyone looks very happy now that the man's things are the right size.
text: 现在每个人看起来都非常地快乐，因为这个男人所有的东西大小都非常合适。

SourceText: Point to and name the many different colors on this page.
text: 请指出并说出这一页上许多不同颜色的名称。

SourceText: He sat on a very high chair. He ate with a very long fork.
text: 他坐在一个非常高的椅子上。他用非常长的叉子吃饭。

SourceText: Count out with your child many of the things in the picture -- such as fingers, legs, steps, and tines.
text: 和你的孩子一起数出图片中的许多东西--例如手指、腿、台阶和尖齿。

SourceText: Look at how high the boy's chair is! Would you be scared sitting so high?
text: 看看这个男孩的椅子有多高! 坐在这么高的地方你会害怕吗？

SourceText: Now that all his things are the right size for him, the man is not too tall at all!
text: 现在这个男人所拥有的东西都是适合他的尺寸，男人一点都不高！

SourceText: He left his house and moved to a big house in the forest, where he lived for many years.
text: 他离开了自己的房子，搬到了森林里的一座大房子里，他在那里生活了很多年。

SourceText: Count the pineapples, bags, and trees with your child.
text: 和你的孩子一起数菠萝、袋子和树。

SourceText: Count the rungs on the ladder with your child.
text: 和你的孩子一起数一数梯子上的级数。

SourceText: Notice that the bird is yellow again!
text: 请注意，这只鸟黄又回到黄色!

SourceText:
How many cats? 

 0 Zero cats.

No cats here!
text:
有多少只猫?
0 零只猫。
这里没有猫!

SourceText: 0 is an important number! It's where all counting starts, even when we don't say it.
text: 0是一个重要的数字! 这是所有计算开始的地方, 即使我们不把它说出来。

SourceText: How many cats do you see?
text: 你看到多少只猫?

SourceText: Count together the butterflies – they are tricky to find in this picture.
text: 数一数蝴蝶们——在这张图片里很难找到它们。

SourceText:
How many cats? 

 1 One cat.

 A black cat is eating red meat.
text:
有多少只猫？ 
一只猫。 
一只黑猫正在吃红肉。

SourceText: Point to and name the green and orange squares, blue shirt, and black cat.
text: 指出并说出绿色和橙色的方块，蓝色的衬衫和黑猫。

SourceText: Notice how Paul is looking at the cat. Paul sure likes cats!
text: 注意保罗是怎么看着猫的。保罗肯定喜欢猫！

SourceText: Each time a cat is added: a) say that one more than the last number of cats is the new number, and b) one less than the current number is the last number.
text: 每次添加一只猫时：a）说新数量是上次猫的数量加一，b）上次数量是当前数量减一。

SourceText:
How many cats? 

 2 Two cats. 

 A white cat and a grey cat are sleeping.
text:
有多少只猫？
2 两只猫。
一只白猫和一只灰猫在睡觉。

SourceText: Count together the cats, plants, and people.
text: 数一数猫、植物和人。

SourceText: Of cats, plants, and people, which number is the biggest? Which one is the smallest?
text: 在猫、植物和人当中，哪个数字最大？哪一个是最小的？

SourceText: Notice that the square tiles are now all the same gray color.
text: 注意这些正方形瓷砖现在都是相同的灰色。

SourceText:
How many cats? 

3 Three cats. 

Three cats are playing in the kitchen.
text:
有多少只猫？ 
3 三只猫。
三只猫在厨房里玩。

SourceText: What a mess! There must be zero people here!
text: 真是一团糟！ 这里肯定一个人都没有！

SourceText: Count together each group – the cats, cabinet doors, food containers, and spoons.
text: 数一数每一组——猫、橱柜门、食物容器和勺子。

SourceText: Which thing is there the most of in this picture?
text: 在这张图中哪一样东西最多？

SourceText:
How many cats? 

4 Four cats. 

Four cats are Paul's friends.
text:
有多少只猫？ 
4 四只猫。
四只猫是保罗的朋友。

SourceText: Count all the cats.
text: 数一数所有的猫。

SourceText: Which of these cats have you seen before, and which are new? Which ones are missing?
text: 这些猫中哪些你以前见过，哪些是新的？少了哪些？

SourceText: Point at and name all the different colors in the room.
text: 指着房间里所有不同的颜色并说出它们的名称。

SourceText:
How many cats? 

5 Five cats. 

Five cats chase the dog.
text:
有多少只猫？
5 五只猫。
五只猫追那只狗。

SourceText: Looking at their faces and bodies, do the cats and the dog like each other?
text: 看着他们的脸和身体，猫和狗彼此喜欢对方吗？

SourceText: Count the number of cats and the number of dogs. Which group is bigger? Poor dog!
text: 数一数猫和狗的数量。哪一组的数量更大？可怜的狗！

SourceText: These cats all have different coloring. Describe the color and pattern of each cat.
text: 这些猫的颜色都不同。描述每只猫的颜色和斑纹。

SourceText:
How many cats?

6 Six cats.

Six cats waiting for the dog.
text:
有多少只猫？
6 六只猫。 
六只猫等待着那只狗。

SourceText: Count the cats on the floor and in the picture. Is it the same number?
text: 数一数地板上和图画里的猫。是同一个数字吗？

SourceText: Find a cat or two in the picture on the wall that is not on the floor.
text: 在墙上的图片中找一只或两只不在地板上的猫。

SourceText: The dog doesn't want to come back. Why not?
text: 那只狗不想回来。为什么不想呢？

SourceText:
How many cats? 

7 Seven cats. 

Seven cats playing in the compound.
text:
有多少只猫？
7 七只猫。 
七只猫在院子里玩耍。

SourceText: Point at each of the seven cats.
text: 指出七只猫中的每一只。

SourceText: What is Paul looking for?
text: 保罗在找什么？

SourceText: The cat on the roof is the highest cat. How did that cat get up so high?
text: 屋顶上的猫是最高的猫。那只猫是怎么爬到这么高的？

SourceText:
How many cats? 

8 Eight cats. 

Eight cats and one dog!
text:
有多少只猫？ 
8 八只猫。 
八只猫和一只狗！

SourceText: The cats have many different colors and patterns. Have you seen cats like these?
text: 这些猫有许多不同的颜色和斑纹。你见过这样的猫吗？

SourceText: Seven cats plus one dog makes how many animals?
text: 七只猫加一只狗等于多少只动物？

SourceText: Do you think the dog looks happy or worried?
text: 你认为这只狗看起来是高兴还是担心？

SourceText:
A kitten is stuck in a tree! 

"I will rescue you!" says Paul.
text:
一只小猫被卡在树上了！
 “我来救你！”保罗说。

SourceText: How many cats are stuck in the tree?
text: 有多少只猫被困在树上？

SourceText: How did the cat get up there?
text: 那只猫是怎么爬上去的？

SourceText: The cat is higher than Paul. How will Paul help the cat?
text: 这只猫比保罗高。保罗将如何帮助这只猫？

SourceText:
Mama, can we keep him?" 

How many cats? 

9 Nine cats. 

"That is too many cats!" says Mama.
text:
“妈妈，我们能留下他吗？”
有多少只猫？ 
9 九只猫。
妈说：“这太多猫了！”

SourceText: One more than eight cats is nine cats. A dog and nine cats is how many animals?
text: 比八只猫多一只就是九只猫。一只狗和九只猫是多少只动物？

SourceText: Do you know anyone with cats? How many cats do they have?
text: 你认识养猫的人吗？他们有多少只猫？

SourceText: Do you think nine cats is too many?
text: 你觉得九只猫太多了吗？

SourceText: Long time ago, Cassava and Palm lived in a village called Koowa. They were very good friends. They visited each other every day. They were farmers. They worked very hard on their farms.
text: 在很久以前，木薯和棕榈住在一个叫做库瓦的村庄。他们是非常好的朋友，每天都互相问候。他们都是农民，非常努力地在田地里工作。

SourceText: These are two talking plants! Use your imagination to suggest what they might be saying to each other.
text: 这是两株会说话的植物！用你的想象力来猜猜看它们可能会对对方说什么。

SourceText: Palm is a kind of tree that doesn't have branches like other trees -- it has leaves, called fronds, that are held together by a rib in the middle.
text: 棕榈树是一种与其他树木不同的树——它没有树枝，而有叶子，称为叶柄，叶柄中间有一条肋骨把它们固定在一起。

SourceText: Count how many ribbed fronds you see. How does the rib on the fronds compare to your own ribs?
text: 数一数你看到多少条有肋骨的叶柄。叶柄上的肋骨与你自己的肋骨比较怎么样？

SourceText:
In a certain year, there was no rain. The crops did not grow well. All the plants dried up. People did not have any food to eat.

Cassava and Palm decided to travel to another village to look for work.
text: 在某一年，没有下雨。庄稼长势不好。所有的植物都枯萎了。人们没有任何食物可以吃。 于是木薯和棕榈决定前往别的村子找工作。

SourceText: How have Palm's fronds and Cassava's leaves changed now that the weather has been so dry?
text: 现在天气非常干旱，棕榈树的叶柄和木薯的叶子变化有多大？

SourceText: The plants in the ground are very thirsty. Have you ever been very, very thirsty? When you were extremely thirsty, how much did you drink? 1 cup? 2 cups? 3 cups? more?
text: 地里的植物非常渴。你有没有感觉非常非常口渴？ 当你极度口渴时，你喝了多少？ 1杯？ 2杯？ 3杯？ 还是更多？

SourceText: All the little plants are dying! How many of them can you count? Can you count that high?
text: 所有的小植物都在死去！你能数多少？你能数那么多吗？

SourceText:
On their way, they met a woman. "Good afternoon," they greeted her.

She responded, "Where are you going?" "We are going to the next village to look for work," said Palm.
text: 在路上，他们遇到一个女人。“下午好，”他们向她打招呼。 \Para 她回应道：“你们要去哪里？” “我们要去隔壁村找工作，”棕榈树说。

SourceText: Cassava has what are called tuber roots that help it stand up. How many tuber roots do you see?
text: 木薯有所谓的块茎根帮助它站立。你看到多少块茎根？

SourceText: Count the fingers on the woman's hands. How many fingers do most people have? How many does she seem to be missing?
text: 数一数这个女人手上的手指。大多数人有多少根手指？她似乎少了多少根？

SourceText: Notice everyone's arms in this picture. Copy each one with your own arms. Arm positions can tell us a lot about what a person is thinking or feeling. What do these arm positions say to you?
text: 注意图片中每个人的手臂。用你自己的手臂模仿每个姿势。手臂姿势可以告诉我们一个人在想什么或感觉什么。这些手臂姿势对你意味着什么？

SourceText:
"What work can you do?" the woman asked. The friends responded, "We can provide food for your family and animals."

The woman asked, "What do you need to provide the food?" "Give us land, water and good care," they replied.
text:
“你们能做什么工作？”那个女人问道。朋友们回答说：“我们可以为你的家人和动物提供食物。” 
人问：“你们需要什么来提供食物？” “给我们土地、水和好的照料，”他们回答说。

SourceText: Most of our food comes from plants. What are some of your favorite foods that come from trees? From bushes? From vines? (berries, tomatoes, beans, squash)
text: 我们的大多数食物来自植物。你最喜欢的来自树木、灌木或藤蔓的食物是什么？(浆果、西红柿、豆类、南瓜)

SourceText: Rectangles are shapes with four straight sides, like this page. Count the rectangles on this page.
text: 长方形是有四条直边的形状，就像这页纸。数一数这页上的长方形。

SourceText: These roofs are made of straw. The roof of the round building is shaped like a cone. The roofs of the other two buildings are somewhat like two sides of a triangle.
text: 这些草屋顶是用草做的。圆屋顶的形状像一个圆锥。另外两栋建筑的屋顶有点像一个三角形的两边。

SourceText: The woman took them home with her.
text: 那个女人带他们一起回家了。

SourceText: Palm and Cassava have very different bodies. Describe the shape, color, and size of the scales covering Palm's body.
text: 棕榈树和木薯的身体非常不同。描述一下覆盖棕榈树身体的鳞片的形状、颜色和大小。

SourceText: How many of the bricks on the side of the house can you count? Are there more leaves on Cassava or bricks on the house? How many more?
text: 房子边上的砖块你能数多少个？木薯叶子和房子砖块哪个更多？差多少？

SourceText: What is the shape of the side of a brick? Do you see any other objects with that shape in this picture?
text: 一块砖的边是什么形状的？图片中还有其他什么物品是那个形状吗？

SourceText:
One afternoon, Palm tree and Cassava had an argument. Cassava said he was more important than Palm.

Palm said he was more important than Cassava.
text: 一天下午，棕榈树和木薯发生了争论。木薯说他比棕榈树更重要。\Para 棕榈树说他比木薯更重要。

SourceText: Palm and Cassava want to feel important. What are some ways you feel important?
text: 棕榈树和木薯都想觉得自己被重视。你感觉被重视的方式是什么？

SourceText: There are many ways someone might feel important. Perhaps they are important to someone, or because they can do something really well, or maybe because someone or something needs them.
text: 让一个人感到重视的方式有很多。可能因为对某人很重要，或因为某项事情做得非常出色，或者因为某人或某物需要他们。

SourceText: Use the shadows on the ground to guess where the sun is. Point to the corner of the picture where the sun is.
text: 用地上的影子猜测太阳在哪个方向。指着图片的哪个角落是太阳所在的位置。

SourceText: The woman heard them from her room. She came out and asked "Why are you fighting?"
text: 女人从房间里听到他们吵架。她出来问：“你们为什么吵架？”

SourceText: Rectangles with four equal sides are called squares. Point out squares and rectangles in this picture.
text: 四边相等的长方形称为正方形。指出图片中的正方形和长方形。

SourceText: Palm and Cassava are arguing. What do you think will happen next? Will they stop being friends?
text: 棕榈树和木薯在吵架。你认为接下来会发生什么？他们会不再是朋友吗？

SourceText: Is it possible to disagree with someone and still be friends?
text: 与某人意见不同但仍能成为朋友，这可能吗？

SourceText: Cassava spoke first. "I am more important than Palm tree. I provide tubers for your fufu, gari, boiled cassava and cassava dough."
text: 木薯先说话了。“我比棕榈树更重要。我提供块茎让你做 糊糊、加里、煮木薯和木薯面团。”

SourceText: Fufu is mashed cassava that people put in soups. Which kinds of soup have you eaten?
text: 糊糊 是捣碎的木薯，人们把它放在汤里吃。你吃过什么样的汤？

SourceText: These food containers are all round in some way. How are the shapes of these containers alike and how are they different?
text: 这些食物容器都是圆形的。这些容器的形状在什么地方相似，在什么地方不同？

SourceText: The world has about 8 billion people. Almost 1 billion people eat food from cassava. The country where people eat the most cassava is Nigeria, in Africa.
text: 世界上大约有8亿人。近10亿人吃木薯制成的食物。吃最多木薯的国家是非洲的尼日利亚。

SourceText: "My stems are used for planting. My leaves and peels feed your animals. What does Palm tree do?" asked Cassava.
text: “我的茎可用来种植。我的叶子和皮可喂你的动物。 棕榈树有什么用？”木薯问道。

SourceText: Not all shapes are simple and regular. There are several large, irregularly-shaped dark patches on the goat. How many?
text: 并非所有的形状都简单规则。山羊身上有几个大的不规则的深色块？

SourceText: The pig seems to be enjoying the peels of the cassava plant. Which kinds of foods do we eat after peeling them?
text: 猪似乎正在享受木薯植株的皮。我们吃的哪些食物需要剥皮？

SourceText: It's fun to make animal sounds. Can you make a noise like a pig or a goat? Any others?
text: 模仿动物的叫声很有趣。你能像猪或山羊那样发出声音吗？还能发出哪种动物的叫声？

SourceText: Palm tree laughed, shook his head and said, "Woman, do you remember the palm soup you enjoy so much? I provide that."
text: 棕榈树笑着摇了摇头，说：“女士，你还记得你最喜欢的棕榈汤吗？就是我提供的。”

SourceText: Some kinds of palm trees produce coconuts and some produce palm nuts. Palm nuts hold the seeds for new palm trees.
text: 有些棕榈树结椰子，有些结棕榈果。棕榈果含有新棕榈树的种子。

SourceText: The recipe for palm soup uses palm nuts AND fufu made from cassava. These two friends belong together!
text: 棕榈汤的配方需要棕榈果和木薯做的 糊糊。这两位朋友是一体的！

SourceText: Palm is laughing so hard that spit is flying from his mouth! Did you ever laugh that hard?
text: 棕榈树笑得非常厉害，笑到溅出来！你笑得有这么厉害过吗？

SourceText: I provide the palm oil for preparing the kpokpoi and the palm kernel oil for frying fish and meat. How would you prepare stews and gravies without oil?
text: “我提供棕榈油来做克佩克佩勒，提供棕榈仁油来煎鱼和肉。如果没有油，你怎么做炖菜和肉汁？”

SourceText: People fry many kinds of food in oil. Name some kinds of fried food you have eaten.
text: 人们用油来煎炸很多种食物。说出你吃过的一些油炸食品。

SourceText: If every person in the family eats one of these fish, how many people are in the family?
text: 如果家里每个人吃一条鱼，这个家有多少人？

SourceText: Suppose each person eats two fish, how many people would there be? What if each person eats half a fish?
text: 假设每个人吃两条鱼，会有多少人？如果每个人吃半条鱼呢？

SourceText: "In addition, my friends provide shade for your huts. You cool your heart with my sweet, rich, foamy palm wine after your hard day's work."
text: 此外，我的朋友们为你的小屋提供遮荫。劳累一天后，你可以喝我芳香浓郁的起泡棕榈酒清凉身心。”

SourceText: The poles that hold up the palm frond roof are vertical -- they are straight up and down. The edge of the wall behind the people is horizontal -- it goes from side to side. Point out vertical and horizontal lines around you.
text: 支撑棕榈叶顶的木桩是垂直的——直接从上往下。墙后人们边上的线是水平的——从一边到另一边。指出周围垂直线和水平线。

SourceText: The places where the poles meet the wall make right angles – angles like the corner of this page. Point out right angles in the picture and where you are.
text: 木桩与墙相交的地方成直角——像这页角落。指出图片和你周围的直角。

SourceText: Most drink containers are round. Why do you suppose that is?
text: 大多数饮料容器是圆形的。你认为这是为什么？

SourceText: "Above all, the brooms that are used to sweep the rooms and compounds come from me," concluded Palm.
text: “最重要的是，扫房间和院子用的扫帚也来自我这里，”棕榈树结束陈述。

SourceText: People tie palm fronds tightly together to make brooms. A dust broom is a really short broom for sweeping small areas. Do you have a dust broom?
text: 人们把棕榈叶柄紧紧捆在一起做成扫帚。短扫帚是用来扫小区域的。你有短扫帚吗？

SourceText: Do you suppose they are sweeping up bits of cassava peels and palm nut shells? Have you ever used a tall broom or a dust broom?
text: 你认为他们是在扫木薯皮和棕榈果壳吗？你用过高扫帚或短扫帚吗？

SourceText: Point out the vertical and horizontal lines in this picture.
text: 指出图片中的垂直线和水平线。

SourceText: Hmmm! sighed the woman. "All right friends, I have heard you. I will settle this problem."
text: “嗯！”女人叹了口气，“好了，朋友们，我听到你们说的了。我会解决这个问题的。”

SourceText: The woman says, "I have heard you." She listened carefully to both of them. It really helps when people listen closely to what people care about.
text: 女人说：“我已经听到你们了。”她仔细地聆听了两人。认真聆听别人关心的事情真的很有帮助。
