SourceText: After a month, the two brothers came back to their father. The father said, "Well, have you built your homes?" And both of the brothers said, "Yes."
text: 一个月后，两个兄弟回到他们父亲那里。父亲说：“你们建好房子了吗？”两个兄弟都说：“是的。”

SourceText: Vertical lines go up and down. Although you can't see them all, how many vertical planks in the door do you think there are?
text: 垂直线是上下的。虽然你看不见它们全部，但你认为门上有多少垂直的木板？

SourceText: Horizontal lines go from side to side. If you add the one horizontal plank to the vertical planks, how many planks are there all together?
text: 水平线是从一边到另一边的。如果你把一块水平的木板加到垂直的木板上，一共有多少块木板？

SourceText: A month can be 28, 29, 30, or 31 days. Do you think someone could make their home in about 30 days? What month of the year is it for you right now?
text: 一个月可以是28天、29天、30天或31天。你认为有人能在大约30天内建好房子吗？现在对你来说是一年中的哪个月？

SourceText: The father went with his eldest son. He saw that the son had built many huts. As he walked by each hut, he asked, "Is there anybody in this hut?" Each time, the son replied, "No."
text: 父亲和大儿子一起去看。他看到儿子建了许多茅草屋。当他走过每个茅草屋时，他问：“这个茅草屋里有人吗？”每次大儿子都回答：“没有。”

SourceText: There is a new word that the father uses for these buildings. How is a hut different from a home?
text: 父亲用一个新的词来描述这些建筑。茅草屋和房子的区别是什么？

SourceText: Have you ever made a real or pretend hut, house, or fort? What did you use to make it?
text: 你是否曾经建过真实或假想的茅草屋、房子或要塞？你用什么建的？

SourceText: Count how many huts there are in this picture. If there is no one in a hut, how many people is that? (0 – zero)
text: 数一数这张图片中有多少个茅草屋。如果一个茅草屋里没有人，那就是0(零) 人。

SourceText: The father would ask, "Is there anybody in this hut?" And the son would reply, "No."
text: 父亲会问：“这个茅草屋里有人吗？”大儿子会回答：“没有。“

SourceText: Count all the rectangles you can find in this picture.
text: 尽可能在这张图片中统计所有矩形。

SourceText: A right angle is formed when two lines cross each other like the corner of this page. Horizontal lines form right angles with vertical lines. Point out some right angles in this picture.
text: 当两条线相交时，会形成直角，就像这页的角落。水平线与垂直线形成直角。指出图片中一些直角。

SourceText: There are probably lots of right angles where you are. Can you count them all, or are there too many?
text: 在你所在的地方可能有很多直角。你能把它们都统计出来吗，还是太多了？

SourceText: The father became hungry, but there was no one to serve food to him. He said, "Let's go home." So they went home.
text: 父亲饿了，但没有人给他端饭吃。他说：“我们回家吧。”于是他们回家了。

SourceText: People usually offer visitors something to eat or drink. All these huts are unwelcoming, with nothing to offer to a visitor.
text: 人们通常会请客人吃些东西或喝些东西。所有的这些茅草屋都很冷清，没有什么可以招待客人。

SourceText: Notice that the father has turned his back on his son. What message do you give someone when you turn your back on them?
text: 注意父亲已经转过身去不再面对大儿子。当你转身背对别人时，你向Ta传达什么信息？

SourceText: As the father walks away, what do you think he is feeling?
text: 当父亲离开时，你认为他有什么感受？

SourceText: The second brother took them to the first family he had adopted. He introduced them, "Here is my father and my brother." The family welcomed the men. They slaughtered a sheep and gave them a big feast.
text: 二儿子带他们去见第一家收养他的家庭。他介绍说：“这是我的父亲和哥哥。”那家人欢迎这几个男人。他们宰了一只羊，大摆宴席。

SourceText: This family gave the father a feast! Why did they do that?
text: 这家人给父亲摆了一场盛宴！他们为什么这么做？

SourceText: How do you think the father is feeling about this?
text: 你认为父亲对此有什么感受？

SourceText: What do you think will happen with the next family they visit?
text: 你认为他们访问下一个家庭时会发生什么？

SourceText: They went to the second family the younger son had adopted. He introduced his father and brother and they were given another feast.
text: 他们去拜访二儿子收养的第二个家庭。他向父亲和哥哥介绍后，他们又得到了一场宴请。

SourceText: Notice how the people are looking at each other. How are they feeling?
text: 注意这些人正在看着对方。他们的感受如何？

SourceText: What do you think the small child and the second son are saying to each other as they meet?
text: 当二儿子和小孩见面时，你认为他们在说什么？

SourceText: Their clothes have many soft hues. Describe some of the different colors that you see.
text: 他们的衣服有许多柔和的色调。描述一下你看到的不同颜色。

SourceText: Father and brother were welcomed in all the places where the younger son was adopted. They ate and were satisfied. Then they left for home.
text: 父亲和哥哥在二儿子被收养的所有地方都受到欢迎。他们吃得饱饱的。然后他们离开回家。

SourceText: Some of the cone-shaped roofs are steeper than others. Why is it helpful to have a steep roof?
text: 一些圆锥形的屋顶比其他的更陡峭。为什么陡峭的屋顶很有用？

SourceText: Can you think of any disadvantages of having a steep roof? (It would take more material.)
text: 你能想到陡峭屋顶的任何缺点吗？(需要更多材料。)

SourceText: What things about the father tell you that he is feeling very tired?
text: 父亲的哪些事情告诉你他感到非常疲惫？

SourceText: The father said, "This is what I meant when I said you should make yourself a home. A home is more than many huts or a big expensive house. It is love, warmth and friendship with other people."
text: 父亲说：“这就是我说你应该建立家园的意思。家不只是许多茅草屋或昂贵的大房子。它是与其他人的爱、温暖和友谊。”

SourceText: A home is not just a roof or walls or doors. In the place where you live, what kinds of things make it a home to you?
text: 家不仅仅是屋顶或墙壁或门。在你生活的地方，是什么使它成为你的家？

SourceText: Which of these three is the tallest and which is the shortest?
text: 这三个中的哪个最高，哪个最短？

SourceText: Which do you think is more helpful – to have lots of people who care about you or to have lots of buildings?
text: 你认为更有帮助的是拥有许多关心你的人，还是拥有许多房子？

SourceText:
A father, his son, and their donkey started a long journey.

On the way, some people asked them why they didn't ride the donkey.
text:
一位父亲，他的儿子和他们的驴开始了一段漫长的旅程。
在路上，有人问他们为什么不骑驴。

SourceText: Why do you think other people cared about why no one was riding the donkey? Make up a reason why no one is riding.
text: 你认为别人为什么会关心没有人骑驴？想一个没有人骑驴的理。

SourceText: This story is about these three going along the road together. Before reading on, make up a story of your own about them.
text: 这是一个关于三个人一起走在路上的故事在开始阅读之前，自己编一个关于他们的故事。

SourceText: The three of them look tired. Think about how many steps they have to take to go on their long journey. Do you think the donkey will get twice as tired because it takes twice as many steps?
text: 他们三个看上去十分疲惫。想想他们在旅途中要走多少路。你认为驴会不会因为走了两倍的路而感到双倍的疲惫呢？

SourceText:
The father invited his son to ride the donkey while he walked.

They continued like this for a while.
text:
父亲邀请儿子在他走路的时候骑驴。
他们继续这样走了一段时间。

SourceText: Notice how the hills and sky in the distance are paler than the hills and sky closer in. Have you seen this effect when you look out over distant scenes near you?
text: {注意远处的山和天空比近处的山和天空更浅。当你眺望远方的景色时，你有注意到这一现象吗？

SourceText: This paleness of objects is an important clue in a scene that tells you what is close and what is far. What do you suppose causes this effect? (It is caused by all the air between you and the objects.)
text: 物体的苍白是场景中的一个重要线索，它能告诉你物体的远近。你认为什么导致了这一现象？ （这是由你与物体之间的空气造成的）

SourceText: Have you ever tried to count your own steps when you walked someplace? If you can't count that high, you can keep track of the count in bunches of 20's, 50's, or 100's -- for example, you could count how many groups of 50 steps you take.
text: 你有没有试过走路时数你的步数？如果你数不到那么多，你可以用20步，50步或者100步来计数——例如，你可以数你走了多少50步。

SourceText: Then, other people they met remarked, "Look at this rude boy riding a donkey while his father is walking!"
text: 然后，他们遇到的其他人说：“看这个无礼的男孩骑着驴但他的父亲却在走路！”

SourceText: Why would someone think it is rude for the boy to ride while his father walked? Why would these people care what this father and son did?
text: 为什么其他人认为这个男孩骑驴而他的父亲走路是无礼的？为什么其他人会关心男孩和他的父亲的行为？

SourceText: Most of the people have sticks. What do you suppose they use them for?
text: 大多数人都有棍子，你认为他们用它做什么？

SourceText: Here is another scene with faded things that are far away. In addition to faintness, what are some other clues that tell you that these things are far away? (They are smaller and somewhat bluer.)
text: 这是另一个场景，远处有褪色的东西。除了模糊以外，还有什么线索能告诉你这些东西很远？（它们更小，颜色更蓝）

SourceText:
As a result, the son jumped down and his father rode the donkey.

They continued their journey.
text:
因此，儿子跳了下来，他的父亲骑上了驴。 
他们继续他们的旅途。

SourceText: What do you notice about the expressions of the father and son during their journey? Do they change?
text: 你有注意到旅途过程中父亲和儿子的表情吗？他们有什么变化？

SourceText: Do you enjoy going on long walks or hikes? Describe a walk or hike you went on recently and some of the interesting things you saw or experienced along the journey.
text: 你喜欢长途跋涉或远足吗？描述你最近一次的散步或远足以及你在旅途过程中看到或体验到的有趣的事情。

SourceText: Look at all the body parts that come in pairs on these people and donkey. They have pairs of legs, arms, ears, and many more. What are some parts that don't come in pairs? Notice that all these single items are in the middle of their bodies.
text: 看这些人和驴身上成对的身体部位。他们有成双的腿，手臂，耳朵等等。还有哪些部分不是成对出现的？注意那些单独的部分都在身体中央。

SourceText: After some time, other people said, "Look at this rude father riding a donkey while his son is walking!"
text: 过了一段时间，其他人说：“看这个无礼的父亲骑着驴但他的儿子却在走路！”

SourceText: Why did these people say it was rude for the father to be riding? Who is correct -- is it rude for the son to ride or the father to ride? Why do these people care?
text: 为什么其他人说这位父亲骑驴是无礼的？谁是正确的——儿子骑驴无礼还是父亲骑驴无礼？为什么其他人会在意？

SourceText: Why do some people feel they need to comment on how other people are living? Are there times when it is a good thing to comment about others?
text: 为什么会有人认为他们需要评价他人如何生活？有时评论别人是件好事吗？

SourceText: There are some new shapes on this page. Point out the rectangles and triangles here. Can you count all the rectangles, or are there too many?
text: 这一页还有一些新的形状。指出这里的长方形和三角形。你能数出所有的长方形吗，还是太多了？

SourceText: So the father and son decided to ride the donkey together.
text: 所以父亲和儿子决定一起骑驴。

SourceText: So far, the watching people have always found something to criticize. Try to guess what people will object to this time.
text: 到目前为止，围观的人总能找到值得批判的地方。试着猜测这次人们会反对什么。

SourceText: This story is almost over. How do you think it will end?
text: 这个故事即将接近尾声。你认为它会怎样结尾？

SourceText: What is the donkey doing that shows that the donkey is stressed and tired?
text: 驴在做什么表明它感到压力和疲惫？

SourceText: But a few minutes later, some people remarked, "Look at these rude people! They are going to kill the donkey."
text: 但是几分钟后，有人说：“看这些无礼的人！他们要杀了这头驴。”

SourceText: Nothing seems to make the watching people happy. Have you ever been in a situation where it seemed no matter what you did it was considered wrong? How did that make you feel?
text: 似乎没有什么能让这些围观的人开心。你是否曾遇到这样的情况，无论你做什么事情都被认为是错的？你感觉怎么样？

SourceText: What do you think the father and son should do about all these unhappy, critical people?
text: 你认为父亲和儿子应该怎样处理这些不开心，挑剔的人？

SourceText: What do you think the three people by the side of the road are doing? Do you think they just spend their days watching people go by?
text: 你认为路旁的三个人在做什么？你认为他们只是花上一整天的时间看人们经过吗？

SourceText:
Finally, father and son understood that they could not escape from people's remarks.

They decided to use their minds to do the right thing.
text:
最后，父亲和儿子明白了他们无法避免他人的评价。 
他们决定用他们的想法去做正确的事情。

SourceText: There are many things we can learn from others. However, ultimately we need to figure out what feels right and stick up for ourselves.
text: 我们能从他人身上学到许多东西。但是，最终我们还是要弄清楚什么是正确的并坚持立场。

SourceText: Do you think it is possible to act in a way that will make everyone happy?
text: 你认为有可能让所有人都满意吗？

SourceText: Can you think of a time when you did what you felt was right despite what others thought?
text: 你能想到有一次你不顾别人的看法，做了你认为正确的事情吗？

SourceText:
Fati was a little girl who ran like the wind.

She loved to laugh, and always tried hard to do as she was told.
text:
法蒂是一个跑得像风一样快的小女孩。
她喜欢笑，并且总是按照吩咐她的尽力去做。

SourceText: It can be hard sometimes to do what you are told. Are you good at following directions?
text: 有时候按吩咐去做可能很难。你擅长遵循指示吗？

SourceText: How do you feel when you don't do as you are told?
text: 当你没有按吩咐去做时，你会有什么感觉

SourceText: Does Fati have more, or less,  limbs (arms and legs) than there are ends to her stick?
text: 法蒂有比她棍子的末端数目更多还是更少的肢体（手臂和腿）？

SourceText: One day, Fati went with her mother and father to look for firewood.
text: 有一天，法蒂和她的母亲父亲一起去找柴火。

SourceText: Have you ever tried to balance something on your head the way Fati's mother is doing? What sorts of things do people carry on their heads?
text: 你曾经试过像法蒂妈妈那样用头平衡某样东西吗？人们通常会在头上扛什么样的东西？

SourceText: Looking at Fati's head and shoulders, what do you think she is feeling?
text: 看法蒂的头和肩膀，你认为她有什么感受？

SourceText: Count together the people in this picture.
text: 一起数这张图片中的人数。

SourceText:
Fati liked to help her mother and father, but there was so much to do and so much to see.

There were birds, monkeys, and the sky!
text:
法蒂喜欢帮助她的母亲和父亲，但要做的事情和要看的东西太多了。 
那里有鸟儿，猴子，还有天空

SourceText: When you are outside, what do you like to look at in the sky?
text: 当你在户外时，你喜欢看天空中的什么？

SourceText: How many birds is Fati looking at?
text: 法蒂正在看多少只鸟？

SourceText: Count together all the ends of the sticks in this picture.
text: 一起数这张图片中木棍末端一共的数目。

SourceText: Mother said, "Fati, please listen! You can look for firewood here and you can look for firewood there."
text: 妈妈说：“法蒂，请仔细听好！你可以在这里找柴火，也可以在那里找柴火。”

SourceText: Fati and her mother are holding outdoor tools. Have you used tools, such as a broom, to do work outside?
text: 法蒂和她妈妈都拿着户外工具。你用过像扫帚这样的工具在户外做过工作吗

SourceText: Fati's mother's dress has a design on it. Count together how many times the design is repeated. Can you count that high? If not, count just one leg.
text: 法蒂妈妈的裙子上有图案。一起数这个图案重复了几次。你能数到这么多吗？如果不能，就只数一条腿上的图案。

SourceText: Two people have a total of two heads. Together, how many legs, arms, eyes, and ears do these two people have?
text: 两个人总共有两个头。加在一起，这两个人有多少条腿、胳膊、眼睛和耳朵？

SourceText:
But Fati, please watch where you go and be very careful."

She replied, "Yes, mother."
text:
“但是法蒂，请注意你去哪里，并且非常小心。” 

她回答说：“是的，妈妈。”

SourceText: What kinds of things might be dangerous for Fati while out collecting firewood?
text: 在外面收集柴火时，对法蒂可能有哪些危险？

SourceText: Which sorts of things are you warned to be careful about?
text: 有哪些事情你被警告要小心？

SourceText: Do you listen to those warnings? Do you think Fati will listen?
text: 你听那些警告吗？你认为法蒂会听吗？

SourceText: Soon Fati's mother and father were very busy.
text: 很快，法蒂的母亲和父亲都很忙。

SourceText: There are many reasons people wear hats. Why is Fati's father wearing a hat?
text: 人们戴帽子有很多原因。法蒂爸爸戴帽子的原因是什么？

SourceText: Fati's father uses a hat to work outside in the sun. Can you think of other clothes that have special uses for certain occasions?
text: 法蒂爸爸戴着帽子在阳光下做外面工作。你能想到其他在某些场合有特殊用途的衣服吗？

SourceText: Fati's family is gathering firewood. Other than keeping warm, what are some ways people use fires?
text: 法蒂一家正在收集柴火。除了取暖，火还能用来做什么？

SourceText:
They found big pieces of firewood.

They found small pieces of firewood.
text:
他们找到大块的柴火。

他们找到小块的柴火。

SourceText: Do the different sizes of firewood have different uses?
text: 不同大小的柴火有不同的用途吗？

SourceText: Count how many pieces of firewood there are.
text: 数一数这里有多少块柴火。

SourceText: Compare the thickness of the biggest pieces of firewood to Fati's father's leg. Which is wider and which is narrower?
text: 把最粗的几块柴火与法蒂爸爸的腿相比。哪个更宽，哪个更窄？

SourceText:
Fati was also very busy.

She found small pieces of firewood.

She found very small pieces of firewood.
text:
法蒂也很忙。


她找到小块的柴火。 

她找到了非常小块的柴火。

SourceText: Why do you think Fati found such small pieces of firewood?
text: 你认为法蒂为什么会找到这么小的柴火？

SourceText: In making a fire, having a variety of sizes of wood is useful. The small pieces help get the fire going, and the big pieces can make it last a long time.
text: 在生火时，有各种大小的木头很有用。小块可以帮助启动火，而大块可以维持很长时间。

SourceText: Count together how many pieces of firewood Fati has found. It's tricky to tell because her wood is all jumbled together.
text: 一起数法蒂找到了多少块柴火。很难数清因为她的木头都乱糟糟的。

SourceText:
Then Fati looked up.

She saw a red bird in the tall grass.
text:
然后法蒂抬起头。

她在高高的草丛中看到一只红色的鸟。

SourceText: Lots of animals have things in common, such as a mouth and a heart. Guess what birds have that no other animal has. (feathers)
text: 很多动物有共同点，比如嘴和心脏。猜猜鸟有什么其他动物没有的？(羽毛)

SourceText: Fati is having too much fun looking at special things to worry about looking for dangers. Is she being careless?
text: 法蒂太沉浸在看有趣东西，没有注意到危险。她是不是太粗心了？

SourceText: Does the bird's red color blend in with the colors in the tall grass?
text: 那只鸟的红色和高高的草丛的颜色是否相配？

SourceText:
Next, Fati looked down.

She saw a brown ant on the dusty path.
text:
接着，法蒂往下看。

她在尘土小路上看到一只褐色的蚂蚁。

SourceText: The largest ants are about the same length as your finger. Do you think the artist got a little carried away drawing this ant?
text: 最大的蚂蚁差不多和你的手指一样长。你认为画家画这只蚂蚁画过火了吗？

SourceText: Ants have six legs. How many legs does this ant have?
text: 蚂蚁有六条腿。这只蚂蚁有几条腿？

SourceText: If ants should have six legs, how many legs is this ant missing?
text: 如果蚂蚁应该有六条腿，这只蚂蚁少了几条腿？

SourceText:
Fati saw a beautiful leaf. The leaf was shiny and green.

She put one finger on the beautiful leaf.
text:
法蒂看到一片漂亮的叶子。那片叶子闪亮而绿油油的。

她一根手指放在那片美丽的叶子上。

SourceText: What do you think will happen next with this strange leaf?
text: 你认为接下来会对这片奇怪的“叶子”发生什么？

SourceText: What is different about the "leaf" that Fati is touching?
text: 法蒂碰到的“叶子”跟别的叶子有什么不同？

SourceText: An estimate is an educated guess. Make an estimate of how many leaves are in this picture. Is it a number bigger than you know?
text: 估计值是一个有根据的猜测。估计这张图片中有多少片叶子。这个数字太大你数不清楚吗？

SourceText:
Fati said, "This does not feel like a leaf."

Suddenly, the beautiful leaf moved!

Fati said, "This is not a beautiful leaf. This is a green snake!"
text:
法蒂说：“这感觉不像叶子。"

突然，那片漂亮的叶子动了！

法蒂说：“这不是美丽的叶子，这是一条绿色的蛇！"

SourceText: Which of her five senses did Fati use to notice the snake?
text: 法蒂用了她的哪一种感觉发现了蛇？

SourceText: If you remove one of the five senses, how many are left?
text: 如果去掉五种感觉中的一种，还剩下几种？

SourceText: Can you name all five of your senses?
text: 你能说出你的全部五种感觉吗？

SourceText:
Fati screamed, "EII!"

She ran very fast to look for her mother and father.
text:
法蒂尖叫道：“啊！”

她跑得很快去寻找她的母亲和父亲。

SourceText: Fati screamed and ran. When you are surprised and scared, what do you do?
text: 法蒂尖叫并跑开了。当你感到惊讶和害怕时，你会做什么？

SourceText: Do you like to hide in your bed or maybe under your bed? What is your favorite hiding spot?
text: 你喜欢躲在床上或者床下吗？ 你最喜欢的藏身之处是哪里？

SourceText: Fati is running so fast that she doesn't notice something. What is it?
text: 法蒂跑得那么快，没有注意到一些事情。是什么？

SourceText:
Fati saw her father and shouted, "A snake! A snake!"

Father said, "Where? Where?"

Fati said, "There! There!"
text:
法蒂看到她父亲，大喊：“蛇！蛇！”

父亲说：“哪里？哪里？”

法蒂说：“那里！那里！”

SourceText: Do you think her father is angry that she wondered away, happy that she is okay, or both?
text: 你认为她父亲是生她的气因为她走远了，还是为她平安高兴，或者两者都有？

SourceText: Her father has two shoes. How many shoes does Fati have and how many is she missing?
text: 她父亲有两只鞋。法蒂有几只鞋丢了几只？

SourceText: Together they have one more shoe than her father has. What is one more than two?
text: 加在一起，他们比她父亲的鞋多一只。两只的一只多是几只？

SourceText:
Then her father chased the green snake with a stick.

The green snake slithered away.
text:
然后她父亲用棍子赶走了那条绿色的蛇。

绿蛇滑走了。

SourceText: Have you ever seen a snake outside on the ground or in a bush?
text: 你见过地上或者灌木丛里的蛇吗？

SourceText: Some snakes are very dangerous, and many others are safe. Do some snakes do good things?
text: 有些蛇非常危险，而许多其他蛇是安全的。有些蛇会做好事吗？

SourceText: What do you know about snakes?
text: 你对蛇知道什么？

SourceText:
Father said, "Fati, you are safe."

Let's go to mother and tell her about the green snake."
text:
父亲说：“法蒂，你很安全。

我们去告诉你妈妈那条绿蛇的事。”

SourceText: What are Fati and her father feeling in this picture?
text: 这张图片中，法蒂和她父亲在感受什么？

SourceText: What do you think her mother will say?
text: 你认为她妈妈会说什么？

SourceText: Fati got back her other shoe. Now she and her father have one more than three shoes. How many shoes is that?
text: 法蒂找回了另一只鞋。现在她和她父亲的鞋比三只鞋多一只。多少只？

SourceText: Mother said, "Fati, I am happy the green snake did not bite you."
text: 妈妈说：“法蒂，我很高兴那条绿蛇没有咬你。”

SourceText: Are you surprised that her mother is not angry?
text: 你惊讶她妈妈没有生气吗？

SourceText: Count together the number of many kinds of things in this picture.
text: 一起数这张图片中多种东西的数量。

SourceText: Are there more pants or dresses? Are there more sandals or boots?
text: 裤子多还是裙子多？凉鞋多还是靴子多？

SourceText:
But next time, please, look where you go, and be more careful.

And that was the end of that.
text:
“但下次，请注意你走到哪里，并更加小心。”

就这样完事了。

SourceText: What does the story mean by "And that was the end of that." ?
text: 这个故事所说的“就这样完事了”是什么意思？

SourceText: The three of them have three pairs of shoes. How many is that?
text: 他们三个人有三双鞋。加起来有多少双？

SourceText: You can count all their shoes by counting by 2's -- 2, 4, 6. Or, you could think of it as twice the number of people -- 3, 6. Which way is easier for you?
text: 你可以通过数2来数所有的鞋――2，4，6。或者，你可以想成人数的两倍――3，6。对你来说哪种方法更容易？

SourceText: My heart feels a lot of things.
text: 我的心能感受到很多事物。

SourceText: Think of different feelings you have. How many can you think of?
text: 想想你有哪些不同的感情？你能想到多少种感情？

SourceText: Tell a story about a time when you felt one of those feelings.
text: 讲一个你感到其中一种感情的故事。

SourceText: Do your feelings fit into a few groups? For example, are they all happy or sad feelings?
text: 你的感情是否可以归入几个类别？例如，它们都是快乐的还是悲伤的感情？

SourceText: I feel happy when my granny tells us stories in the evening.
text: 当我的奶奶在晚上给我们讲故事时，我感到快乐。

SourceText: Do you know a special person who loves to tell you stories? Does it make you feel good to hear that person tell stories?
text: 你认识一个特别喜欢给你讲故事的人吗？听那个人讲故事会让你感觉很好吗？

SourceText: Count together how many children are listening to granny's story. If you add granny to that count, it will be one more -- how many would that make?
text: 一起数数有多少个孩子在听奶奶讲故事。如果把奶奶加到这个数中，就会再多一个——那会是多少？

SourceText: Do these children look happy? How can you tell?
text: 这些孩子看起来快乐吗？你怎么知道？

SourceText: I feel silly when I play with my friend.
text: 当我和朋友一起玩时，我感觉自己像个傻瓜。

SourceText: What things do you do when you are being silly?
text: 当你犯傻的时候，你会做些什么？

SourceText: Count together the hands, feet, eyes, noses, fingers, toes, or anything else you see.
text: 一起数数手、脚、眼睛、鼻子、手指、脚趾或你看到的其他任何东西。

SourceText: Which group of things has the biggest number and which one has the smallest?
text: 哪组东西的数量最多，哪组最少？

SourceText: I feel bad when my dad says he does not have money.
text: 当我爸爸说他没有钱时，我会感到难过。

SourceText: What sorts of things make you sad?
text: 什么事情会让你感到难过？

SourceText: Point to and name the colors of their different pieces of clothing.
text: 指着并说出他们不同衣服部件的颜色。

SourceText: Count the number of buttons on her dress.
text: 数一数她裙子上的钮扣有多少个。

SourceText: I feel loved when my mom gives me a hug.
text: 当我妈妈拥抱我时，我会感到被爱。

SourceText: What are some special moments that make you feel loved?
text: 有一些特别的时刻让你感到被爱吗？

SourceText: What do you do to let others know you feel love for them?
text: 你会怎样让别人知道你对他们有爱意？

SourceText: The mother's clothing has stripes and the girl's has stars. Do you have some clothes with stars or some other shapes on them?
text: 母亲的衣服上有条纹，女孩的衣服上有星星。你有一些带着星星或其他形状的衣服吗？

SourceText:
Chat was born blind.

Her eyes had never seen her parents, or her brother and sisters. She knew their faces by touch.
text:
莎特生下来就是盲人。

她的眼睛从未见过她的父母，或者她的兄弟姐妹。她通过触摸来认别他们的脸。

SourceText: Have you tried walking with your eyes closed? If you do, be sure to be with someone else to stay safe.
text: 你尝试过闭着眼睛走路吗？如果你想要尝试，安全起见，请确保有人会陪着你。

SourceText: When you don't see, you become much more aware of your other senses. Which senses do you notice more when you close your eyes?
text: 当你看不见时，你会更加注重你的其他感官。当你闭上眼睛时，你会更注重哪些感官？

SourceText: A rectangle is a four-sided shape like this page. A square is a rectangle with four equal sides. Point to the squares and rectangles you see on this page.
text: 矩形是一个像这一页一样有四条边的形状。正方形是四条边相等的矩形。指出你在这一页上看到的正方形和矩形。

SourceText:
One day, Chat was strolling in the garden.

She liked the sweet scent of flowers.

She loved to touch their soft petals.
text:
有一天，莎特在花园里漫步。

她喜欢花朵的甜蜜香气。

她喜欢触摸它们柔软的花瓣。

SourceText: There are many things to count here. Count together the trees, butterflies, canes, shoes, and any other groups you notice.
text: 这里有很多东西可以数。一起数一数树木、蝴蝶、手杖、鞋子和其他任何你注意到的组合。

SourceText: Which of these groups can Chat count?
text: 莎特可以数出这些组合中的哪一个？

SourceText: Which of these groups has the most in it and which has the least?
text: 这些组合中哪一个数量最多，哪一个最少？

SourceText:
Chat wished she could see flowers, just once.

"They are lovely," she said to herself.
text:
莎特希望她能看到花朵，一次就好。

"她对自己说：“它们真可爱。”

SourceText: There are five blue flowers and five yellow-orange flowers. How many is that all together?
text: 这里有五朵蓝色的花和五朵黄橙色的花。它们一共是多少？

SourceText: If you include the yellow-orange flower that Chat is holding, that would be one more. What is one more than five?
text: 如果包括莎特手中拿的黄橙色的花，那就是再多一个。比五个再多一个是多少？

SourceText: How many more blue flowers are there than butterflies?
text: 蓝色的花比蝴蝶多多少？

SourceText:
Every day, Chat walked in the garden. She knew her way around.

Today, she raised her head to the skies.
text:
莎特每天都在花园里散步。她熟悉这里的路。

今天，她抬起头仰望天空。

SourceText: Do you see the surprise on her face? What is she surprised about?
text: 你看到她脸上的惊讶吗？她为什么感到惊讶？

SourceText: She can't see the clouds. What can she sense about what is happening?
text: 她看不见云。她能感觉到正在发生什么吗？

SourceText: What is going on in the sky? What do you think is about to happen?
text: 天空中发生了什么？你认为即将发生什么？

SourceText:
Suddenly, she heard thunder and lightning.

"I need to hurry back to the house," Chat thought.
text:
突然间，她听到电闪雷鸣。

“我需要赶快回到房子里去，”莎特想。

SourceText: Have you ever been outside someplace when a storm came up quickly? Did you get wet?
text: 你曾经在暴风雨即将来临时呆在户外吗？你被淋湿了吗？

SourceText: Do you like watching lightning?
text: 你喜欢看闪电吗？

SourceText: Do you find lightning scary or fun when you are outside?
text: 当你在外面时，你觉得闪电是可怕的还是有趣的？

SourceText:
Rain began to fall.

Chat slipped, lost her balance and fell.

She hit her head on a stone.
text:
雨开始下了起来。

莎特脚滑了一下，失去平衡摔倒了。

她的头撞在一颗石头上。

SourceText: Head injuries can be very serious. Do you think Chat will be okay?
text: 头部受伤可能会很严重。你认为莎特会没事吗？

SourceText: There are colors going from yellow to light red to red in this picture. Point to them and describe them.
text: 这张图片中有从黄色到浅红色再到红色的颜色。指出并描述它们。

SourceText: Point to and describe the colors going from yellow to various greens in the picture.
text: 指出并描述图片中从黄色到各种绿色的颜色。

SourceText:
When Chat woke up, there were people around her.

"What happened?" she asked.
text:
当莎特醒来时，周围有许多人。

“发生了什么？”她问道。

SourceText: Count together the people in Chat's family. Did you include Chat?
text: 一起数数莎特的家里有多少人。你包括莎特在内了吗？

SourceText: Can you tell by looking at their faces what each person is feeling?
text: 通过看他们的脸，你能知道每个人的感受吗？

SourceText: There are many colors here! Which of the colors of the rainbow are missing in this picture?
text: 这里有很多颜色！这张图片中缺少彩虹的哪些颜色？

SourceText:
You fell and bumped your head, her father said.

"We are so thankful that you are fine," said her mother.
text:
“你摔倒并且撞了头，”她的父亲说道。

“谢天谢地你没事，”她的母亲说道。

SourceText: There is a fun circular pattern on Chat's bed. Are there more blue circles or red circles?
text: 莎特的床上有一个有趣的圆形图案。这里有更多蓝色的圆形还是红色的圆形？

SourceText: Describe some pretty patterns around where you are.
text: 描述一下你周围的一些漂亮的图案。

SourceText: Find the rectangles in this picture and around where you are.
text: 找到这张图片中和你周围的矩形。

SourceText: Daddy, mummy? asked Chat. She also called the names of her brothers and sisters. "Please, get me a flower." Everyone was surprised.
text: “爸爸，妈妈？”莎特问道。她还喊着她兄弟姐妹的名字。“请给我一朵花。”每个人都很惊讶。

SourceText: Why is everyone surprised?
text: 为什么每个人都感到惊讶？

SourceText: Why is everyone looking so happy?
text: 为什么每个人看起来那么开心？

SourceText: Can you count all the circles on her bed, or is it too many? Can you count other things, such as eyes, arms, or noses?
text: 你能数出她床上的所有圆圈吗，还是太多了？你能数出其他东西，比如眼睛、手臂或者鼻子吗？

SourceText:
Her sister returned with a flower.

Chat held it gently. "It is so lovely," she said.
text:
她的妹妹拿着一朵花回来了。

莎特轻轻地握住它。“它真美，”她说道。

SourceText: Imagine what it is like to see the world for the first time. What would you most want to see?
text: 想象一下第一次看到世界是什么感觉。你会最想看到什么？

SourceText: Which side of her head did she hit on the rock and which side is bandaged? Hmmm ...?
text: 她撞上石头的是头的哪一侧，哪一侧是被包扎着？嗯...？

SourceText: Can you find all the rectangles in this picture? Some of them are a bit sneaky.
text: 你能找到这张图片中的所有矩形吗？其中一些可能有些难找。

SourceText:
Her family looked at one another.

"Chat, can you see the flower?" her mother asked.
text:
她的家人相互看了看。

“莎特，你能看到这朵花吗？”她的母亲问道。

SourceText: What emotion do you see on each person's face?
text: 你能从每个人的脸上看到什么情感？

SourceText: Have you known anyone who suddenly got much better from an illness?
text: 你认识哪个突然从疾病中恢复得很好的人吗？

SourceText: Have you known anyone who was blind?
text: 你认识之前看不见的人吗？

SourceText:
Chat played with the flower in her hand.

"You are all so beautiful, just like this flower," she smiled.
text:
莎特把玩着手中的花。

“你们都很美，就像这朵花一样，”她笑了。

SourceText: Point out some of the new rectangles in this picture.
text: 指出这张图片中的一些新出现的矩形。

SourceText: This is a very happy ending! Did you think the story would end this way?
text: 这是一个非常幸福的结局！你认为故事会以这种方式结束吗？

SourceText: Some people become doctors because they like helping people to have happy endings like this.
text: 有些人成为医生是因为他们喜欢帮助人们拥有这样幸福的结局。

SourceText: My name is Simo.
text: 我的名字是西莫。

SourceText: Count together the different colors of stripes on Simo's shirt.
text: 一起数一数西莫衬衫上不同颜色的条纹。

SourceText: Simo's ball has two colors and is round. A pentagon is a five-sided shape. Point at the dark pentagons on Simo's ball. Do you see any pentagons around you?
text: 西莫的球是一个有两种颜色的圆球。五边形是一个有五条边的形状。指出西莫球上深色的五边形。你周围有没有看到其他五边形？

SourceText: A hexagon is a six-sided shape. Point at the hexagons on the ball. Hexagons are often used in tiling patterns. Do you see any hexagons around you?
text: 六边形是一个有六条边的形状。指着球上的六边形。六边形经常用在瓷砖图案中。你周围有没有看到其他六边形？

SourceText: I have four friends.
text: 我有四个朋友。

SourceText: When you put Simo together with his four friends, how many is that all together? Another way to ask this is: "What is 1 more than 4?"
text: 当你把西莫和他的四个朋友放在一起，一共有多少人？另一种问法是：“4加1等于多少？”

SourceText: How many of them have striped shirts and how many have solid shirts? That means that 2 more than 3 is 5.
text: 他们中有多少人穿条纹衬衫，有多少人穿纯色衬衫？这意味着3加2等于5。

SourceText: That's two different ways of getting five! If you take one more than four you get the same thing as two more than three!
text: 这是两种不同的得到五的方式！如果你比四多一个，你得到的结果就和比三多二一样！

SourceText: Their names are Zizo, Lele, Sisa, and Ayanda.
text: 他们的名字分别是兹左，乐乐，西沙和阿亚达。

SourceText: Can you guess who has which name? We'll learn about each one soon.
text: 你能猜出谁叫什么名字吗？我们很快就会了解每个人。

SourceText: Make up a story about one of them. Perhaps one of them likes cats or going on long walks?
text: 编一个关于其中一个人的故事。也许其中一个喜欢猫或者喜欢长时间散步？

SourceText: Of the four, one of them likes soccer, one likes swimming, another likes hide-and-seek, and one likes reading -- guess which one is which.
text: 在这四个人中，有一个喜欢足球，一个喜欢游泳，一个喜欢捉迷藏，还有一个喜欢阅读 - 猜猜看每个人是谁。

SourceText: My friend Zizo likes to play soccer.
text: 我的朋友兹左喜欢踢足球。

SourceText: Simo and Zizo have soccer in common. Which parts of their clothes are similar to each other?
text: 西莫和兹左在足球方面有共同点。他们的衣服哪些部分相似？

SourceText: Simo and Zizo have stripes on different parts of their clothing. How are their stripes different?
text: 西莫和兹左的衣服上都有条纹，他们的条纹有何不同之处？

SourceText: Zizo seems to like shades of red. Do you? What is your favorite color?
text: 兹左似乎喜欢不同色调的红色。你呢？你最喜欢的颜色是什么？

SourceText: My friend Lele likes to swim.
text: 我的朋友乐乐喜欢游泳。

SourceText: Point at and name the beautiful greens, blue greens, and blues in this picture.
text: 指着并说出这张图片中美丽的绿色、蓝绿色和蓝色。

SourceText: Count the fingers on Lele's left hand. Is she missing a finger or was the artist careless when drawing this picture?
text: 数一数乐乐左手上的手指。她是不是少了一个手指，还是画家在画这幅图时粗心了？

SourceText: It can be dangerous to swim by yourself. To be safe, always swim with a buddy.
text: 一个人独自游泳可能很危险。为了安全起见，要和朋友一起游泳。

SourceText: My friend Sisa likes to play hide-and-seek.
text: 我的朋友西沙喜欢玩捉迷藏。

SourceText: Is Sisa "it" or is Sisa hiding? It is easy to see Sisa. Is Sisa hiding behind the tree?
text: 西沙是"他"吗，还是西沙在躲藏？看起来很容易找到西沙。西沙是不是躲在树后面？

SourceText: They say zebras have stripes to help them hide among trees. Do the stripes on Sisa's shirt make Sisa hard to see?
text: 他们说斑马身上的条纹可以帮助它们在树丛中躲藏。西沙衣服上的条纹是否让他难以被察觉？

SourceText: When playing hide-and-seek, the "it" person usually counts up to some number before looking for people. How high do you think the person should count?
text: 玩捉迷藏时，"他"通常数到某个数字后再找人。你认为应该数到多高？

SourceText: My friend Ayanda likes to read.
text: 我的朋友阿亚达喜欢阅读。

SourceText: The other people picked sports and games they like to play. Is reading a sport or game?
text: 其他人选择了他们喜欢做的运动和游戏。阅读是一项运动或游戏吗？

SourceText: Can you read with other people, or must you read by yourself?
text: 你可以和其他人一起阅读，还是必须独自阅读？

SourceText: Ayanda looks like she enjoys shades of orange. Name some things around you that are shades of orange.
text: 阿亚达似乎喜欢不同色调的橙色。看看你周围有哪些是橙色调的。

SourceText: Me? I like to do the things they like to do.
text: 我呢？我喜欢做他们喜欢做的事。

SourceText: Does Simo like doing all the things, or is he just being agreeable so he can be with everyone?
text: 西莫是不是喜欢做所有的事情，还是他只是为了能和大家在一起而心甘情愿？

SourceText: Did you notice that the stripes on his shirt have changed? How have they changed?
text: 你有没有注意到他衬衫上的条纹已经改变了？它们是如何改变的？

SourceText: Of the four activities, how many do you like?
text: 在这四项活动中，你喜欢哪个？

SourceText: I play soccer with Zizo.
text: 我和兹左一起踢足球。

SourceText: Count the fingers on Zizo's left hand. Is Zizo missing a finger, or was the artist being careless again?
text: 数一数兹左左手上的手指。兹左是不是少了一个手指，还是画家再次粗心了？

SourceText: Some people are born with six fingers on a hand. What is one less than six? What is two less than six? How many fingers seems like a good number to you?
text: 有些人生来左手有六根手指。六减一等于多少？六减二等于多少？你觉得多少根手指是个好数字？

SourceText: Zizo has a solid shirt with striped socks, while Simo has a striped shirt with solid socks. Which way do you like better?
text: 兹左穿的是纯色衬衫配条纹袜子，而西莫穿的是条纹衬衫配纯色袜子。你更喜欢哪种搭配？

SourceText: I swim with Lele.
text: 我和乐乐一起游泳。

SourceText: Count the fingers on Lele's left hand. She has one more finger than she had before! Did she grow a finger?
text: 数一数乐乐左手上的手指。她比之前多了一个手指！她是不是长出了一个手指？

SourceText: Talk about the shades of green in this picture. Some shades are darker, some yellower, and some bluer.
text: 讨论一下这张图片中的绿色调。一些颜色较深，一些更黄，一些更蓝。

SourceText: Lele is swimming with a buddy now -- that is much safer (and more fun)!
text: 乐乐现在和一个伙伴一起游泳 - 这样更安全（而且更有趣）！

SourceText: I play hide-and-seek with Sisa.
text: 我和西沙一起玩捉迷藏。

SourceText: Why did Simo take his shoes off?
text: 为什么西莫脱掉了鞋子？

SourceText: Who do you think is hiding and who is seeking in this picture?
text: 你认为在这张图片中，谁在躲藏而谁在找人？

SourceText: Which of these two can hide better in this place -- whose clothes blend in better with the surrounding colors?
text: 在这两个人中，谁更容易在这个地方躲藏 - 谁的衣服更能融入周围的颜色中？

SourceText: Come, friend, what do you like?
text: 来吧，朋友，你喜欢什么？

SourceText: What are some of your favorite activities?
text: 你喜欢做什么活动？

SourceText: Count together the different activities in this story. Of these, which one would you pick?
text: 一起数一数这个故事中的不同活动。你会选择哪个？

SourceText: There were four activities and you picked your favorite. What is one less than four? Of the remaining activities, which one is your least favorite?
text: 有四个活动，你选了你最喜欢的。四减一等于多少？在剩下的活动中，哪一个是你最不喜欢的？

SourceText: Come, play soccer with us.
text: 来吧，和我们一起踢足球。

SourceText: Are they playing on teams, or are they just kicking the ball around?
text: 他们是不是分成了不同的队伍，还是只是踢球玩？

SourceText: There are five people. Can you split them into two teams with the same number of people?
text: 这里有五个人。你能把他们分成人数相同的两队吗？

SourceText: Whose shoes are the worst for playing soccer?
text: 谁的鞋最不适合踢足球？

SourceText: Come, swim with us.
text: 来吧，和我们一起游泳。

SourceText: There are two pairs of children and one child alone. Can you put them all into pairs so no one is left out?
text: 有两对孩子和一个独自的孩子。你能让他们都成对，没有人被遗漏吗？

SourceText: A number is said to be "odd" if there is no way of splitting that many things into pairs. It is also "odd" if that number of things cannot be split into two equal groups.
text: 如果没有办法将那么多东西分成成对的，这个数字就被称为"奇数"。如果数量的东西不能被分成两个相等的组，它也是"奇数"。

SourceText: Why are the two ideas for "odd" the same? Why is being able to split something into pairs the same as being able to split it into two equal groups?
text: 为什么"奇数"的两个概念是相同的？为什么能够将某物分成成对和能够将其分成两个相等的组是相同的？

SourceText: Come, play hide-and-seek with us.
text: 来吧，和我们一起玩捉迷藏。

SourceText: It looks like Simo is "it." Will he have a hard time finding the other children?
text: 看起来西莫就是"他"。他会很难找到其他孩子吗？

SourceText: Count the children on top of the branch and the number hiding on the other side of the tree. Do they add up to four children?
text: 数一数树枝上的孩子和树的另一侧躲藏的孩子。他们加起来是四个孩子吗？

SourceText: There is one in the tree, one counting, and three behind the tree. You can get five in many ways from this. One way is to start with three, add one more, and then add one more. Think together of other ways to get five.
text: 树上有一个，一个在数数，树后面有三个。你可以用很多种方式从中得到五个。一种方式是从三开始，加一个，然后再加一个。一起想想其他得到五的方式。

SourceText: Come, read with us!
text: 来吧，和我们一起读书！

SourceText: One person is reading alone, and the rest are reading in pairs.
text: 有一个人在独自阅读，其他人两人一组阅读。

SourceText: They all seem very happy together, no matter which activity they do. Do you have some friends you like to do things with?
text: 无论做哪种活动，他们似乎都非常快乐。你有没有一些喜欢一起做事的朋友？

SourceText: One of the children only has four fingers on a hand -- which one?
text: 其中一个孩子只有一只手上有四根手指 - 是哪一个？

SourceText:
Chalew is a horse that pulls a cart.

He carries heavy loads along the gravel roads of Debre Birhan.

He works from morning to evening.
text:
查鲁是一匹拉车的马。

他在德布雷比尔汉的碎石路上负重前行。

他从早到晚地工作。

SourceText: Chalew pulls heavy loads and does a difficult job. Have you seen any animals that have to do work?
text: 查鲁拉着沉重的负荷，做着一项艰难的工作。你见过任何需要工作的动物吗？

SourceText: A rectangle is a shape with four straight sides like the shape of this page. Point out some shapes in this picture that are rectangles and some that are round.
text: 矩形是一个有四条直边的形状，就像本页纸张的形状一样。指出这张图片中的一些矩形和一些圆形的形状。

SourceText: How many rectangles can you find in the place where you are now?
text: 在你现在所处的位置，你能找到多少个矩形？

SourceText:
Chalew does not get enough time to rest.

He does not get enough food to eat.

The driver of the cart beats him to go faster.
text:
查鲁没有充足的时间休息。

他没有足够的食物可以吃。

车夫通过鞭打催促他走得更快。

SourceText: How do you feel about the way the driver treats Chalew?
text: 你对车夫对待查鲁的方式有什么感想？

SourceText: What are some ways to treat animals, or people, to try to get them to do what you want? For people, you can say "please," and that works sometimes.
text: 对待动物或人类，可以尝试通过哪些方法使他们按照你的意愿行动？对于人类，你可以说“请”，这样有时会奏效。

SourceText: What makes you want to do things for other people?
text: 是什么让你愿意为别人做事？

SourceText:
One day, all the cart drivers gathered for a funeral.

The cart horses were left to graze in a nearby field.

They began to talk about their terrible conditions.
text:
有一天，所有的车夫因为一场葬礼而聚集。

拉车的马被留在附近的田地里吃草。

他们开始谈论他们糟糕的境况。

SourceText: Count the number of people and the number of horses. Are there more people or horses? How many more?
text: 数一数人的数量和马匹的数量。是人多还是马多？多了多少？

SourceText: Use skip counting by 2's to count how many legs the people have. Can you skip count that high?
text: 通过以2为单位跳着数，计算这些人有多少条腿。你能跳数到那么大的数字吗？

SourceText: What would you skip count by to count the number of legs the horses have? That's a pretty big number. Can you skip count that high?
text: 为了计算马有多少条腿，你会以哪个数为单位跳着数？这是一个相当大的数字，你能跳数到那么多吗？

SourceText:
"My harness doesn't fit me. It is too tight and cuts my skin," said one horse.

"Me too, me too," another agreed.
text:
“我的马具不合适。它太紧了，划破了我的皮肤。”一匹马说道。

我也是，我也是，"另一匹附和道。

SourceText: How do real horses talk with each other?
text: 现实的马是如何交流的？

SourceText: Which parts of a horse come in pairs, and which don't?
text: 马的哪些部位是成对出现的，哪些不是？

SourceText: The body parts that pair up show up on opposite sides of the horse's body. Can you think of other animals like that? Can you think of any that aren't like that?
text: 成对的身体部位出现在马身体的对称两侧。你能想到其他也类似这样的动物？你能想到一些不是这样的动物吗？

SourceText:
An old horse spoke. "I'm almost lame because of the nails they hammer into my hooves."

More horses nodded in agreement.
text:
一匹老马说道：“我几乎瘸了，就是因为他们钉进蹄子里的这些钉子。” 

更多的马点头表示同意。

SourceText: Why do you think the owners have been so bad to the horses? Were the owners mean on purpose and did they not realize what they were doing?
text: 你认为车夫们为什么对马这么糟糕？这些车夫是故意的，还是他们没有意识到他们在做什么？

SourceText: What do you think the horses should do about being treated so badly?
text: 你认为马应该如何应对被这般虐待？

SourceText: There are five horses. How many tails, ears, and legs are there? Did you skip count to find the ears and legs, or did you start with the number of tails and double things?
text: 这是五匹马。有多少尾巴、耳朵和腿？你是通过跳数来找出耳朵和腿的数量，还是从尾巴的数量开始然后翻倍计算的？

SourceText:
"We work very hard, but most of our owners treat us badly. Many do not know how to look after us," said Chalew.

All of the horses agreed.
text:
“我们工作很努力，但大多数主人都对我们很差。很多人不知道如何照顾我们。”查鲁说道。

所有的马都表示同意。

SourceText: What do you think Chalew is going to suggest that they do about their bad situation?
text: 你认为查鲁会建议他们怎么应对糟糕的处境？

SourceText: In this picture, the five horses are paired up into two pairs with one left over. Is there any way to pair these five horses into pairs all at the same time? When there are a number of things that can't all be paired up, that's called on odd number.
text: 在这张图片中，五匹马被分成了两对和单独的一匹。有没有办法同时让这五匹马两两成对？ 当一定数量的东西无法全部成对时，这个数就是奇数。

SourceText: Think of some other odd numbers. When you have two people and an odd number of things, it is impossible to give them the same number, so you can't share the things equally.
text: 想一想一些其他的奇数。当你有两个人和奇数件东西时，不可能给每个人相同的数量，因此你无法平均分享这些东西。

SourceText:
"We need better conditions. Let's go on strike!" declared Chalew. The horses cheered!

They decided to stay in the field until the cart drivers agreed to change.
text:
“我们需要更好的条件。让我们罢工吧！”查鲁宣布。马儿们欢呼起来！

他们决定留在田地里，直到车夫们同意做出改变。

SourceText: A strike occurs when a group of workers refuse to work and insist on getting treated better by their company. People sometimes go on strike to get better working conditions, and sometimes they do it to get paid more.
text: 罢工是指一群工人拒绝工作，并坚持要求公司更好地对待他们。人们有时会罢工以改善工作条件，有时则是为了获得更高的工资。

SourceText: What is risky for a person when they strike? (They might not get paid for a long time and they might lose their job.)
text: 罢工时工人会面临什么风险？（他们可能长时间得不到工资，还可能失去工作。）

SourceText: Numbers that can be pair up are called even numbers. There are six horses in this picture. Can you pair them all up? Is six an odd or even number?
text: 可以被两个两个配成对的数字称为偶数。这张图中有六匹马。你能把它们全部配成对吗？六是奇数还是偶数？

SourceText:
The cart drivers did not know what to do.

"I can get another horse," boasted one driver.

But most of the drivers needed their horses to earn a living.
text:
车夫们不知道该怎么办。

“我可以找到另一匹马。”一位车夫夸口道。

但是大多数车夫需要他们的马来谋生。

SourceText: How many people are in this picture? If you take away (subtract off) the two who are sitting down, how many are standing up?
text: 这张图片里有多少人？如果去掉（减去）那两个坐着的人，站着的有多少人？

SourceText: Are there an odd or even number of people in the room? Can they be split into two equal groups? If you can, it's an even number and otherwise it's an odd number.
text: 房间里的人数是奇数还是偶数？他们能被分成相等的两组吗？如果可以，那就是偶数，否则是奇数。

SourceText: What worries the owners? Are they worried about how the horses feel or are they worried about their businesses?
text: 是什么让车夫们担心？他们是担心马的感受，还是担心他们的生意？

SourceText:
The drivers held a meeting to discuss the strike. They argued for a long time.

"Maybe the horses are right," said one man. "Why should they get better conditions?" asked another.
text:
车夫们召开了一次会来议讨论罢工事件。他们争论了很长时间。

“也许马是对的。”一个人说道。“为什么他们应该得到更好的条件呢？”另一个人问道。

SourceText: Estimate how many people are crowded into the room and then count, as best you can, how people there are. An estimate is an educated guess based on partial information, such as a quick glance.
text: 估算一下有多少人挤在房间里，然后尽量数出人数。估算是一种有根据的猜测，它基于不完整的信息，比如一个快速的扫视。

SourceText: Making estimates can be a fun game. When you're walking around, have everyone make an estimate of a group of things, then carefully count how many there are, and see who is closest to the right answer.
text: 进行估算可以是一场有趣的游戏。当你四处走动时，让每个人对一组物品进行估算，然后仔细数一下有多少，看看谁最接近正确答案。

SourceText: How do the owners know what the horses want? Did the horses talk to them?
text: 车夫们是怎么知道马想要什么的？马跟他们说话了吗？

SourceText:
The horses' strike spread from the town of Debre Birhan across Ethiopia.

Nearly three million horses refused to work.

"We have had enough! Treat us fairly!" they said.
text:
马匹的罢工从德布雷比尔汉镇蔓延整个埃塞俄比亚。

将近三百万匹马拒绝工作。

“我们受够了！得公平对待我们！”他们说道。

SourceText: Three million is a lot of horses! Can you think of something around you that there are more than one hundred of? More than a thousand?
text: 三百万匹马真的非常多！你能想到你周围某种有一百个以上的东西吗？一千个以上的东西呢？

SourceText: Have you heard of working people going on strike near you? Did the strike work, or did the strikers give up before getting what they wanted?
text: 你听说过你附近有工人罢工吗？罢工是成功了，还是罢工者在得到他们想要的之前放弃了？

SourceText: What do you do when you really want something and it doesn't seem like you are going to get it? Does it work?
text: 当你真的想要某样东西却似乎无法得到时，你会怎么做？那个方法有效吗？

SourceText:
So, the cart drivers were forced to change.

They agreed to better conditions and fair treatment for all horses.

They learned how to look after the horses, and keep them healthy.
text:
因此，车夫们被迫做出改变。

他们同意为所有马提供更好的条件和公平的对待。

他们学会了如何照顾马匹，并保持它们的健康。

SourceText: Taking better care of the horses is the right thing to do for the horses, and it's the smart thing to do to get the horses to do better work!
text: 更好地照顾马匹是对待马的正确方式，也是让马更好地工作的明智之举！

SourceText: If it's a good idea to take better care of the horses, why weren't the drivers doing this all along?
text: 如果更好地照顾马匹一是个好主意，为什么车夫们一直没有这样做呢？

SourceText: Sometimes people do something that seems easy, but is a bad idea in the long run. Have you ever put off doing something that you wished you hadn't?
text: 有时人们会做一些看起来容易的事，其实从长远来看这是不明智的想法。你有曾经拖延做，但是后来后悔了的事情吗？

SourceText:
Slowly, the horses' lives improved.

They got enough food and rest. Their harnesses fitted. They got better shoes for their hooves.

Old Chalew became a hero to all horses!
text:
慢慢地，马的生活得以改善。

他们得到了充足的食物和休息。他们的挽具合身。他们的蹄子配上了更好的蹄铁。

老查鲁成为全体马匹的英雄！

SourceText: Chalew took a risk and helped an important cause. Can you think of a person who has done that?
text: 查鲁冒险帮助了一个重要的事业。你能想到一个这样做的人吗?

SourceText: Have you ever gone out of your way to help a person or group of people who needed help? Did you make a difference for them?
text: 你是否曾经尽心尽力地帮助过需要帮助的某一个或某一群人？你为他们带来改变了吗？

SourceText: How does it feel when you help others?
text: 帮助他人时你是什么感觉？

SourceText: How many legs do two ladybugs have?
text: 两只瓢虫有多少条腿？

SourceText: Skip counting is counting by steps bigger than 1. You can skip count these legs by 6's by counting 6, 12. You can also skip count by 3's using the sides of their bodies 3, 6, 9, 12.
text: 间隔计数是以大于1的间隔统计。你可以通过6的间隔计数这些腿，统计6，12。你也可以通过他们身体的两侧以3的间隔计数，统计3，6，9，12。

SourceText: You can skip count to 12 in steps of 3 and 6. Can you think of other ways to skip count to 12? Which ways work (1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 12) and which ways don't (5, 7, 8, 9, 10, 11)?
text: 你可以以3和6的来间隔计数到12。您能想到统计到12的其他方法吗？哪些方法有效(1，2，3，4，6，12)，哪些方法无效(5，7，8，9，10，11)？

SourceText: Count together the dots on each ladybug's back. Have you seen ladybugs around where you live -- did they have more or fewer dots than these?
text: 一起统计每只瓢虫背上的点。你在居住的地方见过瓢虫吗——它们的点比这些多还是少？

SourceText: How many wings do four birds have?
text: 四只鸟有多少只翅膀？

SourceText: Skip count the wings by counting by 2's -- one 2 for each bird.
text: 以2的间隔来计数每只鸟的翅膀。

SourceText: Skip count the wings by counting the four left wings and then the four right wings. It's fun that you get the same answer whether you skip by 2's or 4's!
text: 先数四只左翼，再数四只右翼的翅膀。有趣的是，无论你按2还是4跳跃计数，得到的答案都是相同的！

SourceText: If the bird in the sky flies away, how many of the four birds will remain?
text: 如果天空中的一只鸟飞走了，还剩下几只鸟？

SourceText: How many horns do three rhinos have?
text: 三头犀牛有多少只角？

SourceText: Each rhino has two horns, a big one and a small one. Skip count their horns by 2's and 3's.
text: 每头犀牛有两只角，一大一小。以2和3的间隔来数它们的角。

SourceText: How would you skip count to find out how many feet they have?
text: 你将如何用间隔计数来找出它们有多少只脚？

SourceText: Each rhino has twice as many feet as horns. Take the total number of horns and double that to get the total number of feet.
text: 每头犀牛的脚是角的两倍。将角的总数加倍即可得到脚的总数。

SourceText: How many trunks do five elephants have?
text: 五头大象有多少条象鼻？

SourceText: Let's count trunks, tails, tusks, and ears. Counting tails and trunks is simple -- what number do you get?
text: 让我们来数一数象鼻、尾巴、长牙和耳朵。数尾巴和长牙很简单——你得到了多少？

SourceText: Each elephant has two tusks and two ears. Which do you like better -- skip counting these by 2's or by 5's?
text: 每头大象有两只长牙和两只耳朵。你更喜欢以2或5的间隔来数它们吗？

SourceText: There are four big elephants and one baby elephant. How much is four plus one more?
text: 有四头成年大象和一头小象。四加一是多少？

SourceText: How many ears do seven dogs have?
text: 七只狗有多少只耳朵？

SourceText: Did you count the ears by 1's, 2's, or 7's?
text: 你是以1、2还是7为间隔来数耳朵的吗？

SourceText: There are 14 ears. We can skip count to 14 by 1's, 2's, and 7's. Are there any other step sizes that work for counting to 14?
text: 有14只耳朵。我们可以以1、2和7的间隔计数到14。还有其他适合统计到14的间隔吗？

SourceText: There are four dogs in the top group and three in the bottom. What do you get when put four dogs together with three more?
text: 顶端组有四只狗，底部组有三只。把四只狗和另外三只狗放在一起是多少？

SourceText: How many tails do three monkeys have?
text: 三只猴子有多少条尾巴？

SourceText: Let's count the tails, eyes, and feet. How many tails do you count?
text: 让我们统计尾巴、眼睛和脚。您统计了多少条尾巴？

SourceText: Would you count the eyes two at a time, two for each monkey, or would you count them three at a time, which is doubling the number of monkeys?
text: 你会以每只猴子两只眼睛的方式，即每只猴子两只，还是以猴子数量的两倍的方式统计眼睛？

SourceText: You have many choices for skip counting their feet. What are your choices and which one would you choose to use?
text: 你有很多选择来间隔计数它们的脚。你的选择是什么？您会选择哪一种？

SourceText: How many eyes do six cats have?
text: 六只猫有多少只眼睛？

SourceText: Wow, these cats are a bit creepy! Did you skip count the eyes by 2's or 6's?
text: 哇，这些猫有点吓人！你是以2还是6的间隔计数眼睛的？

SourceText: How many whiskers does each cat have? Can you count high enough to skip count all the whiskers?
text: 每只猫有多少根须？你能统计足够高的数字来间隔计数所有的须吗？

SourceText: Can you skip count high enough to count all the feet?
text: 你能统计足够高的数字来统计所有的脚吗？

SourceText: How many legs does one worm have?
text: 一条蠕虫有多少条腿？

SourceText: Can you count all those legs, or is it too tricky to see or too high to count?
text: 你能统计所有那些腿吗，或者很难看清或统计太高？

SourceText: Think of some other things that are just too many to count.
text: 再想想其他太多无法统计的东西。

SourceText: Skip counting can be fun because it gets you to the answer much more quickly than counting by 1's. It's also fun to discover the different step sizes that give you the same answer.
text: 间隔计数可以很有趣，因为它可以比1的统计快得多地得到答案。 发现不同的间隔也很有趣，会给你相同的答案。

SourceText: Mod the toad was tired of living in water.
text: 莫德蛤蟆厌倦了生活在水中的日子。

SourceText: Why do you think Mod was tired of water?
text: 你觉得莫德蛤蟆为什么会厌倦生活在水中的日子？

SourceText: Mod has four "fingers" on each leg. Who has more fingers -- you or Mod? How many more?
text: 莫德蛤蟆每条腿上有四根“手指”。你和莫德蛤蟆比一比，谁有跟多手指？多几根手指呢？

SourceText: With four fingers on each leg, how many fingers does Mod have all together? You can count them by 1's, 2's, or 4's. Is it too high for you to count?
text: 如果莫德蛤蟆每条腿有四根手指，那么莫德蛤蟆一共有多少根手指？你可以以一或二或四为单位数一数。怎么样？这对你来说是否太难数呢？

SourceText: Be careful, said the turtle. "Your skin will dry out."
text: “小心一点，”乌龟警告，“你的皮肤会变得很干燥。”

SourceText: Why don't turtles worry about their skin drying out?
text: 乌龟为什么不怕自己的皮肤会变得很干燥呢？

SourceText: Do you think a big turtle would be able to climb onto a narrow log like that?
text: 你认为一只大乌龟能够顺利的爬上狭窄的木杆吗？

SourceText: Do you think toads and turtles talk to each other?
text: 你觉得蛤蟆和乌龟会跟彼此互相交流吗？

SourceText: But Mod was curious. She hopped away.
text: 但是莫德蛤蟆非常好奇。所以她蹦蹦跳跳的离开了。

SourceText: Mod looks very excited to be going on an adventure!
text: 莫德蛤蟆看起来非常兴奋， 她马上就要开始冒险的旅途了！

SourceText: Have you ever done something even though you were told it was a bad idea? Were you glad you did it?
text: 小朋友们你是否做了一些长辈们说不可以做或者是个坏主意的事情呢？做完后感觉怎么样 ？

SourceText: Do you think Mod had ever been out of the river before? Are there places you would like to explore?
text: 你觉得莫德蛤蟆是否曾经离开过河流吗？有那些地方是你想要去探索的吗？

SourceText: She looked all around.
text: 她四处张望，左看右看。

SourceText: Count the trees in the background behind Mod.
text: 请数一数莫德蛤蟆身后的森林里到底有几棵树。

SourceText: Is it easier for you to count the trees one at a time or to count them by 2's?
text: 对你来说一颗一颗数树比较容易还是以二为单位数比较容易？

SourceText: Notice the shades of colors. Mod's colors go from light yellow to dark brown. The grass goes from very light yellow to the yellow greens of the tree tops to the darker shades directly beneath the tree canopy.
text: 请注意颜色变化的层次。莫德蛤蟆身上的颜色从淡黄色慢慢变到深棕色。周围的草却从浅黄色渐渐变成跟树稍上的黄绿色，然后又渐渐的变成跟树冠上的叶子一样的深绿色。

SourceText: She met a purple chameleon next to a puddle of water.
text: 她在水坑旁边遇到了一只紫色的变色龙。

SourceText: Mod looks surprised to see the chameleon!
text: 莫德蛤蟆遇到了变色龙非常惊讶，都惊呆了！

SourceText: Why is the chameleon holding that bug? Do you eat insects sometimes?
text: 变色龙为什么手里拿着一只虫子？你们会偶尔吃虫子吗？

SourceText: Count the bugs flying around. If you add one more for the one the chameleon is holding, how many does that make in total?
text: 请数一数在空中飞来飞去的小虫。加上变色龙手里拿着的小虫，图中一共有多少只小虫？

SourceText: The chameleon started turning pink! Mod jumped away.
text: 变色龙身上的颜色突然换成粉红色！莫德蛤蟆吓得的马上转身就跳走。

SourceText: Chameleons and some other animals can change colors to blend in.
text: 一些动物是可以像变色龙一样换变颜色来融入周围的环境。

SourceText: Do you think this chameleon is blending in?
text: 你觉得这只变色龙是在融入周围的环境吗？

SourceText: Do you think Mod knew the chameleon could change colors? Mod looks surprised and afraid!
text: 对你来说，你觉得莫德蛤蟆知道变色龙能换颜色吗？莫德蛤蟆看起来又惊又怕！

SourceText: Then she saw a hyena starting a fire.
text: 过了一会儿，她看见了一只鬣狗在生火。

SourceText: It's silly to think that hyenas go around starting fires with torches.
text: 她一想到鬣狗可以用火把生火，就觉得很荒谬也很可笑。

SourceText: If they could do it, why would they want to?
text: 如果鬣狗可以自己用火把生火，你觉得他们为什么要这么做呢？

SourceText: Hyenas are sometimes described as bad characters in stories. Do you think hyenas would go to all the trouble to start a fire just to be mean?
text: 鬣狗有时候在一些故事中被描述为成坏人角色。你觉得鬣狗会为了想要刻意伤害他人而故意生火吗？

SourceText: The fire spread around Mod. She was afraid.
text: 火势蔓延到莫德蛤蟆的附近，她非常害怕。

SourceText: Have you ever seen or been near a big wildfire? If so, how did you feel about it?
text: 你是否曾经很看过或者很靠近野火？如果是的，哪你感觉如何？

SourceText: Did Mod pick a good place to hide?
text: 你觉得莫德蛤蟆选了一个好的隐藏点来躲起来吗？

SourceText: What do you think will happen to Mod -- is Mod in a safe place?
text: 你觉得莫德蛤蟆会怎么样？她是否在一个安全的地方？

SourceText: The fire burned her skin. She jumped back, into the puddle.
text: 莫德蛤蟆被火烧了。她被火烧伤后，急忙跳进水坑里。

SourceText: Getting burned hurts a lot! Have you ever been burned or known someone who was?
text: 被火烧会很疼！你曾经被火烧烧伤过或者认识被曾经被火烧伤的人吗？

SourceText: Why did Mod cover her eyes?
text: 莫德蛤蟆为什么用手捂住了她的双眼？

SourceText: Finding something cool to put on your wound is often a very good idea to stop further burning inside the wound.
text: 如果你被火烧了，你一定要找到冷的东西放在被火烧了的地方。这会停止伤口进一步被灼伤。

SourceText: But her skin was already full of blisters.
text: 但是，她的皮肤已经起了满满是水泡。

SourceText: When Mod splashed, what shape were the ripples in the water around where Mod went in?
text: 莫德蛤蟆进水里的时候水波是什么形状的，当她溅起水花时水面上的涟漪是什么形状？

SourceText: Have you ever watched the ripples a stone makes when it falls into quiet water?
text: 你见过石头掉进水里面的涟漪吗？

SourceText: Those ripples are circles that have a common center point. Such circles are called concentric.
text: 那些涟漪的圆圈都有同样的中心点。这些圆圈叫做同心圆。

SourceText: Mod found a home under a rock. Her new skin was dry and rough.
text: 莫德蛤蟆在石头下面找到一个新家。她新长出来的皮肤又干燥又粗糙。

SourceText: Even if things did not go so well, she had some interesting experiences. Do you think Mod regrets her adventure?
text: 虽然有一些事情进展不太顺利，但是她确实经历一些有趣的的事故。对你来说，你觉得莫德蛤蟆后悔她的冒险记吗？

SourceText: Do you think toads have homes with doors, windows, and tables?
text: 你觉得蛤蟆住在有门口、窗户和桌子的家吗？

SourceText: It looks like Mod has three fingers now. Is that more or less than she had before?
text: 现在看起来莫德蛤蟆只有三跟手指了。那比她以前的手指比较多还是比较少？

SourceText: Now only frogs have smooth skin and live near water.
text: 青蛙不但有光滑的皮肤也住在离开水的地方很近。

SourceText: Did you know that there are differences between frogs and toads?
text: 你之前知道青蛙和蛤蟆有什么区别吗？

SourceText: Have you ever seen a frog or toad? Could you tell which one it was?
text: 你曾经看见了青蛙和者蛤蟆吗？你能分辨出是青蛙或者蛤蟆吗？

SourceText: Have you ever gone to a pond, river, or lake to explore water life?
text: 你曾经去过池塘，河边或者湖去探索水中的生物吗？

SourceText: A long time ago, there was a greedy hyena.
text: 很久以前，有一只贪婪的土狼。

SourceText: These houses seem very smoky. How many houses do you see in Hyena's village?
text: 这些房子看起来在烟熏。你看到土狼村里有多少所房子？

SourceText: Each house is round with round roof going up to a point. Each roof is in the shape of a cone. Do you see any cone-shaped things around you?
text: 每所房子都是圆形的，圆形的房顶向上延伸到一个点。每个屋顶的形状都是一个圆锥体。你周围看到任何圆锥体形状的东西吗？

SourceText: Count the toes on each of Hyena's legs. Hyenas have the same number of toes on all their legs -- is that what the picture shows?
text: 数一下土狼每条腿上的脚趾。土狼在它所有的腿上有相同数量的脚趾——图片是这样显示的吗？

SourceText: There was also Tortoise. Hyena and Tortoise were friends.
text: 还有乌龟。土狼和乌龟是朋友。

SourceText: How many houses are in Tortoise's village? How many houses are in the two villages combined?
text: 乌龟村里有多少所房子？两个村庄一共有多少所房子？

SourceText: Which village has more houses, or are they equal?
text: 哪个村庄的房屋更多，它们相等吗？

SourceText: What is different about the roofs in Tortoise/s village compared to Hyena's village? Why do you suppose that is?
text: 与土狼村相比，乌龟村的屋顶有什么不同？你认为为什么会这样？

SourceText: Hyena told Tortoise, "Let us search for honey."
text: 土狼对乌龟说：“我们去寻找蜂蜜吧。”

SourceText: Compare the drawing of the houses with the first page. Whose house are they in front of?
text: 与第一页相比，画中的房子如何？他们在谁的房子前面？

SourceText: Hyena and Tortoise seem like unlikely friends. What do you think will happen to their friendship by the end of the story?
text: 土狼和乌龟看起来是不太可能的朋友。你认为在故事结束时他们的友谊会发生什么？

SourceText: Do you have friends that are different from you? Do your differences help make your friendship weaker or stronger?
text: 你有和你不同的朋友吗？你们之间的差异会让你们的友谊更弱还是更强？

SourceText: Hyena ran fast. Tortoise followed slowly. He was afraid.
text: 土狼跑得很快。乌龟慢慢地跟着。他很害怕。

SourceText: These animals travel at very different speeds. Have you gone for a walk with someone who is a lot faster or slower than you? How did the two of you work out having two different speeds?
text: 这些动物的速度非常不同。你是否和比你快得多或慢得多的人一起散步过？你们两个不同速度的人是如何配合的？

SourceText: Real hyenas and tortoises don't look like these two. What are the differences? Those differences will be important later in the story!
text: 真实的土狼和乌龟不像这两个。有什么不同之处？那些差异在后面的故事中很重要！

SourceText: Tortoise is looking backward. What is Tortoise looking for?
text: 乌龟正在向后看。乌龟在寻找什么？

SourceText: They crossed a river. They got wet.
text: 他们渡过了一条河。他们都湿透了。

SourceText: "They got wet" seems like an understatement for how they look in the picture. Hyenas are excellent swimmers, so it is surprising that Hyena looks so unhappy.
text: “他们都湿了”似乎低估了图片中他们的样子。土狼是出色的游泳者，所以土狼看起来这么不高兴让人惊讶。

SourceText: Do you like swimming? Have you ever gone swimming in rivers or other natural bodies of water?
text: 你喜欢游泳吗？你是否曾经在河流或其他天然水体中游过泳？

SourceText: Which direction do you think the water is flowing? How can you tell?
text: 你认为水流的方向是什么？你如何判断的？

SourceText: Then they saw beehives. Hyena ran to the hives.
text: 然后他们看到了蜂房。土狼跑向蜂房。

SourceText: There are a lot of hives in those trees. Sometimes a swarm will fly around looking for a new home. Have you ever seen a swarm of bees?
text: 那些树上有很多蜂房。有时会有一群蜜蜂到处飞找新家。你见过蜂群吗？

SourceText: Do you like bees or are you afraid of them? What are some things you are afraid of?
text: 你喜欢蜜蜂还是害怕它们？你害怕的东西有哪些？

SourceText: Hyena is pictured with four toes on his front legs and three toes on his back legs. How many more fingers do you have on your arms? How many more toes do you have on your legs?
text: 图片中显示土狼在前腿有四个脚趾，后腿有三个脚趾。你的手臂上比它多几个手指？你的腿上比它多几个脚趾？

SourceText: Hyena told Tortoise, "Climb up and get the beehive."
text: 土狼对乌龟说：“爬上去拿蜂巢。”

SourceText: It is difficult to imagine Tortoise climbing a tree. Why would Hyena be a better tree climber than Tortoise?
text: 很难想象乌龟爬树。为什么土狼比乌龟更适合爬树？

SourceText: Why did Hyena tell Tortoise to climb up and get the beehive?
text: 土狼为什么让乌龟爬上去拿蜂巢？

SourceText: A hexagon is a shape with six straight sides. If the sides are all the same length, it is called a regular hexagon. Each of the little cells in a beehive is a regular hexagon. Do you know of any designs around you that are made of hexagons?
text: 六边形是一种有六条直边的形状。如果所有的边长度都相同，则称为正六边形。蜂巢中的每个小室都是正六边形。你知道周围有任何由六边形制成的设计吗？

SourceText: Tortoise climbed slowly. Hyena was angry. He shouted at Tortoise.
text: 乌龟缓慢地爬。土狼很生气。他对乌龟大喊大叫。

SourceText: Why was Hyena shouting? Did Hyena's shouting help Tortoise climb the tree?
text: 土狼为什么大喊大叫？土狼的大喊大叫是否帮助乌龟爬树？

SourceText: Do you ever get angry and start shouting? Did your shouting help make the situation better?
text: 你是否曾经生气大喊大叫过？你的大喊大叫是否有助于改善情况？

SourceText: Tiles that are regular hexagons fit together to make beautiful tile floors and walls. Tiles in the shape of squares (shapes with four equal straight sides and square corners) fit together well too. Describe any other tiling patterns on floors or walls that you have seen.
text: 正六边形的瓷砖拼在一起可以制造出非常漂亮的瓷砖地板和墙壁。 正方形(四条相等的直边和平直角的形状) 的瓷砖也可以很好地拼在一起。描述你见过的地板或墙壁上的任何其他平铺图案。

SourceText: Tortoise touched the beehive. Bees swarmed in the air.
text: 乌龟碰到了蜂巢。蜜蜂在空中成群结队。

SourceText: Why was Tortoise safe from the bees and Hyena was not?
text: 为什么乌龟可以安全避开蜜蜂而土狼却不能？

SourceText: An estimate is an educated guess when there are too many things to count easily. What is your estimate of how many bees there are?
text: 当数量太多难以轻易统计时，估算是一个修正过的猜测。你对蜜蜂数量的估算是多少？

SourceText: Do your best to count the bees. How far off was your quick estimate?
text: 尽你最大努力数蜜蜂。你的快速估算有多少？

SourceText: Tortoise fell. The beehive fell on him. Hyena licked the honey.
text: 乌龟掉了下来。蜂巢落在他身上。土狼舔蜂蜜。

SourceText: Hyena was so focused on the honey that he didn't help Tortoise. Can you think of a time you were so focused on one thing that you completely forgot something else you should have done?
text: 土狼太专注于蜂蜜，以至于没有帮助乌龟。你能想到自己曾经因为过于专注于一件事情而完全忘记了本应该做的另一件事情的时候吗？

SourceText: Hyena should have helped his friend. Is Hyena a very good friend?
text: 土狼应该帮助他的朋友。土狼是一个很好的朋友吗？

SourceText: Do you think this page shows more or fewer bees than on the last page?
text: 你认为这一页显示的蜜蜂比上一页更多还是更少？

SourceText: The bees stung Hyena. He ran. The bees followed him.
text: 蜜蜂蜇了土狼。他跑了。蜜蜂追着他。

SourceText: Why did the bees chase and sting Hyena?
text: 为什么蜜蜂追逐和蜇土狼？

SourceText: A beehive is the home for the bees. Is it okay for people to take honey from beehives, or should we leave their homes untouched?
text: 蜂巢是蜜蜂的家。采取蜂巢中的蜂蜜对人类来说可以吗，还是我们应该离开它们的家不动呢？

SourceText: Have you ever tried to outrun a bee or some other stinging insect? Were you able to do it?
text: 你是否曾经试图躲避蜜蜂或其他蜇人的昆虫？你做到了吗？

SourceText: Hyena ran into the river. The bees still followed him.
text: 土狼跑进河里。蜜蜂仍在追赶他。

SourceText: Why did the Hyena go into the river? Did it work?
text: 土狼为什么进入河中？这起作用了吗？

SourceText: The bees can't go into the water, but Hyena can't stay under the water for long. What do you think Hyena should do?
text: 蜜蜂不能进入水中，但土狼也不能在水下停留很久。你认为土狼应该做什么？

SourceText: Poor Hyena must be miserable. Have you ever had a bee sting or some other kind of sting? If so, did it hurt a lot?
text: 可怜的土狼一定很痛苦。你是否曾经被蜜蜂蜇过或其他蜇伤？如果有，疼痛很厉害吗？

SourceText: The beehive and the honey dried on Tortoise's back.
text: 蜂巢和蜂蜜在乌龟背上。

SourceText: All the bees went after Hyena and left Tortoise alone.
text: 所有的蜜蜂都追着土狼，留下乌龟独自一人。

SourceText: Tortoise looks pretty safe sitting quietly under that layer of drying honey. Do you have a quiet place where you feel safe and peaceful? Perhaps it is a place no one else knows about.
text: 乌龟坐在那里，无忧无虑地坐在那层干燥的蜂蜜下面。你有一个平静安全的地方吗？也许是没有人知道的地方。

SourceText: What does his face tell you about how he is feeling?
text: 他的脸告诉你他的感觉如何？

SourceText: Tortoise got a shell to protect himself. He went home.
text: 乌龟有一个保护自己的壳。他回家了。

SourceText: The honey dried on Tortoise in a beautiful pattern. Can you think of some interesting natural patterns around you?
text: 蜂蜜在乌龟身上干成了漂亮的图案。你能想到周围一些有趣的自然图案吗？

SourceText: People also make a lot of patterns when they build things. Tiles are often laid out to make interesting designs. Do you see any any tiling patterns near you?
text: 人们在建造东西时也制造了很多图案。 瓷砖往往按一定模式铺设以制作有趣的设计。在你附近有没有看到任何平铺图案？

SourceText: What do you think -- how easy is it to sit in that chair with a big shell on your back?
text: 你认为背着大壳坐在那张椅子上有多难？

SourceText: The stings caused patches on Hyena's body.
text: 蜇伤在土狼身上造成了斑点。

SourceText: Now Hyena has lots of spots on him, just like hyenas we see today.
text: 现在土狼身上有很多斑点，就像我们今天看到的土狼。

SourceText: Make a quick estimate how many spots he has and then try to count them. How close was your estimate?
text: 快速估计他有多少斑点，然后尝试计算。你的估算有多接近？

SourceText: Making quick estimates is a fun game two people can play. Whose estimate will be the closest?
text: 快速估算是一个两个人可以玩的有趣游戏。谁的估算会最接近？

SourceText: Tortoise and Hyena are no longer friends.
text: 乌龟和土狼不再是朋友了。

SourceText: Tortoise and Hyena always seemed like unlikely friends. What happened in the story that caused them to stop being friends?
text: 乌龟和土狼似乎一直是不太可能的朋友。故事中发生了什么导致他们不再是朋友？

SourceText: Have you ever had something that caused you to stop being friends with someone?
text: 你是否曾经有过某些事情导致你和某人不再是朋友？

SourceText: Do you think Tortoise and Hyena will return to being friends someday?
text: 你认为乌龟和土狼以后会再次成为朋友吗？

SourceText: I wonder if there's another me somewhere in the world.
text: 我常想到底在这个·世界上是否有另一个像我长得一模一样的人。

SourceText: What do you think -- is there another animal just like this one somewhere in the world?
text: 你是否觉得在世界上的另一个地方也有一只和这只长得一模一样的动物？

SourceText: Do you think there's another person just like you?
text: 你觉得世界上是否有另一个人和你一模一样？

SourceText: There are five trees in this picture. If you take away the one by itself on one side, how many trees are there on the other side? What is one less than five?
text: 这张图片上有五棵树。如果把旁边的那棵树拿走，剩下多少棵树？五减一等于多少？

SourceText: Who looks the same.
text: 谁看起来长得一模一样。

SourceText: When you look in a mirror or in water, the image is almost the same as how you look. How is it different and how is it the same?
text: 当你站在照镜子前·或望着水中的倒影，照镜子中你和水中的倒影几乎和你的样子是一样的·。你觉得那两个形象有何不同之处，又有何相同之处？

SourceText: Something that has one side that is the mirror image of the other side is called symmetric, or even mirror symmetric. Do you see some things around you that are symmetric?
text: 当你把物体旁放一面镜子前,镜子中的物像和物体到镜面的距离相等,即像物等距;像与物的大小相同镜子中的物像与物体是对称性的。那叫镜像对称。你看到周围有对称的东西吗？

SourceText: People's faces are very close to being symmetric. Do you notice anything on one side of your face that is a little different than the other side? Perhaps your hair?
text: 人的脸几乎是对称的。你是否注意到你脸上有左侧和右侧有一点不同？也许是你的头发？

SourceText: And talks the same.
text: 并且说一样的话。

SourceText: This animal is listening to its echo across a canyon. Have you heard an echo of your voice?
text: 这只动物正在聆听自己在峡谷的回声。你是否也听过你的声音的回声吗？

SourceText: An echo for your voice is like looking in a mirror for your image. Does an echo sound exactly like you, or can you tell the difference?
text: 听到自己你声音回音就好像看镜子时看到自己的形象一样。回声听起来和你声音是否完全一样，还是你能分辨出任何差异？

SourceText: Hearing an echo is similar to hearing a recording of your voice. Do you think recordings of your voice sound like what you hear in your head when you talk?
text: 听到自己的回声就好像听到你的声音的录音回播。你认为自己录音的声音是否和你自己说话时在脑海中听到的声音相似？

SourceText: And even has my curls.
text: 甚至还有和我一样的卷发。

SourceText: Hippos and mice may have curly tails, but that does not make them the same as our friend. How many things need to be the same for two animals to be the same?
text: 河马和老鼠可能也·有卷曲的尾巴，但这并不意味着它们和我们的朋友一样。两种动物要有多少相同之处才能算一样？

SourceText: Describe some ways that the hippo and the mouse are different than our friend.
text: 描述一下河马和老鼠与我们的朋友有何不同的·地方。

SourceText: Pick someone you know and describe some ways you are similar to them and some ways you are different.
text: 想一个你认识的人，然后描述一下你和这个朋友相似和不同的地方。

SourceText: Someone with my eyes my ears.
text: 一个有着和我一样的眼睛和耳朵。

SourceText: Can you think of other animals that have big ears similar to these?
text: 你能想到其他跟这只动物一样有一对大耳朵的动物吗？

SourceText: Can you think of other animals that have eyelashes like these?
text: 你能想到一种动物有着跟这只动物一样的眼睫毛的动物吗？

SourceText: This animal has three eyelashes on each side. How many eyelashes is that all together?
text: 这只动物每侧有三根眼睫毛。请问·这只动物一共有·多少根眼睫毛？

SourceText: Who even has my laugh.
text: 甚至还有和我一样的笑声。

SourceText: Can you make some animals sounds? Which animals?
text: 你能模仿一些动物的声音吗？是哪些动物？

SourceText: Can you neigh like a horse, oink like a pig, meow like a cat, or bray like a donkey?
text: 你可以像马一样嘶鸣、或者像猪一样哼哼、还是像猫一样喵喵、或者像驴子一样嘶叫吗？

SourceText: This animal has exceptionally big teeth. Think of other animals with teeth like these.
text: 这只动物有异常大的牙齿。你可以想想有什么其他动物也有类似牙齿的动物。

SourceText: Who can do what I can do.
text: 谁可以做我能做的事。

SourceText: Do you feel happy running in a big open space like that?
text: 当你在这样一个大空地上奔跑时，你感到快乐吗？

SourceText: Do you prefer to run with someone or by yourself?
text: 你喜欢独自一人跑步还是和别人一起跑步？

SourceText: Count all the rocks near them. If you take away the two biggest rocks, how many rocks are left?
text: 数一数他们附近的所有石头。如果把最大的两块石头拿走，剩下多少块石头？

SourceText: And can't do what I can't.
text: 和不能做我不能做的事。

SourceText: Why are the animals having trouble peeling the banana?
text: 为什么这些动物无法自己剥香蕉皮？

SourceText: Can you peel a banana easily?
text: 你能自己轻轻松松的剥香蕉吗？

SourceText: Are there things, such as fruit or packages, that you have trouble opening?
text: 在日常生活里有没有一些事情，比如水果或包装，你有困难打开？

SourceText: I've looked and looked everywhere to find another me. I went down to the park and looked behind the trees.
text: 我到寻处，到去寻找，想找到另一个和我一样的人。我去公园寻找和去树后面看看。

SourceText: What animal did he see when he looked behind a tree?
text: 当他到树后面时，看到了什么动物？

SourceText: Did he see an animal just like him when he looked behind the tree?
text: 他在树后是否看到一只和他一模一样的动物吗？

SourceText: Did he see what he was looking for behind the tree?
text: 他是否在树后面找到他寻找的东西？

SourceText: I looked around, up, and down.
text: 我四处张望，左看右看，上看下看。

SourceText: Do you think our friend could ever climb to the top of a tree?
text: 你觉得我们的朋友是否能爬到树顶去？

SourceText: Do you think the bird is surprised to see him there?
text: 你觉得鸟儿看到他在树上会不会很吃惊？

SourceText: Has the animal looked everywhere? What are some places that may have been missed?
text: 这个动物已经在各角落看过一遍了吗？是否哪一些地方可能被遗漏了？

SourceText: At every single face.
text: 在每一张脸上。

SourceText: There are three animals on one side of the pond, and one more on the other side. If you put them all together, how many animals are there? What is one more than 3?
text: 池塘的一侧有三只动物，另一侧多了一只。如果把它们全部放在一起，一共有多少只动物？3再加1等于多少？

SourceText: If you remove one animal on one side of the pond from the four animals at the pond, how many are left? What is one less than 4?
text: 如果从池塘的一侧移走一只动物，剩下的动物是多少？4减1等于多少？

SourceText:
Describe how the two facts:
3 + 1 = 4 and 4 - 1 = 3
are tied together.
These two related math facts are called a math fact family. Can you think of another math fact family?
text:
描述这两个事实：
3 + 1 = 4 和 4 - 1 = 3
两个事实是联系在一起的。
这两个相关的数学事实被称为数学事实家族。你能想到另一个数学事实家族吗？

SourceText: I couldn't find another me in any single place.
text: 我在任何一个地方都找不到另外一个我。

SourceText: Do you think his shadow temporarily fooled him into thinking that there was another animal just like him?
text: 你认为他的影子是否愚弄了他，让他以为这个世界上有另一个和他一模一样的动物？

SourceText: How much does your shadow look like you?
text: 你觉得你的影子和你有多相像？

SourceText: Have you ever seen a shadow that you thought was a person?
text: 你是否曾经看见一个影子但却以为是一个人？

SourceText:
There's only one me in the world!
I'm special, oh it's true!
text:
世界上只有一个我！

我特别的，哦，这是真的！

SourceText: How many animals can you count in this picture?
text: 你能数一数看看在这张图片中一共有多少只动物？

SourceText: Describe some of the ways each animal in this picture is different than our friend.
text: 请·描述一下这张图片中每个动物与我们的朋友什么不同的一些方面。

SourceText: Describe some of the ways each animal is similar to our friend.
text: 请描述一些这张图片中每个动物与我们的朋友相似的一些方面。

SourceText:
But not just me, don't you see?
There's only one of you!
text:
但不仅仅是我，你不明白吗？

世界上只有一个你！

SourceText: Do you know someone who is very similar to you? How are they similar to you?
text: 你是否认识一个和你非常相似的人？他们和你有哪些相似的特点？

SourceText: Despite the similarities, describe some ways they are different from you.
text: 除了相似之处，也请你描述一些他们与你不同的地方。

SourceText: Do you like being the only you that there is?
text: 你喜欢成为世上唯一的你吗？

SourceText: I love forests!
text: 我爱森林！

SourceText: What are some great things about forests?
text: 森林有哪些伟大之处？

SourceText: There are many types of places. For example, there are deserts, hills, beaches, canyons, mesas, and mountain slopes. What are some of your favorite places?
text: 地方有很多种类型。例如，有沙漠、山丘、海滩、峡谷、高原和山坡。你最喜欢的地方是哪些？

SourceText: How many of the trees in this picture can you count? Can you count that high?
text: 你能数出这张图片中有多少棵树吗？你能数到那么大的数吗？

SourceText: Last week I went to Kibale forest.
text: 上周我去了基巴莱森林。

SourceText: Kibale National Park is a rain forest in Western Uganda near the center of Africa. It is a sanctuary for a large variety of primates, wildlife, and vegetation.
text: 基巴莱国家公园是位于非洲中心附近乌干达西部的一片雨林。它是多种灵长类动物、野生动物和植被的保护区。

SourceText: Are there parks or natural areas that you like to visit?
text: 你有没有喜欢去的公园或自然区域？

SourceText: Which do you find more interesting to see: plants and trees or lots of animals?
text: 你觉得哪个更有趣：植物和树木，还是很多动物？

SourceText: I saw many trees. I saw Fig, Muvule, Palm, and Ebony trees.
text: 我看到了很多树。我看到了无花果树、姆卢勒树、棕榈树和乌木树。

SourceText: This picture shows plains with mountains in the distance. Do you think a mixture of living areas will be good for creating a mixture of plants and animals for the park?
text: 这张图片展示了远处有山的平原。你认为混合的生活区域对于公园内植物和动物的多样性有好处吗？

SourceText: The story mentions four types of trees in the park. Do you see four types in this picture?
text: 故事中提到了公园里的四种树。你在这张图片中看到四种树了吗。

SourceText: How many types of trees can you think of near where you live?
text: 你能想到你居住地附近有多少种树吗？

SourceText: I saw chimpanzees, baboons, and monkeys.
text: 我看到了黑猩猩、狒狒和猴子。

SourceText: These adult animals are sitting in pairs, which makes them easy to count by 2's - 2, 4, 6. Adding in one more baby makes 7!
text: 这些成年动物成对坐着，这让它们很容易被2的倍数计数 - 2、4、6。再加上一个小宝宝就是7了！

SourceText: One more than the 6 adults is 7. If you take away the one baby, how many is one less than 7?
text: 比6个成年动物多一个是7。如果你去掉一个小宝宝，那比7少一个是多少？

SourceText: Do you think this mixture of animals would naturally be together like this, or did the artist take some liberties with the picture?
text: 你认为这些动物在大自然中会像这样聚在一起吗，还是画家在画这张图时有所自由创作？

SourceText: I saw different birds. I saw crested cranes, eagles, and owls.
text: 我看到了不同的鸟。我看到了冠鹤、鹰和猫头鹰。

SourceText: What about this picture -- do you think these birds would all be together like this?
text: 这张图片呢——你认为这些鸟会像这样聚在一起吗？

SourceText: There are four birds and one fish. How many animals is that all together? How many is one more than four?
text: 这里有四只鸟和一条鱼。总共有多少只动物？比四多一个是多少？

SourceText: The story mentions three types of birds and shows us four birds. Do you think two of these birds are of the same type? If so, which two?
text: 故事提到了三种鸟，并给我们展示了四只鸟。你认为这些鸟中有两只属于同一种吗？如果是，是哪两只？

SourceText: I laughed when I saw a big elephant with a little tail.
text: 我看到一只大象有一个小尾巴时笑了。

SourceText: Why do you think such a large animal has such a little tail?
text: 你认为为什么这么大的动物有这么小的尾巴？

SourceText: The parts the elephant has two of (ears, tusks, pairs of legs, and eyes) are on opposite sides of its body, and the parts it has one of (mouth, tail, and trunk) are in the middle of its body. Are all animals like this?
text: 大象一对的身体部位（耳朵、象牙、腿对和眼睛）位于它身体的两侧，而它只有一个的身体部位（嘴巴、尾巴和鼻子）位于它身体的中间。所有动物都是这样的吗？

SourceText: Can you think of an animal that doesn't have its parts  arranged about a middle line?
text: 你能想到一个身体部位不是围绕中线排列的动物吗？

SourceText: I saw so many different animals, birds, and plants.
text: 我看到了很多不同的动物、鸟和植物。

SourceText: Describe the animals by where they are in the picture -- some are in the air, the trees, the water, and in the grass.
text: 描述图片中动物的位置——一些在空中、树上、水中和草地上。

SourceText: Count each group and then count them all together -- do you get the same result?
text: 数一数每一组，然后把它们放在一起数——你能得到相同的结果吗？

SourceText: Which group has the most animals in it? Which has the least?
text: 哪一组里有最多的动物？哪一组最少？

SourceText: Kibale forest is a good place to visit. I love forests! Do you?
text: 基巴莱森林是一个好去处。我爱森林！你呢？

SourceText: Do you like to visit forests?
text: 你喜欢去森林吗？

SourceText: What is your favorite place to visit away from where you live?
text: 你最喜欢去离你居住地很远的地方是什么？

SourceText: What is your favorite spot to go to around where you live?
text: 你最喜欢去你居住地附近的地方是什么？

SourceText: This is the story of Keeper and his nursery of orphaned animals.
text: 这是关于饲养员和他的孤儿动物园的故事。

SourceText: An orphan is a young animal who has no adult animals to care for it. What problems might an orphan animal have in the wild?
text: 孤儿是指没有成年动物照顾的幼年动物。在野外，孤儿动物可能会面临什么问题呢？

SourceText: Rectangles are four-sided shapes like this page. Notice how each of the gates and doors is a rectangle with a diagonal crosspiece. Adding a diagonal piece creates two triangles, and triangles are stiffer and stronger than rectangles.
text: 矩形是像本页这样有四条边的形状。注意每个门和门都是带有对角横梁的矩形。添加对角线会创建两个三角形，而三角形比矩形更坚固更强大。

SourceText: Can you find some triangles and rectangles where you are?
text: 你能在你的周围找到一些三角形和矩形吗？

SourceText: August was a busy month for Keeper and his helpers at the nursery.
text: 八月对饲养员和他在育儿园的助手们来说是一个忙碌的月份。

SourceText: Many baby animals need milk the way baby people do. What kind of milk do you think they are putting in the bottles?
text: 许多幼儿动物需要像人类婴儿一样的奶。你认为他们在奶瓶里放的是什么牛奶？

SourceText: We have triangles and rectangles as before, and now we have lots of circles. The bottles are round shapes that are called cylinders.
text: 我们有之前的三角形和矩形，现在又有很多圆形。这些瓶子是被称为圆柱体的圆形。

SourceText: There are many different jobs in a place that keeps lots of animals. See if you can figure out what each person's job is in this picture.
text: 在照顾很多动物的地方有很多不同的工作。看看你能否弄清楚这张图片中每个人的工作是什么。

SourceText: One-year-old Mkite arrived first. She came in an old green truck.
text: 一岁的姆凯特首先到达。她乘坐一辆旧的绿色卡车而来。

SourceText: This is a baby elephant with no adult elephants to take care of it. Make up a story about how this elephant came to be by itself.
text: 这是一只没有成年大象照顾的幼小大象。编一个关于这只大象是如何独自一人的故事。

SourceText: How do you think the baby elephant is feeling, and how can you tell? Our eyes and body position can reveal a lot about our feelings.
text: 你认为这只幼小大象的感觉是怎样的，你怎么能告诉呢？我们的眼睛和身体姿势可以透露出许多关于我们感觉的信息。

SourceText: Why are there black and yellow stripes on the ramp going down from the truck?
text: 卡车下来的斜坡上为什么有黑色和黄色的条纹？

SourceText: Keeper and his helpers were very sorry for Mkite. She was so thin and sad.
text: 饲养员和他的助手们为姆凯特感到非常抱歉。她如此瘦弱和悲伤。

SourceText: How do you think these people feel about animals who are in trouble? Do you think they believe in their work?
text: 你认为这些人对于陷入困境的动物有什么感觉？你认为他们相信自己的工作吗？

SourceText: Have you ever seen a wild animal who was hurt or not doing well? If so, how did it make you feel? It's very natural to want to help others in trouble.
text: 你曾经见过受伤或状态不佳的野生动物吗？如果是的话，那让你有什么感觉？想要帮助陷入困境的其他人是非常自然的。

SourceText: Sometimes when a person is sad, they stop eating normally. And sometimes, it can work the other way too -- if a person is not eating properly, that can affect their emotional health. All parts of an animal's life need to be in balance.
text: 有时当一个人感到悲伤时，他们会停止正常进食。而有时，情况也可能反过来 —— 如果一个人没有正常进食，这可能会影响他们的情感健康。动物生活的各个方面都需要保持平衡。

SourceText: But soon, Mkite got stronger. She began to play with the other animals at the nursery.
text: 但很快，姆凯特变得更加强壮。她开始和育儿园里的其他动物一起玩耍。

SourceText: In zoos and in the wild, these animals are usually separated. Isn't it fun to see the different kinds of animals playing together!
text: 在动物园和野外，这些动物通常是分开的。看到不同种类的动物一起玩是不是很有趣！

SourceText: Look at the different shapes on this page. There are rectangles in the windows and the ball is in the shape of a sphere.
