text: 看看这一页上的不同形状。窗户上有矩形，而球的形状是一个球体。

SourceText: If you look very closely, the ball has pentagons (5-sided figures) and hexagons (6-sided figures) on it.
text: 如果你仔细看，大厅上有五边形（有5条边的形状）和六边形（有6条边的形状）。

SourceText: On another day in August, a helicopter landed at the nursery.
text: 在八月的另一天，一架直升机降落在育儿园。

SourceText: This view high up in the sky is something you don't get to see very often. Notice how the roofs all look like rectangles from up here. What does that tell you about the shape of the rooms underneath the roofs?
text: 从天空中高高的位置看到的景象是你不常见到的。注意从这里看，所有的屋顶都像矩形。这告诉你有关屋顶下房间形状的信息是什么？

SourceText: There is a circle around the top of the helicopter. There is actually nothing circular there. What is causing it to look like there is a circle there?
text: 直升机的顶部有一个圆圈。实际上那里并没有真正的圆形。是什么让它看起来像有一个圆圈呢？

SourceText: There is a second small circle at the far end of the helicopter. Because we are seeing it from the side, that circle looks like a very thin oval.
text: 直升机的远端有一个第二个小圆圈。由于我们是从侧面看到它，那个圆圈看起来像一个非常细的椭圆。

SourceText: Keeper and his helpers rushed outside. In the helicopter was a small elephant covered with a blanket.
text: 饲养员和他的助手们冲到了外面。直升机里有一头用毯子盖着的小象。

SourceText: A helicopter would only be used for a small animal who needed very fast attention. Take a guess at what kind of problem this elephant has.
text: 只有对于需要迅速处理的小动物才会使用直升机。猜测一下这头大象可能有什么问题。

SourceText: Look at the cart that they are going to load the animal on. Why does it need four wheels? Which sorts of things are usually put on this cart?
text: 看看他们要把动物装上的手推车。为什么它需要四个轮子？通常会放什么样的东西在这个手推车上？

SourceText: There are shapes all around us, and they are fun to wonder about. Look at the clouds. These clouds all have flat bottoms and fluffy tops. Why do you suppose a lot of clouds are like this?
text: 周围有各种各样的形状，而且想象它们是很有趣的。看看云。这些云底部都是平的，顶部是蓬松的。你认为为什么很多云都是这样的呢？

SourceText: It was Ndiwa. He was five days old. Keeper fed Ndiwa with a bottle.
text: 这是恩迪瓦。他只有五天大。饲养员用奶瓶喂养恩迪瓦。

SourceText: The health of animals who are just a few days old is very fragile. That's one reason there was such a rush to get care for Ndiwa.
text: 刚出生几天的动物的健康非常脆弱。这是为什么争分夺秒为恩迪瓦提供护理的原因之一。

SourceText: Ndiwa is being fed milk from a milk bottle, much as a human baby would be fed. Have you ever fed a baby or a baby animal from a milk bottle?
text: 恩迪瓦正在用奶瓶喂食，就像人类婴儿一样。你曾经给婴儿或幼小动物用奶瓶喂过食吗？

SourceText: Milk bottles are in the shape of cylinders. They are round and their sides go straight up and down. Do you see any cylinders around you? They are not so common, so you may not see any.
text: 奶瓶的形状是圆柱体。它们是圆形的，而且侧面是垂直的。你在周围看到了吗？它们不太常见，所以你可能看不到。

SourceText: The third orphan that month was Malea. She arrived at the nursery on a red tractor. She was six months old.
text: 那个月的第三个孤儿是马利娅。她乘坐一辆红色拖拉机到达育儿园。她六个月大。

SourceText: This orphan is a lot older than Ndiwa. It must be pretty large to be in a trailer pulled by a tractor. What kind of animal do you think it is?
text: 这个孤儿比恩迪瓦大得多。能够被拖拉机拉着的拖车一定相当大。你认为它是什么动物？

SourceText: Look at the two pairs of wheels on the tractor. The rear pair of wheels is much larger than the front pair. Why do you suppose that is?
text: 看看拖拉机上的两对轮子。后面的一对轮子比前面的一对要大得多。你认为这是为什么呢？

SourceText: What advantage would having a very large pair of wheels give you?
text: 拥有一对非常大的轮子会给你带来什么好处？

SourceText: Malea the rhinoceros soon became close friends with Enkare, a baby buffalo. They went everywhere together.
text: 犀牛马利娅很快与小水牛恩卡莱成为亲密无间的朋友。它们无处不在地在一起。

SourceText: One of the fun things about this nursery is that the different kinds of baby animals get to play together. Do you think they are having fun?
text: 这个育儿园有趣的地方之一是不同种类的幼儿动物可以一起玩。你认为它们在玩得开心吗？

SourceText: Have you ever wondered what pattern four-legged animals use their feet in? Next time you get a chance, take a careful look and see if you can figure it out. (They move their left side first, back foot first, and then repeat on their right side.)
text: 你曾经想过四条腿的动物是如何运用它们的脚的吗？下次有机会时，仔细观察看看是否能弄清楚。 （它们先移动左侧，后脚先动，然后在右侧重复。）

SourceText: All these animals have body parts that come in pairs on opposite sides of their body, or singleton parts down the center of their body. Can you think of any animals that have more than one of a body part that doesn't come in pairs?
text: 所有这些动物都有身体部位，这些部位在它们的身体的相对一侧成对出现，或者在身体的中心有单一的部分。你能想到有哪些动物有多个不成对出现的身体部位吗？

SourceText: One night, everybody was woken up by the arrival of Ambia.
text: 一天晚上，大家都被安比娅的到来惊醒。

SourceText: Look at how much that poor baby giraffe had to bend its neck to fit into that cage.  Why do you suppose they didn't put the giraffe in a bigger cage?
text: 看看这只可怜的小长颈鹿得弯曲脖子才能适应那个笼子。你认为他们为什么不把长颈鹿放在一个更大的笼子里呢？

SourceText: Have you ever squeezed into a small box or other space to play? Was it scary or cozy to be in such a small space?
text: 你曾经挤进一个小盒子或其他空间玩过吗？在这样一个小空间里是令人害怕还是舒适？

SourceText: Look at all those stars! How many can you count? Have you been in a really dark place outside where you could see more stars than you can count?
text: 看那些星星！你能数出多少颗？你曾经在一个真的很暗的地方看到更多的星星，以至于你数不过来吗？

SourceText: Ambia was five months old. She was weak after her long journey.
text: 安比娅只有五个月大。她在长途旅行后感到虚弱。

SourceText: Ambia looks weak and sad. These poor baby animals are away from their homes to get care to help save their lives. It is hard for a baby animal to be by itself in a strange place.
text: 安比娅看起来虚弱而悲伤。这些可怜的幼儿动物离开了它们的家，是为了得到护理以帮助挽救它们的生命。对于一个幼儿动物来说，在陌生的地方独自一人是很困难的。

SourceText: Have you ever gone on a trip away from home for a long time? Did you feel sad, or were you excited to be in a new place on an adventure?
text: 你曾经离家长时间出差吗？你感到难过，还是对在新的地方冒险感到兴奋？

SourceText: An estimate is a best guess when it is difficult to count something. What is your estimate for how many dark spots Ambia has?
text: 估计是在难以计数的情况下的最佳猜测。你对安比娅有多少个暗斑的估计是多少？

SourceText: Because of her long neck, Keeper held the bottle high to feed Ambia.
text: 由于她的长颈，饲养员将奶瓶高高举起来喂安比娅。

SourceText: Keeper does everything to make the animals comfortable. Taking stress out of the animals' lives is an important part of helping them to get healthy.
text: 饲养员会尽一切努力让动物感到舒适。从动物的生活中消除压力是帮助它们变得健康的重要部分。

SourceText: About how high up is Keeper? He is higher than the height of one person. Is he higher than twice the height of a person? Sometimes it is useful to measure the size of one thing in terms of the size of something else you know.
text: 饲养员有多高？他比一个人的身高高。他比一个人的身高的两倍还高吗？有时，用你了解的其他事物的大小来衡量一样东西的大小是有用的。

SourceText: Do the same thing with this tree. How many person-heights tall is this tree? People did this sort of thing a long time ago when creating lengths they could talk about with others. For example, they would measure some things by the length of a foot or the length of a stride.
text: 对这棵树也做同样的事情。这棵树有多高？人们在很久以前就用这种方法创造可以与他人交流的长度。例如，他们会用脚的长度或步幅的长度来测量一些东西。

SourceText: Tiny twins Abei and Moit arrived in the middle of August. These antelopes were only a few hours old. They were very sick.
text: 在八月中旬，小双胞胎阿贝和莫伊特到达了。这些羚羊只有几小时大。它们生病了。

SourceText: How do you think they got these baby antelopes to the nursery so quickly? Do you think they were watching the birth?
text: 你认为它们是如何如此迅速地把这些幼小羚羊带到育儿园的？你认为它们看到了出生的过程吗？

SourceText: Have you ever seen a newborn animal or person? They seem so helpless and wide eyed. They are seeing their world for the very first time and they are amazed!
text: 你曾经见过新生的动物或人吗？它们看起来如此无助而睁大了眼睛。它们第一次看到这个世界，感到惊奇！

SourceText: It's important to keep newborns warm. That's why these pictures of newborn animals show blankets on the animals. You'll see the same thing for newborn human babies.
text: 保持新生儿温暖是很重要的。这就是为什么这些新生动物的图片上都有毯子覆盖它们的原因。新生儿人类婴儿也是一样。

SourceText: Everyone was sad when Abei died a week after he arrived at the nursery. But Keeper and his helpers saved Moit.
text: 当阿贝在到达育儿园一周后去世时，大家都很伤心。但饲养员和他的助手们挽救了莫伊特。

SourceText: Sometimes, people do their best and still things do not turn out well. Think of a time when you did your best and things did not go well.
text: 有时候，人们尽最大努力，但事情仍然不顺利。想想一个你尽力而为但事情没有进展顺利的时候。

SourceText: It can be discouraging to try hard and not have things turn out well. When you have had failures, did it discourage you, or did it make you want to work even harder to make sure things turned out better the next time?
text: 努力而事情不顺利可能会让人泄气。当你遇到失败时，它是使你灰心，还是让你更加努力以确保下一次事情变得更好呢？

SourceText: When things go poorly, it is important to understand why that happened. If there were things that happened that you could not have foreseen or controlled, then that's just bad luck. If there were things you could have done better, it's a good idea to learn those lessons so you'll do better next time.
text: 当事情进展不顺利时，重要的是要了解为什么会发生这种情况。如果发生了你无法预见或控制的事情，那就是运气不好。如果有一些事情你本可以做得更好，学到这些教训是个好主意，这样你下次就能做得更好。

SourceText: The last orphans to arrive in August were Kopi, Kepi, and Keji. These cubs were two weeks old. They were very hungry when they arrived.
text: 八月最后到达的孤儿是科皮，克皮和科吉。这些幼崽两周大。它们到达时非常饥饿。

SourceText: These three cubs look like they are going to have a lot of fun with each other. How do Keeper and his helpers feel about these cubs? How can you tell?
text: 这三只幼崽看起来彼此之间会玩得很开心。饲养员和他的助手们对这些幼崽有什么感觉？你怎么能知道？

SourceText: Estimate how many spots these cubs have all together. Now, try counting the spots, perhaps 2 at a time, and see how close your estimate is.
text: 估计一下这些幼崽一共有多少斑点。现在，试着数一数这些斑点，也许每次数两个，看看你的估计有多接近。

SourceText: Make a game of estimating by challenging each other to look quickly at something and have each of you make an estimate. Then, look back, count the actual number of things, and see whose estimate was closest. With practice, you'll get much better at this!
text: 玩一个估计的游戏，挑战彼此迅速看一些东西，然后每个人估计一下。然后回头，数一数实际的数量，看看谁的估计最接近。通过练习，你会变得更擅长这个的！

SourceText: Keeper and his helpers love all of the animals, even the naughty ones.
text: 饲养员和他的助手们喜欢所有的动物，即使是淘气的动物。

SourceText: Even when these baby animals cause trouble, Keeper and his helpers have a good time playing with them. Are there some animals you enjoy playing with?
text: 即使这些幼儿动物惹麻烦，饲养员和他的助手们也很开心地和它们一起玩。有没有一些你喜欢和它们一起玩的动物？

SourceText: Do you like to play around in the water when you wash off? Young animals are not all that different than young people.
text: 洗澡的时候你喜欢在水里玩吗？幼儿动物和年轻人并没有那么不同。

SourceText: The elephant barely fits in that bath tub. What do you think they will do when the elephant outgrows this tub?
text: 大象勉强能够适应那个浴缸。你认为当大象长大超过这个浴缸时，他们会怎么办？

SourceText: The naughtiest baby was Lobolia. Lobolia liked to hide Keeper's glasses.
text: 最淘气的小动物是洛波里亚。洛波里亚喜欢藏饲养员的眼镜。

SourceText: Do you think Keeper can see without his glasses? If he can't see, he's going to have a very hard time finding his glasses. He doesn't wear his glasses on any of the pages, so he must not need them very much.
text: 你认为饲养员没有眼镜能看清吗？如果他看不清，他找眼镜就会非常困难。他在任何一页上都没有戴眼镜，所以他可能不是非常需要。

SourceText: Do you remember seeing Lobolia on the previous page? Keeper had his glasses in his shirt pocket during the bath. Do you think Lobolia stole them from him?
text: 你还记得在前一页看到洛波里亚吗？在洗澡时，饲养员把眼镜放在衬衫口袋里。你认为洛波里亚是从他那里偷走的吗？

SourceText: It would be very easy for Lobolia to escape from the nursery. Those fences would certainly not keep Lobolia in. Why do you think Lobolia stays around?
text: 洛波里亚很容易逃离育儿园。这些围栏肯定阻挡不住洛波里亚。你认为洛波里亚为什么会留在附近呢？

SourceText: The people at the nursery work hard to look after the baby animals. They hope that one day the orphans can look after themselves. Then they can return to the wild.
text: 育儿园的人们努力照顾这些幼儿动物。他们希望有一天这些孤儿能够照顾自己。然后它们可以返回野外。

SourceText: They may care about each animal, but wild animals should always go back to the wild if they can handle it. It must be sad, but fulfilling, to see their animals become healthy adults who can thrive in the wild.
text: 他们可能关心每一只动物，但野生动物如果能够适应的话，应该回到野外。看到这些动物变成可以在野外茁壮成长的健康成年动物，这一定是令人悲伤但充实的。

SourceText: Some animals have permanent injuries or problems that make it impossible for them to go back into the wild. Can you think of why that would be?
text: 一些动物有永久性的伤害或问题，这使得它们无法返回野外。你能想到原因吗？

SourceText: Think about being one of these animals that has been in the nursery ever since it was a baby. Do you think the animal is excited to go into the wild, or do you think it is fearful about being on its own?
text: 想象一下这些动物是自从它们还是婴儿时就一直在育儿园的。你认为这只动物是否对回到野外感到兴奋，还是它对独自一人感到害怕？

SourceText:
How old and how many? Read the story again and then answer these questions.

1. How many animals arrived at the nursery in the month of August?

2. Who arrived first that month? How old was this animal?

3. Who arrived last? How old were those animals?

4. Who were the youngest animals to arrive in August? How old were they?

5. Who was the oldest to arrive in August?

Reviewing a story after you read it can help you remember it much better!
text:
多大和多少只？再读一遍故事，然后回答这些问题。

1. 多大和多少只？再读一遍故事，然后回答这些问题。

2. 那个月谁先到达？这只动物多大了？

3. 谁最后到达？那些动物多大了？

4. 八月份到达的最小的动物是谁？它们多大了？

5. 八月份到达的最大的是谁？

在阅读后回顾故事可以帮助你更好地记住它！

SourceText:
Today I an not going to school.

It is a holiday.
text:
今天我不去上学了

因为是假期。

SourceText: What do you think she will do with her day off from school?
text: 你认为她放假的这一天会做些什么呢？

SourceText: Why does she like not going to school?
text: 为什么她不喜欢上学？

SourceText: Do you think she will miss seeing her school friends and teachers?
text: 你认为她会想念学校里的朋友和老师吗？

SourceText:
Today I am not going to watch TV.

There is no electricity anyway.
text:
今天我也不看电视了。

反正也停电了。

SourceText: Why does she decide to not watch TV?
text: 她为什么决定不看电视？

SourceText: What would you do if you were to plan a special day?
text: 如果你来计划这个特别的一天，你会做些什么？

SourceText: What do you do during times when your electricity is not working? Do you have special activities for such times?
text: 当你家里停电的时候，你会做些什么？有什么特别的活动计划吗？

SourceText:
What am I going to do?

Today I am going to listen to my body!
text:
我今天要做什么呢？

今天我要倾听我的身体！

SourceText: Her hands only have four fingers! Have you seen someone with four fingers on a hand?
text: 她的手上只有四根手指！你见过有人一只手上只有四根手指吗？

SourceText: It is uncommon, but some people are born with six fingers on a hand. How many more fingers is six fingers than what she has?
text: 这种情况不常见，但有些人出生时一只手就有六根手指。六根手指比她的手指多几根？

SourceText: Do you think you can buy gloves for someone with six fingers?
text: 你认为你可以为六根手指的人买到手套吗？

SourceText:
First I have to be very quiet.

So that I can listen to my own body.
text:
首先我要保持非常安静。

这样我才能听到我的身体。

SourceText: Have you listened to the sounds your body makes? What are some of them?
text: 你听过你的身体发出声音吗？有哪些？

SourceText: Have you heard your stomach rumbling, grumbling, or gurgling?
text: 你听过你的肚子咕咕叫、嘟嘟响、或是咕噜咕噜叫吗？

SourceText: Have you ever run hard and heard your pulse pounding in your ears?
text: 你有没有努力跑步，然后听到耳朵里咚咚跳动的心跳声？

SourceText:
Yes, now I can hear my breath.

I breath in and out, in and out.
text:
对，现在我能听到自己的呼吸声。

我呼气、吸气，呼气、吸气。

SourceText: If you stop and listen, can you hear yourself breathing?
text: 如果你静下心来，你能听到自己的呼吸声吗？

SourceText: Do you breathe through your mouth or your nose most of the time?
text: 你通常是通过嘴巴还是鼻子呼吸？

SourceText: Watch the time for half a minute and count your breaths. How many were there?
text: 观察半分钟的时间，数一下你的呼吸次数。有多少次？

SourceText:
And I can make my breath noisier. 
Ssssssssssss!

And softer.
Mmmmmmmm.
text:
我还可以让我的呼吸声更响。
呼—— ！

然后更轻。
嗯——。

SourceText: She is making her toy fly around by blowing on it very hard. When have you blown hard on something?
text: 她通过用力吹气让她的玩具飞起来。你什么时候对着什么东西吹过气？

SourceText: Have you blown out candles on a birthday cake or maybe blown on a fire to help it burn?
text: 你有没有在生日蛋糕上吹灭过蜡烛，或者对着火吹气让火烧得更旺?

SourceText: How old were you at your last birthday?
text: 你上次生日时几岁了？

SourceText:
Now I can hear my heart beating!

Doodom, doodoom, dooo dooom.
text:
现在我能听到我的心跳声了！

嘟嗒，嘟嗒，嘟 嗒。

SourceText: It is not easy to hear your own heart beating. Can you hear yours?
text: 听到自己的心跳声并不容易。你能听到你的心跳声吗？

SourceText: Put your ear on someone's chest so you can hear their heart beating.
text: 把你的耳朵贴在别人的胸口，你就能听到他们的心跳声。

SourceText: Do you think your heart ever stops beating? Most of your muscles can get tired, but your heart muscle never does!
text: 你认为你的心脏会停止跳动吗？你的大多数肌肉会感到疲劳，但你的心脏肌肉从不会！

SourceText:
Can I make my heart go faster or louder?

Yes, by jumping up and down twenty times.
text:
我能让我的心跳更快或更响吗？

可以，试试蹦蹦跳跳二十次。

SourceText: Can you count to 20 to count the jumps?
text: 你能数到20来计算蹦跳的次数吗？

SourceText: If you can't count to 20, you can count to 10 and then immediately count to 10 again. That will be just the same.
text: 如果你不会数到20，你可以数到10然后立刻再数一次10，这两种方法是一样的。

SourceText: When you run around and start breathing hard, do you sometimes feel your heart beating in your chest?
text: 当你跑来跑去，开始喘气时，你有时能感觉到胸口的心跳吗？

SourceText: Now see, my heart is beating faster.
text: 现在，我的心跳更快了。

SourceText: Have you ever seen your own heart beating in your chest? Is it possible to see it?
text: 你有没有看到过自己胸口的心跳？有可能看到吗？

SourceText: The storyteller and artist are stretching the truth a bit here. Have you ever stretched the truth a bit to make a story a little more interesting?
text: 在这里，讲故事的人和艺术家有点夸大其词了。你有没有为了让故事更有趣而稍微夸大一点？

SourceText: Her toy is covering its ears because the heart is beating so loudly. Is it possible to hear someone else's heart from a distance?
text: 她的玩具因为心跳声太大而捂住了耳朵。你能从远处能听到别人的心跳吗？

SourceText: If I put my fingers on my wrist, then I can feel my pulse!
text: 如果我把手指放在我的腕部，那我就能感觉到我的脉搏了！

SourceText: Can you feel your pulse on your wrist? Some people like to feel their pulse on their neck or on their head. Try it!
text: 你能在你的腕部感觉到脉搏吗？有些人喜欢在脖子或头部感受脉搏。试试看！

SourceText: Count your pulse for ten seconds. Did you get a count between 7 and 20?
text: 数一数十秒内的脉搏数。你数到的次数在7到20之间吗？

SourceText: Have another person do the same thing and compare the counts you got. Whose count was more and whose was less?
text: 让另一个人做同样的事，然后比较你们数到的次数。谁的次数更多，谁的更少？

SourceText:
I can hear myself laughing.

Haha, haha, haaah, haaa!
text:
我能听到自己在笑

哈哈，哈哈，哈哈哈，哈哈哈！

SourceText: She is very expressive, so her laughter is probably very loud. Is it possible to laugh softly? Can you do it?
text: 她非常乐于表达，所以她的笑声可能非常大声。你能小声地笑吗？能做到吗？

SourceText: People often like to laugh together. When you laugh, do other people laugh with you?
text: 人们常常喜欢一起发笑。你笑的时候，其他人会跟着你笑吗？

SourceText: Even when there is nothing funny happening, sometimes just laughing out loud can make you feel better.
text: 即使没有什么好笑的事情发生，有时候大声地笑一笑也能让你感觉更好。

SourceText: I can hear myself crying. Boohoooo hooo!
text: 我能听到自己在哭。呜呜呜！

SourceText: Do you think she is really crying, or is she just pretending?
text: 你认为她是真的在哭，还是假装的？

SourceText: Do you ever pretend to cry so that people will feel sorry for you?
text: 你有没有假装哭过，从而让人们同情你？

SourceText: Some people feel much better after they cry. Do you feel better after you cry?
text: 有些人哭过之后会感觉更好。你哭过后感觉好些了吗？

SourceText:
I can hear myself clapping.

Clap, clap, clap.
text:
我能听到自己在拍手。

拍，拍，拍。

SourceText: Make up a pattern using claps and foot stomps on the ground.
text: 用拍手和跺脚来打一个节拍。

SourceText: Was your pattern complicated, or was it as simple as: clap clap stomp, clap clap stomp?
text: 你的节奏是复杂的，还是像这样简单：拍 拍 跺，拍 拍 跺?

SourceText: Dancing is often a pattern of movements with your arms and legs. Do you like to dance?
text: 跳舞通常是一套手臂和腿部动作的特定模式。你喜欢跳舞吗?

SourceText:
I can hear my stomach rumbling!

Guddu, guddu, guddu.
text:
我能听到我的肚子在咕咕叫！

咕嘟，咕嘟，咕嘟。

SourceText: When your stomach rumbles, what is your body feeling?
text: 当你的肚子咕咕叫时，你的身体是什么感觉？

SourceText: Does your stomach ever rumble when it is having trouble digesting something or when you're sick?
text: 你的肚子在消化不良或生病时会咕咕叫吗？

SourceText: Looking at her face, what is she feeling right now?
text: 看看她的脸，她现在感觉如何？

SourceText: My stomach is saying, "Feed me!"
text: 我的肚子在说： “快喂我！”

SourceText: Have you ever been so hungry you couldn't wait and you had to eat immediately?
text: 你有没有饿到等不及，必须马上吃东西的时候？

SourceText: Do you think her stomach is really shoving her to get some food?
text: 你认为她的肚子真的在催促她去吃东西吗？

SourceText: Each time she bounds forward, she takes two steps. You can count those steps by counting by 2's -- 2, 4, 6, 8, ...
text: 每次她向前跳跃时，她都会迈出两步。你可以通过两个两个数来计算这些步骤 —— 2、4、6、8、……

SourceText:
My nose can smell cakes baking in mother's kitchen.

And now I want to hear my jaws chewing those cakes!
text:
我鼻子能闻到妈妈厨房里烤蛋糕的味道

现在我想听听我咀嚼这些蛋糕的声音！

SourceText: How many really small cakes do you think she will eat?
text: 你认为她会吃多少个小蛋糕？

SourceText: What are the most cookies or other snack you've eaten at one time?
text: 你一次最多吃过多少饼干或其他零食？

SourceText: This story has talked about a lot of different sounds to hear from your body. How many of them can you remember?
text: 这个故事讲述了很多你身体发出的声音。你还记得多少种？

SourceText:
I have a very big problem, cried Chief Short and Round in a loud voice. "Everyone, come here! I have a very big problem."

The people of the Village of Many Shapes formed a big circle around Chief Short and Round. They wanted to hear what he had to say.
text:
"我现在面临一个很大的问题！" 一位矮胖的酋长大声喊道。"大家请过来这里！我有一个很大的问题。"

多形状村里的人们纷纷过来并站在矮胖酋长的周围，围成一个大圆圈。他们都想听听他到底有什么要说。

SourceText: A polygon is a shape with several straight sides. Triangles have 3 sides, quadrilaterals have 4, pentagons have 5, and hexagons have 6. Name some polygons where you are.
text: 多边形是一种由多个直线组成的形状。比如三角形有3条边，四边形有4条，五边形有5条，六边形有6条。现在请看看你周围那里有哪种多边形？

SourceText: What are some of the shapes of the buildings in this picture?
text: 请说说这张图片中建筑物有哪几种不同的形状呢？

SourceText: There are snowflakes in the sky on a sunny day on  this page. Have you ever seen this?
text: 看看这一页图里： 晴天白云的天空中飘着雪花。你见过这样的景象吗？

SourceText:
Chief Short and Round began, "This is the worst news ever. I have lost my spring horn." 

The villagers whispered to each other, "Oh no!" Chief Short and Round continued talking, "If I don't find my spring horn then I can't blow my spring horn! And we can't start the springtime party if I can't blow my spring horn. And spring won't come if we don't have a springtime party."
text: 矮胖的酋长开始说：“我有一个糟糕的消息。我不小心把我的弹簧号给弄丢了。” 他说完后村民们纷纷互相低声窃窃私语交谈着，“哦，不！”矮胖的酋长继续的说：“如果我找不到我的弹簧号，我就无法吹弹簧号！如果我吹不响我的弹簧号，我们就春季聚会就无法开始。如果我们没有春季聚会，那么春天就不会到来。”

SourceText: Many of these people have very colorful clothes. What are your favorite colors to wear to a party?
text: 土楼许多人都穿着非常华丽漂亮衣服。你喜欢在派对上穿什么颜色的衣服？

SourceText: Have you ever looked forward to a party and then worried that it might not happen?
text: 你曾经期待去参加派对吗，然后担心可能派对会被取消吗？

SourceText: There are many beautiful polygons on these clothes! There are patterns with squares (polygons with four equal sides and four square corners), and some with hexagons. Notice how the hexagons on the back of the shirt are made of six triangles in a lively pattern!
text: 这些衣服上有许多漂亮的多边形的花样！有一些花样有四个相等的边和四个直角的正方形，还而有一些却有六边形的花样。大家注意一下衬衫背面上的六边形， 那是是由六个三角形组成的生动图案！

SourceText: Little Square Jojo stepped into the circle and lifted up his hand. "I will find your spring horn, Chief Short and Round." "Good, good," said the chief with a smile. "You can start looking in the last place I visited this morning. Go to Tata Rectangle's house. I remember having my horn with me there."
text: 小正方形乔乔踏入圈子里，然后举起手说：“酋长，我会把你的弹簧号找到的。” “好，好，” 酋长微笑着说。“你可以开始从我今天早上最后一个去过的地方找起。先去塔塔矩形的房子。我记得我在那儿的时候是带着我的号角的。”

SourceText: Why does Little Square Jojo deserve his name?
text: 为什么小正方形乔乔配得上他的名字？

SourceText: There are many circles in this picture. How many circles can you find?
text: 这张图片中有许多圆圈。你一共能找到多少个圆圈？

SourceText: How many squares are there on Jojo's clothes? That is a very tricky question because there are squares of different sizes on his clothes -- some of the squares are made up of smaller squares!
text: 乔乔的衣服上有多少个正方形？这是一个非常棘手的问题，因为他的衣服上的正方形大小不同 —— 一些正方形是由更小的正方形组成的！

SourceText:
Tata Rectangle was happy to see Jojo. He opened his door and welcomed Jojo inside. "I remember seeing Chief Short and Round earlier this morning," said Tata Rectangle, "but I don't think he had his spring horn with him." 

Little Square Jojo looked under Tata Rectangle's bed and behind his books. He even looked into his fridge. But Jojo couldn't find the spring horn anywhere.
text: 塔塔矩形看到乔乔非常高兴。他马上打开门，欢迎乔乔进屋。“我记得今天早上见到了矮胖的酋长，” 塔塔矩形说，“但我觉得他身上好像没有带着他的弹簧号。” 小正方形乔乔查看了塔塔矩形的床底下，然后翻找了他的书后面，甚至查看了他的冰箱。但乔乔还是没看到弹簧号的踪迹。

SourceText: A rectangle has four straight sides with corners like the corners of this page. A square is always a rectangle, but rectangles are not always squares. What would make a rectangle not be a square?
text: 矩形有四条直边，角落就像这一页的角一样。正方形也是属于一个矩形，但矩形并不总是正方形。猜一猜为什么矩形不是正方形呢？

SourceText: Are there any rectangles that are squares in this picture?
text: 在这张图片中，有哪些矩形是属于正方形的吗？

SourceText: Which objects in this room are rectangles? There are rectangles everywhere on this page! Point to as many rectangles as you can.
text: 这个房间里有哪些是矩形的物体？在这图片上到处都是可以看到矩形！请你把图里所有的矩形都指出。

SourceText:
Go and see if Mama Triangle has the spring horn, said Tata Rectangle. "Chief Short and Round visited her before he came to see me." "Thank you, Tata," said Jojo as he waved goodbye.

Mama Triangle's house is about three kilometers from here, thought Jojo. That is a far distance to walk. I will stop at my house along the way and have a rest.
text:
"走去看看三角妈妈哪儿是否有弹簧号，" 塔塔矩形说道。“矮胖的酋长在来找我之前拜访过她。” “好的谢谢，塔塔，” 乔乔挥手告别。

巴拉三角妈妈的房子距离这里大约三公里。有一段挺远的路要走。路上乔乔会经过她家， 她准备停一会，休息休息。

SourceText: What are the tallest things in this picture? Have you ever seen a person almost as tall as a house?
text: 这张图片中最高东西的是什么？你是否见过一个人几乎和房子一样高吗？

SourceText: Jojo is going for a long 3km (about two miles) walk. What is the farthest you have ever walked?
text: 乔乔要走一段很长约3公里（大约两英里）的路。你走过最远的路的距离是多少远呢？

SourceText: Did you ever walk a long, long time? How many minutes was that walk? 10? 20? 60? more?
text: 你曾经散步时走过很长很长时间的路吗？那次散步花了一共多少分钟？10？20？60？还是更多？

SourceText:
Little Square Jojo was hot and tired by the time he reached his house. He went inside to open his freezer and pour a glass of cold water with ice blocks. "I must be half the way to Mama Triangle's house," he said. "I hope she has the chief's horn."

Then Jojo had an idea. "I can visit Dudu Diamond. Her house is only half a kilometer from here and it's on the way.
text:
小正方形乔乔在到达家的时已经又热又累。他走进屋里，打开冰柜，倒了一杯带有冰块的冷水喝后心想。“我肯定已经走了一半的路，三角妈妈的家应该不远了，”他说。“希望她手里有酋长的号角。”

接着，乔乔想到了一个主意。“我可以去看看朵朵菱形。她的房子离这里只有半公里，而且正好在路上。"

SourceText: On this floor, you can hop from one square to another square of the same color. Choose one color with your finger and hop around that room.
text: 在这个楼层上，你可以从一个相同颜色的正方形跳到另一个相同颜色正方形。用手指选择一种颜色，然后用手指在房间里跳来跳去。

SourceText: Do you have a pattern on the floor where you are? Do you ever hop around a room trying to stay on just one color?
text: 你现在所在的地方的地板上有图案吗？你曾经在房间里试图只踩在一种颜色上跳来跳去吗？

SourceText: Jojo has walked half way of his 3 km (2 mi) walk. How far has he walked?
text: 乔乔已经走了他3公里（2英里）行程的一半。哪他一共走了多远的路？

SourceText:
Dudu Diamond was cleaning her house when Jojo arrived. Her earrings were making a lovely tinkling sound as she worked. 

"Hello, Jojo," she said. "What are you doing today?" "I am on my way to Mama Triangle's house to find the chief's spring horn," said Little Square Jojo. "That's nice of you," said Dudu. "I am happy to come with you. How much further do you have to go?"
text: 当乔乔到达时走到朵朵菱形的家时，她正在打扫屋子。她的耳环在她工作时发出一阵阵可爱的叮当声。“你好，乔乔，”她说。“你今天在忙些什么？” “我正要去三角妈妈的家找酋长的弹簧号，”小正方形乔乔说。“你心太善良了，”朵朵说。“我可以跟你一起去。你还有多远的路要走？”

SourceText: Another name for a diamond is a rhombus. A rhombus is a quadrilateral with four equal sides. A square is always a rhombus, but not every rhombus is a square. Point to some diamonds in this picture that aren't squares.
text: 菱形的另一个名字是斜方形。斜方形是一个四边形，有四条相等的边。正方形始终是一个斜方形，但并非每个斜方形都是正方形。在这张图片中指出一些不是正方形的菱形。

SourceText: This room is full of diamond shapes. What shape are the diamond windows if you turn them on their side? Jojo should feel right at home with those windows!
text: 这个房间里充满了菱形形状。如果把它们横过来看，窗户的形状是什么？在那些窗户下乔乔觉得很自在！

SourceText: This room has many pairs of things. Which pairs do you see?
text: 这个房间里的东西有很多成双成对的。你看到了哪些成对的东西呢？

SourceText:
Little Square Jojo scratched his head. "Let's see. Mama Triangle's house was three kilometers away from where I started. I walked about half the way to get to my house, that's one and a half kilometers. Then I walked another half a kilometer to get to your house. That makes 2 kilometers. So we only have one more kilometer to go!" 

"That's not so far then!" smiled Dudu. "I'll pack some things to take with."
text: 小正方形乔乔挠了挠头。“让我想想。三角妈妈的房子离我出发的地方有三公里。我走了大约一半的路到我家，也就是一公里半。然后我又走了半公里到你家。这样一共加起来就是两公里。所以我们只剩下一公里的路要走了！” “那就不算太远了！”朵朵笑着说。“我会准备一些东西带上的。”

SourceText: Jojo added 1 1/2 km plus 1/2 km to get 2 km. He subtracted 2 km from 3 km to get 1 km.
text: 乔乔将1 1/2公里加上1/2公里一共等于2公里。他再从3公里减去2公里得到1公里。

SourceText: Another way is: He had 1 1/2 km to go and he walked 1/2 km, so there was only 1 km left.
text: 另一种方式是：他一共还有1 1/2公里要走，而他已经走了1/2公里，所以只剩下1公里了。

SourceText: Yet another way: Think of 3 km as 6 half kms. When he did half of 6 of those, that meant he did 3 halves and had 3 halves to go. When he did another half km, then he only had 2 halves left. It's a fun puzzle to find different ways to calculate the same thing!
text: 另一种方式是：将3公里看作6个半公里。当他走了其中的一半，也就是3个半公里时，他还有3个半公里要走。当他再走了半公里时，他就只剩下2个半公里了。用不同的计算方式去计算相同一个有趣的难题是很有趣的挑战哦！

SourceText:
Dudu Diamond and Little Square Jojo walked until they reached the bottom of a tall mountain. "Mama Triangle's house is right up there at the top," said Dudu.

"Let's stop for a while and have a rest. You can have the sandwich I packed." Jojo cut the sandwich into four smaller pieces. "Here, let's share the sandwich, you have two pieces and I'll have two."
text: 朵朵菱形和小正方形乔乔一路直走到一座高山的山脚下。“三角妈妈的房子就在山顶上，”朵朵说。 “我们停下来休息一下吧。你可以吃我带上的三明治。”乔乔把三明治切成四小块。“来，我们一起分享这个三明治，你吃两块，我吃两块。”

SourceText: We can't see the top of the mountain. What do you think the shape is of the part we can't see?
text: 我们看不到山顶上。但你觉得我们看不到的那部分是什么形状的？

SourceText: Think of some different ways to cut a sandwich into four parts. Which shapes can you make that way?
text: 想一些不同的方法将三明治切成四块。用这种方式你能做出哪些形状？

SourceText: A round shape that comes to a point is called a cone. The mountain next to them is in the shape of a cone. Find some other cones in this picture.
text: 一个圆形的尖锥体被称为锥体。他们旁边的哪座山就是一个锥体的形状。请试试在这张图片中找一些其他的锥体。

SourceText:
Soon Dudu Diamond and Little Square Jojo were half the way up the mountain. Things were very different there.

"Look," said Jojo. "That's the strangest spider I've ever seen." "Wow," said Dudu. "It has spun a beautiful web. Let's count the sides. One, two, three, four, five, and six! That makes it a hexagon then!"
text:
很快，朵朵菱形和小正方形乔乔就爬到了半山。在那里，眼前看到一切都变得很不同。

“看，”乔乔说。“那是我见过的最奇怪的蜘蛛。” “哇，”朵朵说。“它织了一张好漂亮的蜘蛛网哦。看一看让我们数一数蜘蛛网的边沿。一、二、三、四、五、六！那就是一个六边形！”

SourceText: Can you think of any other hexagons you see or know about? Are there any where you are right now? Perhaps there are some hexagons on a bathroom floor?
text: 想想你能想到其他六角形的东西吗？看一看，看你可以看到或六边形的东西吗？你现在所在的地方有六角形的东西吗？也许浴室地板上有一些六边形的图案？

SourceText: Do you know any stories or songs about spiders?
text: 你知道一些关于蜘蛛的任何故事或歌曲吗？

SourceText: Spiders make webs in trees, in holes in the ground, and even across water. Where have you seen spider webs where you live? Why do spiders make webs?
text: 蜘蛛无论在树上或者地洞里甚至水面上都会结网。在你家里是否曾经你见过蜘蛛网吗？猜一猜蜘蛛为什么要结网呢？

SourceText:
After climbing over a very big rock, Little Square Jojo and Dudu Diamond finally arrived at Mama Triangle's house. They were high up now and felt a bit dizzy.

"Hello, you two," said Mama Triangle with a smile. "I am so happy to have visitors. Most of the time I'm all alone here on the top of my mountain. Come inside and sit down at my table.
text:
小正方形乔乔和朵朵菱形爬过一块非常大的岩石后，终于到达了三角妈妈的家。他们现在所在的地势很高，她们两感觉有点眩晕。

“你们好，”三角妈妈笑着说。“很开心有客人到我家来拜访。平时大多数时候我都是独自一人在这座山的顶上。请进来屋里坐坐。

SourceText: Do you think Mama Triangle knows where the Chief's spring horn is? Do you think they wasted their time coming to the top of the mountain?
text: 你认为三角妈妈知道酋长的弹簧号在哪吗？你认为他们白白浪费精力从山下一路爬上山顶吗？

SourceText: There are a great many polygons in this picture and they are of many types. Point at some polygons and name their types.
text: 在张图片中有很多种多边形，而且它们是不同类型的。请试试指着一些多边形并说出它们的类型。

SourceText: There are a few shapes that are not polygons. These shapes have at least one side that is curved and not straight. Can you find them?
text: 还有一些不是多边形的形状。这些不同的形状里有一条边是弯曲的而不是直的形状。你能找到它们吗？

SourceText: Mama Triangle, said Jojo after catching his breath, "We've come to find Chief Short and Round's spring horn. Tata Rectangle said that the chief visited you this morning." "Yes, that is correct," said Mama Triangle. "The chief came to ask me to help prepare for the springtime party. But he didn't leave his spring horn here." "Oh no," said Jojo sadly, "We've come all this way for nothing!"
text: "三角妈妈，" 乔乔喘着气说道，"我们来找矮胖酋长的弹簧号。塔塔矩形说酋长今天早上来找过你。""是的，没错，" 三角妈妈说。"酋长是来找我想请我帮忙准备春季聚会。但他并没有把他的弹簧号留在这里。" "哦，不，" 乔乔悲伤地说，"我们白白走了这么远的路却找不到酋长的弹簧号！"

SourceText: Do you think they went all that way for nothing? They may not know where the horn is, but they have learned a lot during their travels.
text: 你真的认为他们白白走了那么远的路吗？他们可能没找到酋长的弹簧不知道，但他们在一路的旅行中却看到和学到了很多东西。

SourceText: Sometimes, finding out what something can't be can be almost as valuable as finding out what it is. Useful information comes in many forms!
text: 有时候，了解某物的真相不比了解它真正是什么一样有价值。有用的信息有很多形式！

SourceText: What do you think will happen next in the story? Create an ending for how this story turns out. Do they find the horn, and if so, how do they find it?
text: 你认为故事接下来会发生什么？想一想并为这个故事创造一个故事的结局。他们是否找到了酋长的弹簧，如果可以找到，哪他们是如何找到的？

SourceText: Mama Triangle held Jojo's hand as she led him outside. "Don't worry Jojo," she said. "Chief Short and Round didn't leave his spring horn here, but I know where it is. That chief can be such a silly thing!" Mama Triangle, Little Square Jojo and Dudu Diamond all ran down the mountain and in no time at all they were safely at the bottom.
text: 三角妈妈温和的牵着乔乔的手，带着他走到屋子外面。“别担心，乔乔，”她说。“矮胖的酋长没有把他的弹簧号留在这里，但我知道他把他的弹簧号在哪里。那个酋长真是个糊涂傻瓜！” 三角妈妈、小正方形乔乔和朵朵菱形一同跑下山，一转眼的时间他们就安全地到达山脚下。

SourceText: There are a lot of triangles in this picture! Can you count them all, or is it higher than you can count?
text: 这张图片中有很多三角形！你能把全部三角形都数出来吗，还是超出你可以数的范围呢？

SourceText: Why were they able to go down the mountain so much more quickly than when they went up?
text: 你认为为什么他们下山的速度比上山的速度快那么多呢？

SourceText: Oddly enough, going down a steep hill can be harder than going up. Has this happened to you?
text: 奇怪的是，下陡坡可能比上坡更难。你有过这样的经历吗？你觉得上山容易还是下山容易呢？

SourceText:
It was evening by the time they reached Chief Short and Round's house. Mama Triangle knocked on the door and when it was opened everyone rushed inside.

"Hello," said Chief Short and Round, blinking sleepily. "Did you find my spring horn? Will we be able to have the springtime party?" Little Square Jojo felt very bad and shook his head.
text:
当他们到达矮胖酋长家的时候已经是傍晚了。三角妈妈敲了敲门，门一打开，大家都冲了进去。

“你好，”矮胖的酋长打着呵欠说。“你们找到我的弹簧号了吗？我们的春季聚会开得成吗？”小正方形乔乔感到很难过的摇了摇头。

SourceText: The Chief's room is round and is filled with round things. Point at and count as many circles as you can.
text: 酋长的房间是圆形的，里面摆满了很多圆形的东西。指一指并数一数，尽量的把所有的圆形数完。

SourceText: The circles in the rug have the same center. Circles that share a common center are called concentric circles. Do you see any concentric circles where you are?
text: 地毯上的圆形都有相同的中心点。共享一个中心的圆形被称为同心圆。看看你现在的地方是否有看到了同心圆吗？

SourceText: The Chief is wearing his pajamas. What do you think his bedtime is? What is your bedtime?
text: 酋长现在穿着睡衣。你认为什么时候是他的睡觉时间？你的睡觉时间是什么时候？你一般几点睡觉呢

SourceText:
Jojo looked for your spring horn all day, said Mama Triangle. "It is not his fault that he didn't find it. It is your fault, Chief Short and Round. Don't you remember?" Mama Triangle pointed at the chief. "You are wearing your spring horn on your head!"

Chief Short and Round gasped, "Oh my, I remember it now. I was so hot from climbing up that mountain that I put my horn on my head."
text:
"乔乔今天一整天都在忙着找你的弹簧号，" 三角妈妈说。"他没能找到并不是他的错。是你的错，矮胖酋长。难道你不记得吗？" 三角妈妈指着酋长。“你把你的弹簧号戴在头上了！”

矮胖酋长唉声叹气说：“哦，我的天哪，我现在记得了。我爬上那座山的时候天气非常热，所以把我的弹簧号戴在了头上。”

SourceText: How do you think the Chief felt when he realized the horn was on his head?
text: 你觉得酋长在意识到自己把弹簧号戴在头上时， 他心里的感觉是如何的？

SourceText: How long in this story has the horn been on his head?
text: 在这个故事中，酋长把弹簧号戴在头上的时间有多长？

SourceText: Tell a story about a time when you thought you lost something and then found out it was in an obvious place all along.
text: 你可以分享一个关于你曾认为丢失了一样东西，然后却发现它原来一直在一个显而易见的地方的故事。

SourceText:
I am so embarrassed, said Chief Short and Round as he took his spring horn off his head. Then he passed it to Little Square Jojo. "You have done all the hard work, Jojo. You should blow the horn."

Little Square Jojo smiled. He lifted up the horn and gave a loud blow. "Now we can have the springtime party!" All was well in the Village of Many Shapes.
text:
"真是不好意思， 我感到很难堪，" 矮胖的酋长说着，说着用手把自己头上弹簧号摘下，然后递给小正方形乔乔。“真的是辛苦你了，乔乔。你应该试试吹一下弹簧号。”

小正方形乔乔微笑着。他举起弹簧号，吹了一声响亮的哨音。宣布“现在我们可以举行春季聚会了！”在多形状村里一切都过得很好。

SourceText: Unlike real snowflakes, the snowflakes in this sky come in many, very different shapes. Point to a few and describe them.
text: 图里的雪花与真实的雪花不同，图里的天空中的雪花呈现出许多非常不同的形状。用手指着其中一些并描述一下你看道德形状。

SourceText: Jojo did a great job of problem solving. He thought about the problem, he discussed ideas with others, and he persisted even when he was having trouble solving the problem.
text: 乔乔表现很出色，解决问题的能力很强。他先思考问题，与他人讨论了想法，再下决定。他在解决问题时遇到困难时，仍然坚持不懈。

SourceText: Tell a fun story, real or make believe, of a time when someone was searching all over for something for a long time and then finally found it.
text: 讲一个有趣的故事，可以是真实也可以是虚构，讲述一个人丢失了一样东西，在寻找很长时间后，最终找到的经历。

SourceText: Look at the animals.
text: 看看动物。

SourceText: Count and name together all the animals you see.
text: 数一数你看到的所有动物。

SourceText: What are all the animals looking at?
text: 动物们都在看什么？

SourceText: Do the animals want something from the farmer?
text: 动物们想从农民那里得到什么吗？

SourceText: The cow says, "Moo."
text: 牛说：“哞。"

SourceText: The cow is looking at an empty trough. What do you think "Moo" means?
text: 牛在看一个空食槽。你觉得“哞”是什么意思？

SourceText: If you only have one word ("Moo"), you have to say it in different ways to have it mean different things. What do you think the cow wants?
text: 如果你只能用一个词（“哞”），你需要用不同的方式来表达不同的意思。你觉得牛想要什么？

SourceText: Some of the cow's black spots are small and some are large. Count how many spots the cow has.
text: 牛的黑点有的小，有的大。数数牛有多少个斑点。

SourceText: The goat says, "Meh, meh."
text: 山羊说： “咩，咩。”

SourceText: Why is the goat looking at the drip of water from the faucet?
text: 为什么山羊在看水龙头里滴下的水？

SourceText: Is the goat thirsty, hungry, or both?
text: 山羊是渴了、饿了还是又饿又渴？

SourceText: How many horns does a goat have? Name some other animals that have two hard things growing on their head.
text: 山羊有几只角？想一想有哪些其他动物头上也有两个坚硬物体。

SourceText: The horse says, "Neigh."
text: 马说：“嘶。”

SourceText: The horse is also looking at an empty trough. What is the horse pointing at with its front left leg?
text: 马也在看一个空槽。马用左前腿指着什么？

SourceText: Count together the horse's legs. Can you think of a farm animal that has only two legs?
text: 数一数马有几条腿。你能想到一种只有两条腿的农场动物吗？

SourceText: Are there animals that have any other number of legs than two or four? What about insects or spiders? -- do you know how many legs they have?
text: 除了两条腿或四条腿的动物之外，还有其它的吗？昆虫或蜘蛛？ ——你知道它们有几条腿吗？

SourceText: The pig says, "Grunt."
text: 猪说：“咕噜。”

SourceText: Some people think that pigs say "Oink." What do you think they say?
text: 有些人认为猪会说 “哼哼”。你觉得它们说什么？

SourceText: The pig has two ears, two eyes, and two nostrils. Imagine what it would be like if it had two mouths!
text: 猪有两只耳朵、两只眼睛和两个鼻孔。想象一下，如果它有两张嘴会是什么样子！

SourceText: Count together the posts that make up the fence in front of the pig.
text: 数一数构成猪面前栅栏有几根柱子。

SourceText: The chicken says, "Cluck."
text: 鸡说：“咯咯。"

SourceText: A chicken is a farm animal with just two legs. Are there any others?
text: 鸡是一种只有两条腿的农场动物。还有其它的吗？

SourceText: Count the baby chicks and count how many chickens there are all together.
text: 数一数小鸡，然后数一数一共有几只鸡。

SourceText: One more than three makes how many?
text: 一加三等于几？

SourceText: The dog says, "Woof."
text: 狗说：“汪。"

SourceText: The dog bowl is empty and the dog looks hungry.
text: 狗的碗是空的，狗看起来很饿。

SourceText: Count together the number of bags by the fence.
text: 数一数栅栏旁的袋子有几个。

SourceText: Count together the number of tines on the rake in the corner. Can you find other things to count?
text: 数数角落里的耙子上的尖齿数量。你还能找到其他可以数的东西吗？

SourceText: The farmer says, "Shhh!"
text: 农夫说：“嘘！”

SourceText: Why does the farmer say "Shhh?"  Is the farmer tired of being pestered by the animals?
text: 农夫为什么要说“嘘”？农夫是不是不高兴被动物缠扰？

SourceText: What are the animals waiting for?
text: 动物们在等什么？

SourceText: How many animals are waiting for their food?
text: 有几只动物在等食物？

SourceText: One night Grandpa was tucking me in. His hands were soft and his hair was thin.
text: 一天爷爷哄我入睡，他的手很柔软，头发很稀碎。

SourceText: Two words rhyme when their endings sound alike. Look for the rhyming words on many of the pages of this story. For this page, "in" and "thin" are the rhyming words.
text: 两个单词押韵是指它们的结尾发音相似。在这个故事的许多页上寻找押韵的词。对于这一页来说，“睡”和“碎”是押韵的词。

SourceText: Think of some other words that rhyme with in and thin. (fin, din, kin, tin, win, bin, grin)
text: 想想还有哪些单词与"睡"和"碎"押韵。（会，溃，瑞）

SourceText: Putting things in pairs can be fun. However, not everything can be paired up. There are five buttons on Grandpa's coat, and no matter how you pair them up there will be one left over -- that's because five is an odd number!
text: 将事物成对放置可能很有趣。然而，并非一切都能成对。爷爷的外套上有五个按钮，无论如何配对都会剩下一个 - 因为五是一个奇数！

SourceText: I'm going to tell you a special story, about a girl named Lory Dory.
text: “我要告诉你一个特别的故事。关于一个名叫洛瑞的女孩，多莉是她的姓氏。”

SourceText: Hearing someone tell you a story is a special treat. Someone is reading this story to you right now. How does it make you feel?
text: 听别人给你讲故事是一种特别的享受。现在有人正在给你读这个故事。这让你有什么感觉？

SourceText: When lines are lined up and go in exactly the same direction they are called parallel lines. The artist has drawn this room in a style with almost no parallel lines. Point out some parallel lines where you are right now.
text: 当线条排列整齐并且完全朝着相同的方向时，它们被称为平行线。艺术家以几乎没有平行线的风格绘制了这个房间。在你现在所处的地方找出一些平行线。

SourceText: What are the rhyming words on this page?
text: 这一页上有哪些押韵的词？

SourceText: You couldn't see Lory Dory at all because she was born invisible.
text: “你根本看不见洛瑞多莉，因为她生来就是隐形的。”

SourceText: How do you think it feels to be invisible? You could go places and no one would know you were there. Would you like to be invisible?
text: 你认为隐形是什么感觉？你可以去任何地方，没有人会知道你在那里。你想成为隐形吗？

SourceText: If you are invisible and you put clothes on, are the clothes invisible too?
text: 如果你是隐形的，并且穿上衣服，衣服也会隐形吗？

SourceText: Where is Lory Dory in this picture? How can you tell?
text: 这张图片中洛瑞多莉在哪里？你怎么知道的？

SourceText: You'd only see Lory when rain hit her head.
text: “只有当雨点打在她头上时，你才会看到洛瑞。”

SourceText: When you see a shape by seeing an empty space in a picture, that is called "negative space." You can tell where Lory is by seeing the negative space where there is no rain.
text: 当你通过在图片中看到空白处来看到形状时，这被称为“负空间”。你可以通过在没有雨的负空间来判断洛瑞的位置。

SourceText: The rain lines in this picture are lined up. Those lines are parallel lines.
text: 这张图片中的雨线是排列整齐的。这些线是平行线。

SourceText: Look for parallel lines around you. Most of them will probably be horizontal lines (going side to side) or vertical lines (going up and down). Are there any other parallel lines around you?
text: 在你周围找平行线。它们中的大多数可能是水平线（从一侧到另一侧）或垂直线（从上到下）。你周围还有其他平行线吗？

SourceText: Or when she was curled under blankets in bed.
text: 或者当她蜷缩在床上的毯子下。

SourceText: The artist took many liberties with this drawing. There are extra squiggles that aren't really there. What else is extra in the picture? (the big red area)
text: 艺术家在这幅图中进行了许多自由发挥。有一些额外的波浪线并不存在。图片中还有什么是多余的？（大的红色区域）

SourceText: Why did the artist put in those extra things?
text: 艺术家为什么加入了这些额外的元素？

SourceText: What is the easiest part of Lory to see in this picture?
text: 在这张图片中，洛瑞最容易看到的部分是什么？

SourceText: Lory was left out of all the kids' games. They teased her and they called her names.
text: 洛瑞被排除在所有孩子的游戏之外。他们戏弄她，叫她的名字。

SourceText: We can see Lory in this picture by her negative space and her eyes.
text: 通过她的负空间和眼睛，我们可以在这张图片中看到洛瑞。

SourceText: Why do you suppose her eyelashes are visible when the rest of her is not?
text: 你觉得为什么她的睫毛在其余部分看不见的时候还能看到？

SourceText: People often make fun of someone who is different in some way. Have you ever been made fun for this reason? Have you made fun of someone for this reason? Why do you think people do this?
text: 人们经常嘲笑在某种方面与众不同的人。你有没有因为这个原因而被嘲笑过？你因为这个原因嘲笑过别人吗？你觉得人们为什么这样做？

SourceText: Look, it's Lory. The Imaginary Friend! She's not like us, she's just pretend!
text: "看，那是洛瑞。虚构的朋友！她不像我们，她只是虚构的！"

SourceText: The umbrellas are divided into areas that are triangles. Triangles are shapes with three straight sides. Do you see any triangles where you are?
text: 雨伞被划分为三角形的区域。三角形是具有三条直边的形状。在你所在的地方看到了一些三角形吗？

SourceText: Triangles are stronger than four-sided shapes. It is much harder to bend triangles and make them lose their shape. Why do you suppose that is?
text: 三角形比四边形更坚固。弯曲三角形并使其失去形状要困难得多。你觉得这是为什么？

SourceText: That child is about to throw a snowball. Balls are also called spheres. Spheres roll well and are fun to kick and play with. Do you have any spheres around you?
text: 那个孩子正准备扔雪球。球也被称为球体。球体滚动得很好，是踢和玩耍的好玩具。你周围有球体吗？

SourceText: One day at school, a boy wanted to know: "How do you look? I only see you in snow."
text: 有一天在学校，一个男孩想知道：“你是什么样子？我只能在雪中看到你。”

SourceText: What did the boy mean when he said "I only see you in snow."? Where is Lory in this picture?
text: 男孩说“我只能在雪中看到你”时是什么意思？洛瑞在这张图片中的位置在哪里？

SourceText: The lines on the boy's shirt go in two directions. The two directions meet each other in the same way as the edges of this page do. Lines that meet this way are said to be perpendicular to each other.
text: 男孩衬衫上的线条有两个方向。这两个方向相遇就像这一页的边缘一样。以这种方式相遇的线条被称为彼此垂直。

SourceText: Point out some perpendicular lines where you are. There will probably be a lot of them! Horizontal and vertical lines are usually perpendicular to each other.
text: 在你所在的地方找出一些垂直线。可能会有很多！水平线和垂直线通常彼此垂直。

SourceText: Can you paint yourself? Lory knew that she could. But not in the same way the boy thought she would.
text: "你能给自己涂颜色吗？"洛瑞知道她可以。但她不会像男孩想象的那样。

SourceText: It often happens that someone will mean something different when they say something than what the person hearing it understands. Has that happened to you recently?
text: 经常发生的情况是，当某人说的话与听者理解的不同时，意思也会发生变化。你最近有这种经历吗？

SourceText: What did the boy mean by "paint yourself" and what do you think Lory is going to do?
text: 男孩说“给自己涂颜色”是什么意思，你觉得洛瑞将要做什么？

SourceText: A partial circle is called an arc. There are at least five arcs on this page -- can you find them all? Can you find more than five?
text: 不完全的圆被称为弧。这一页上至少有五个弧--你能找到它们吗？你能找到比五更多的吗？

SourceText: Lory painted her body with all that she loved from the world all around and the sky above.
text: 洛瑞用她所热爱的来自世界和上方的天空的一切为身体涂上色彩。

SourceText: The expression "wearing your feelings on your sleeve" refers to showing the world how you feel. Do you keep your feelings to yourself or do you show them to the world?
text: "把情感表露无遗"这个表达意味着展示你的感受给整个世界看。你是把感情埋在心底还是表露无遗呢？

SourceText: Lory is showing the world all the things she loves. She is wearing her thoughts all over her body!
text: 洛瑞向世界展示她所热爱的一切。她用她的身体表达了思想！

SourceText: What is inside each of us is invisible to the world until we tell the world. Which things that you love would you like to share with the world?
text: 我们内心深处的东西在我们告诉世界之前对外界是不可见的。有哪些你愿意与世界分享的热爱之物？

SourceText: She painted herself every day with such pride, to bring out the person who she was inside.
text: 她每天都自豪地为自己涂上色彩，展现她内在的个性。

SourceText: Which color did she use for her right foot and which one for her left foot?
text: 她用哪种颜色涂了右脚，哪种颜色涂了左脚？

SourceText: Using paint is a bit messy, but it is one way to show her mark on the world. There are many ways we leave marks on the world without using paint. Can you think of a few?
text: 使用颜料可能会有点乱，但这是在世界上留下她标记的一种方式。有许多方法可以不使用颜料也在世界上留下痕迹。你能想到其中的一些吗？

SourceText: You can count the toe prints one by one, or you can count them by 5's. Skip counting is often a quick way to count a bunch of things! How many toe prints are there?
text: 你可以一个一个地数脚趾印，或者你可以按5数。跳数计数通常是快速计算一堆东西的方法！这里有多少个脚趾印？

SourceText: I know I'm invisible and hard to see. So I painted these pictures to show the real me.
text: "我知道我是看不见的，很难被看到。所以我画了这些图画去展示真实的我。"

SourceText: How many different things can you see on her that Lory likes?
text: 你在她身上能看到多少不同的东西？

SourceText: How well does this share who Lory is?
text: 这种展示洛瑞的方式怎么样？

SourceText: Which things would be hard to share this way?
text: 哪些东西在这种方式下会很难展示？

SourceText: "Are you making this up, Gramps? Is this story true?" "Lory is real -- real as me, real as you."
text: "你是在编故事吗，爷爷？这个故事是真的吗？" "洛瑞是真实的 - 真实如我，真实如你。"

SourceText: The story may not be real, but it has a real message. What is the message?
text: 故事可能并非真实，但它传达了一个真实的信息。这个信息是什么？

SourceText: How well do you think people see the invisible things inside you?
text: 你认为人们能看到你内在的看不见的东西吗？

SourceText: Is there something inside you that you would want to keep invisible?
text: 有没有什么你内心希望保持隐形的东西？

SourceText: When Grandpa had left me, I can't quite be sure, but I think I saw Lory just outside my door.
text: 当爷爷离开我的时候，我不能完全确定。但我想我在我的门外看到了有洛瑞站立。

SourceText: What do you think? Do "sure" and "door" rhyme?
text: 你认为"定"和"立"押韵吗？

SourceText: Go back and look at all the pairs of rhyming words. Can you find a few more words that go with each pair?
text: 回头看看所有的押韵词对。你能找到每一对词的更多押韵词吗？

SourceText: Some kinds of poems use rhyming words. Have you ever written a poem?
text: 某些类型的诗歌使用押韵词。你写过诗歌吗？

SourceText:
Three siblings, Udoo, Erdoo, and Eryum listened to the music of the rain. They wanted to dance in it. They wanted to touch the rainbow that arrived in the sky. Mother said, "No." 

They cried, hoping to change her mind. It didn't work. Eryum even tried to sneak out of the house to visit the rainbow.
text:
乌杜、艾杜和艾隆是三个兄妹，他们聆听着雨的音乐。他们想在雨中跳舞，想触摸到天空中出现的彩虹。妈妈说：“不行。”

他们哭了，希望能改变她的主意。但没有用。艾隆甚至试图偷偷溜出家门去看彩虹。

SourceText: Rainbows happen when sunlight shines through raindrops in the sky. The colors of the rainbow are red, orange, yellow, green, blue, indigo, and violet. Some people remember this as Roy G. Biv.
text: 彩虹是阳光透过天空中的雨滴时产生的。彩虹的颜色有红、橙、黄、绿、蓝、靛和紫。有些人记住这些颜色的顺序是‘红橙黄绿蓝靛紫’

SourceText: Some people claim that indigo should not be on that list. What do you think?
text: 有人声称靛色不应该出现在彩虹的颜色中。你认为呢？

SourceText: There are many kinds of rainbows. There are double rainbows and ones that occur when it snows. Have you ever seen one of these unusual rainbows?
text: 彩虹有很多种类。有双彩虹，还有下雪时出现的彩虹。你见过这些不同寻常的彩虹吗？

SourceText:
Mother caught him before he could go. She raised her voice so that Eryum and his sisters would hear too.

"You could catch a cold," she said. "You don't like pepper soup and you would have to eat some, if you caught a cold," she added with a smile.
text:
在他出门之前，妈妈就抓住了他。她提高了声音，让艾隆和他的姐妹们也能听见。

"你可能会着凉，"她说道。"你不喜欢吃辣椒汤，但如果感冒了，你就得吃一些，"她笑着补充道。

SourceText: A partial circle is called an arc. Do you think the colors of a rainbow are in the shape of an arc?
text: 一个部分的圆被称为弧。你认为彩虹的颜色是呈弧形的吗？

SourceText: Eryum wanted to go outside to see and touch the rainbow. Have you ever touched a rainbow. Do you think it's possible?
text: 艾隆想要出去看看、触摸一下彩虹。你有触摸过彩虹吗？你觉得这可能吗？

SourceText: Have you ever wanted to do something so much that you tried to do it even though an adult told you not to?
text: 你是否曾经因为非常想做某事而尽管成年人告诉你不要，但还是试图去做？

SourceText:
Hoping that they would ask for a story, she said, "The rainbow is a magical river with healing powers. But it is so high up in the sky that you can't reach it. If you catch a cold, the rainbow can't help you."

The children thought about this.
text:
希望他们会要求听故事，她说："彩虹是一条具有治愈力量的神奇河流。但它高高悬在天空中，你无法触及它。如果你感冒了，彩虹也无法帮助你。"

孩子们思考着这一点。

SourceText: Their mother is going to tell them a story about the magical healing powers of a rainbow. Before you read further, make up a story of your own about rainbows.
text: 她的母亲将要讲述有关彩虹神奇治愈力量的故事。在继续阅读之前，想象一个你自己的关于彩虹的故事。

SourceText: The straight lines in this picture make lots of rectangles, which are four-sided shapes similar to this page. How many rectangles do you see around you?
text: 这张图片中的直线形成了很多矩形，矩形是四边形，形状类似于这一页。你周围看到了多少个矩形？

SourceText: Sometimes, seeing lots of straight lines is dull. Do you find these lines interesting or dull? Is the curvy pot more interesting?
text: 有时，看到很多直线会感到乏味。你觉得这些线条有趣还是乏味？弯曲的花盆更有趣吗？

SourceText:
"Mother, please tell us our rainbow story," said Erdoo. "Yes, please mother, I want to hear it too," Udoo chimed in. "Me three," Eryum begged, lifting up three little fingers.

"Well, let me see, mmmm," she said playfully. "Okay lovelies, gather round. Mother, the storyteller is here!"
text:
"妈妈，请给我们讲彩虹的故事，"艾杜说道。"是的，请妈妈，我也想听，"乌杜插嘴道。"我也想听，"艾隆乞求着，举起了三根小手指。

"好吧，让我想想，嗯嗯，"她嬉戏地说道。"好的，亲爱的，聚在一起吧。妈妈，讲故事的人来了！"

SourceText: Is there someone you know who makes up stories to tell you? Describe the feeling you have when someone tells you a story.
text: 你认识有人会编故事给你听吗？描述当有人给你讲故事时你的感觉。

SourceText: Sometimes a group of people will create a story together by taking turns making up parts of the story. Have you ever tried this?
text: 有时一群人会轮流编故事的不同部分，共同创作一个故事。你尝试过这样做吗？

SourceText: How can you tell the children are happy on this page? What do you see in their faces and body positions that make it obvious?
text: 你如何知道这页上的孩子们很高兴？你在他们的脸上和身体姿势中看到了什么，让这一点变得明显？

SourceText:
Erdoo ran for the naha, the stirring stick they used as their totem. She handed it over to mother. Eryum got the headgear for mother to wear. It never failed to put her in character.

They all sat quietly to listen to the story they had heard many times. Udoo blew the whistle, telling mother to start. The story began.
text:
艾杜跑去拿那哈，他们用作图腾的搅拌棒。她把它递给了妈妈。艾隆找来了母亲戴的头饰。这总是能使她进入角色。

他们都安静地坐着，聆听着他们听过许多次的故事。乌杜吹哨子，告诉妈妈开始。故事开始了。

SourceText: Do you have special clothes or objects that you use for particular events like story telling?
text: 你有专门用于特定活动的特殊衣物或物品吗，比如讲故事？

SourceText: Having a set of things, or particular places, associated with a type of event helps create a sense of shared occasion. Describe some special events, such as birthday parties, when you wear special clothes or do particular activities.
text: 拥有一套与某种活动相关的特殊物品或特定地点，有助于营造共享时刻的感觉。描述一些特殊事件，比如生日派对，当你穿着特殊衣物或参与特定活动时。

SourceText: The frame on the wall is a rectangle, but not the rug on the floor. An oval is a circle that has been stretched or shrunken in one direction. What do you think, is this rug a perfect circle or is it an oval?
text: 墙上的框架是一个矩形，但地板上的地毯不是。椭圆是一个在一个方向上被拉伸或收缩的圆。你认为，这块地毯是一个完美的圆形，还是一个椭圆？

SourceText:
"Once, the rainbow was a magical river. It was hidden inside the green woods of Mbadede. Because it had healing powers, it was guarded.

If you were sick, you drank the water. The rainbow was always happy to share. Bit it didn't like badly behaved people."
text:
"从前，彩虹是一条神奇的河流。它隐藏在姆巴德德郊绿色的树林中。因为它具有治愈力量，所以受到保护。

如果你生病了，就喝河水。彩虹总是乐意分享。但它不喜欢行为不端的人。"

SourceText: This story talks about the rainbow river as though it could feel and think. Do you think non-animals in our world have feelings and thoughts?
text: 这个故事把彩虹河描述得好像它能感觉和思考。你认为我们世界中的非动物是否有情感和思想？

SourceText: This story talks about the river not liking badly behaved people. This is called foreshadowing. It tells us that such a person will soon appear in the story.
text: 这个故事谈到河不喜欢行为不端的人。这被称为铺垫。它告诉我们这样的人很快就会出现在故事中。

SourceText: What do you think a badly behaved person could do to upset the river?
text: 你认为一个行为不端的人可能会做些什么来惹恼这条河？

SourceText:
"Because of the river's magic, there was ice cream along the banks! Everyone who came to drink the water also enjoyed the ice cream, especially children.

The ice cream from the river was red, orange, yellow, green, blue, purple, and indigo."
text:
"因为河水的魔力，河岸上还有冰淇淋！每个来喝水的人都能享受冰淇淋，尤其是孩子们。

河水做的冰淇淋是红色、橙色、黄色、绿色、蓝色、紫色和靛色的。"

SourceText: How is this list of colors different from the Roy G. Biv list of rainbow colors?
text: 这个颜色列表与彩虹颜色的红橙黄绿蓝靛紫列表有何不同？

SourceText: They are getting ice cream all over themselves. When you eat, do you like to be neat and tidy, or do you enjoy making a mess?
text: 他们把冰淇淋弄得到处都是。当你吃东西时，你喜欢保持整洁，还是喜欢弄得一团糟？

SourceText: It's fun to see the colors mixing together on the river bank. When you mix yellow and blue you get green. What happens when you mix other colors?
text: 在河岸上看到颜色混合在一起很有趣。当你混合黄色和蓝色时会得到绿色。当你混合其他颜色时会发生什么？

SourceText:
"One day, a naughty old woman called Mbom came from the land beyond. On arrival, she met with a guard. He did not know her and he felt a strange feeling. But he did not listen to his feelings.

He pointed the way into the woods and told her to respect the river. Mbom agreed and went to the water."
text:
"有一天，来自彼方之地的一个顽皮老妇人叫姆邦来到了这里。刚到，她就遇到了一个守卫。他不认识她，感到一种奇怪的感觉。但他没有听从他的感觉。

他指了指进入树林的路，并告诉她要尊重河流。姆邦同意了，然后走向了河水。"

SourceText: Sometimes we get feelings about things we can sense but not quite understand. Learning to listen to those feelings and makes sense of them is a great skill learned over a lifetime.
text: 有时我们会对我们能感知但不太理解的事物产生感觉。学会倾听这些感觉并理解它们是一种终身学习的重要技能。

SourceText: Have you ever seen a person who didn't seem quite right to you, or perhaps you were in a situation where you were afraid but didn't know why? Listen to those feelings when you have them and try to understand them.
text: 你曾经见过一个让你觉得不太对劲的人，或者你曾经处于一种害怕但不知道原因的情况吗。

SourceText: There is a large forest behind them. How many trees can you count?
text: 他们背后是一片大森林。你能数出多少棵树吗？

SourceText:
"She took a drink and was healed. Then she looked around to make sure she wasn't being watched.

Mbom picked up a stone and threw it in. She watched as it rose, and spread into a ripple. Pleased, she picked up a stick. She threw it in. The same thing happened."
text:
"她喝了口水，痊愈了。然后她四下看了看，确保没人在看她。

邦捡起一块石头扔进去。她看着它上升，泛起涟漪。高兴的时候，她拾起一根树枝，也扔了进去。同样的事情发生了。"

SourceText: It seems Mbom's body was healed, but she was still sick at heart. Do you think this is what the guard sensed about her?
text: 看起来姆邦的身体得到了痊愈，但她的心灵仍然生病。你认为这是守卫对她的感觉吗？

SourceText: Why do you suppose the river couldn't heal her heart?
text: 你为什么认为这条河不能治愈她的心灵？

SourceText: You would think she would be overjoyed at being healed; however, she doesn't look happy. Why did she throw the stone and stick into the river?
text: 你会认为她因为被治愈而欢欣鼓舞；然而，她看起来并不开心。她为什么把石头和树枝扔进了河里？

SourceText:
"Mbom jumped right into the water! She hoped to get everlasting life. As soon as she jumped, the river rose up. It shot high into the sky, never to return to Mbadede. But sometimes the rainbow follows after the rain, to feel like a river again.

And there my story ends." said mother.
text:
"姆邦跳进水里！她希望得到永生。她一跳，河水涌起，冲向高空，再也不回到姆巴德德。但有时彩虹会在雨后跟随，感觉自己又变成了一条河。

我的故事就到这里。" 妈妈说。

SourceText: Do you think it is possible for anyone to live forever? Do you think the universe will be around forever?
text: 你认为有人能够永远生存吗？你认为宇宙会永远存在吗？

SourceText: One selfish or thoughtless person can ruin a situation for everyone. Why do you suppose it can take a lot of work from a lot of people to make a good thing, and it is so easy for a few people to ruin it?
text: 一个自私或粗心大意的人可以破坏一切。你认为为什么为了创造美好事物需要许多人的努力，而破坏它却只需要少数人？

SourceText: Can you think of a time when you were with friends and one person ruined the good time for everyone else?
text: 你能想到一次你和朋友在一起，有一个人破坏了其他人的好时光吗？

SourceText:
"So my lovelies tell me, why do you love this story so much?" asked mother. "You often ask me to tell it."

"I love it because it reminds me to pay attention to my feelings," Udoo smiled. "It helps me to remember the colors of the rainbow," added Erdoo.
text:
"那么，亲爱的，告诉我，你们为什么这么喜欢这个故事呢？" 妈妈问道。"你们经常让我讲它。"

"我喜欢它因为它提醒我要注意我的感觉，"乌杜笑了笑说。"它帮助我记住彩虹的颜色，"艾杜补充道。

SourceText: Do you remember the colors of the rainbow now?
text: 你现在还记得彩虹的颜色吗？

SourceText: Many things in this picture come in pairs. See how many you can find.
text: 这张图片中有许多成对出现的事物。看看你能找到多少。

SourceText: If you combine the chairs and people together, how many legs do they have? Did you skip count the legs by 2's to figure it out?
text: 如果你将椅子和人数结合在一起，它们一共有多少条腿？你是通过2的倍数数腿来计算的吗？

SourceText:
Eryum tried to push his luck, "I love it because it reminds me of ice cream! Can I have some now, pleeeaaase?"

"Mmmm. It's cold now, let's eat ice cream tomorrow. Shall we?" mother says. Then she adds, "Next time, I will tell the tale of the end of the rainbow."
text:
艾隆试图碰碰运气，"我喜欢它因为它让我想起冰淇淋！我现在能吃点吗，求求你了？"

"嗯嗯，现在有点冷了，我们明天吃冰淇淋吧。好吗？" 妈妈说。然后她补充道，"下次，我会讲述彩虹尽头的传说。"

SourceText: Do you like ice cream? If you could, would you eat ice cream all the time?
text: 你喜欢冰淇淋吗？如果可以的话，你会一直吃冰淇淋吗？

SourceText: What is your favorite food? Is your choice different at different times -- for example, one favorite for when it's hot and another when it is cold?
text: 你最喜欢的食物是什么？在不同的时候，你的选择是否不同——例如，在天热时喜欢一种，而在天冷时喜欢另一种？

SourceText: Some people say there is treasure at the end of the rainbow. Make up a story this mother might tell about a treasure at the end of the rainbow.
text: 有人说彩虹尽头有宝藏。编一个关于彩虹尽头有宝藏的故事，这个母亲可能会讲。

SourceText:
Long time ago, animals had no legs.

They all used to crawl.
text:
很久以前，动物都没有腿。

它们都是爬行的。

SourceText: Imagine if you had to crawl everywhere. How hard would that be?
text: 想象一下你只能到处爬行。那会有多难？

SourceText: An estimate is an educated guess. Without counting, estimate how many spots the giraffe has. Now count the spots and see how close you came.
text: 估计是一种有根据的猜测。不数数的情况下，估计长颈鹿有多少斑点。现在数一数斑点，看看你估计得多接近。

SourceText: Do the estimation game with a friend. When you see a group of things, both of you make a quick estimate for the count. Now count the things and see which of you was closer.
text: 和朋友一起玩估计游戏。当你看到一组东西时，你们两个都快速估计数量。现在数一数这些东西，看看谁更接近。

SourceText: Only people had legs, which Maguru gave to them.
text: 只有人类有腿，是马古鲁给予他们的。

SourceText: Arms and legs are called limbs. How many limbs does one person have? How many limbs do two people have?
text: 手臂和腿被称为四肢。一个人有几肢？两个人有几肢？

SourceText: To find all the limbs for two people, you can count them by 4's as four plus four more. Another way is to count the pairs of limbs by 2's as 2, 4, 6, 8. Of course you can just count them all one at a time. Which way do you like best?
text: 要找出两个人的所有肢体，你可以每四个数一次，即四加四等于八。另一种方法是每两个数一次，即2、4、6、8。当然，你也可以一个一个地数。你更喜欢哪种方式？

SourceText: There are lots of colors in this picture. Which colors of the rainbow are missing?
text: 这张图片中有很多颜色。缺少了彩虹的哪些颜色？

SourceText:
One day, Maguru decided to give legs to every animal. He wanted them to walk.

He told them about it.
text:
有一天，马古鲁决定给每个动物腿。他希望它们能够行走。

他将这件事告诉了它们。

SourceText: Count as many round shapes in this picture as you can.
text: 数一数这张图片中有多少圆形。

SourceText: A round shape that comes to a point is called a cone. The megaphone and the tops of the houses are all cones. Have you ever had food, such as ice cream, out of a cone?
text: 延长到一个点的圆形被称为圆锥形。喇叭和房子的顶部都是圆锥形。你曾经尝试过从圆锥形中吃东西，比如冰淇淋吗？

SourceText: Maguru's hand has an unusual number of fingers. Who has more fingers, you or Maguru?
text: 马古鲁的手有不寻常的手指数量。你和马古鲁谁的手指更多？

SourceText:
The animals said, "It will be very nice to have legs."

They sang and danced.
text:
动物们说："有腿会很棒。"

他们唱歌跳舞起来。

SourceText: You can dance sitting down and you can dance lying down. Have you ever tried dancing on your knees?
text: 你可以坐着跳舞，也可以躺着跳舞。你试过跪着跳舞吗？

SourceText: These animals can be grouped in many ways. Some have ears and some do not seem to. Some have bodies with just one color and others do not. Some have skinny tails and others do not. Can you think of some other groupings?
text: 这些动物可以以许多方式分组。一些有耳朵，而另一些似乎没有。一些身体只有一种颜色，而其他一些则没有。一些有细长的尾巴，而其他一些则没有。你能想到其他一些分组方式吗？

SourceText: Grouping things using their properties is an important way we understand things in the world. What are some of your most important properties?
text: 使用它们的特性对事物进行分组是我们理解世界的重要方式。你最重要的特性是什么？

SourceText:
The animals said it was hard to crawl.

They felt pain.
text:
动物们说爬行很困难。

他们感到疼痛。

SourceText: Would you rather crawl or walk?
text: 你更愿意爬行还是行走？

SourceText: Do you think the mouse will get legs long enough to put him in the clouds?
text: 你认为老鼠会得到长到能让它触及云层的腿吗？

SourceText: Why do you think the crocodile has band-aids on?
text: 你认为鳄鱼为什么贴着创可贴？

SourceText:
When the day came, many animals went to Maguru's house.

Giraffes, lions, elephants, rabbits, crocodiles, and birds stood in a line.
text:
当那一天到来时，许多动物都去了马古鲁的家。

长颈鹿、狮子、大象、兔子、鳄鱼和鸟站成了一排。

SourceText: That's a very long line! Estimate how many animals are in that line.
text: 那是一条非常长的队列！估计一下那条队列中有多少动物。

SourceText: Count all the animals and see how close your estimate was. Can you count that high? Was it too high, too low, or exactly right?
text: 数一数所有的动物，看看你的估计有多接近。你能数到那么多吗？是多了，少了还是正好？

SourceText: Do you see any animals going down? Do you think there is a different path on the backside of the mountain for going down?
text: 你看到有动物下山吗？你觉得山的背面会有一条不同的路径下山吗？

SourceText:
Each animal was given four legs.

Birds were given two legs each.
text:
每只动物都被赋予了四条腿。

鸟类每只被赋予了两条腿。

SourceText: Birds are animals, so why are they being treated differently than the other animals?
text: 鸟是动物，那么为什么它们被区别对待了呢？

SourceText: How many fewer feet did birds get than the other animals?
text: 相比其他动物，鸟少得到了多少条腿？

SourceText: If you were a bird, would you feel short-changed getting only two feet, or do you think having two feet is more fun than having four?
text: 如果你是一只鸟，你会觉得只有两条腿很亏吗，还是认为有两条腿比四条更有趣？

SourceText:
Everything was different after they got legs.

Some danced for joy. Others fell down.
text:
在它们得到腿之后，一切都变了。

一些动物高兴地跳起了舞。另外一些摔倒了。

SourceText: Look at their faces. What are the different feelings these animals have?
text: 看看它们的表情。这些动物有了那些不同的感觉？

SourceText: Some of the animals are having trouble with their new legs. Is it fun for you when you try something new, or is it frustrating sometimes? What is something new you tried that was difficult for you?
text: 一些动物在适应新腿时遇到了问题。当你尝试新事物时，对你来说是快乐的，还是有时让人沮丧的？有什么新事物是对你来说很困难的吗？

SourceText: How many of these animals have four legs and how many have two? What is the total number of legs on this page?
text: 这些动物中有多少只有四条腿，有多少只有两条腿？这一页上腿的总数是多少？

SourceText:
They went to show people.

The animals said, "We will never crawl again."
text:
它们去向人们展示。

动物们说：“我们再也不用爬行了。”

SourceText: People are animals and only have two legs. According to this story, does that mean that people are birds?
text: 人类是动物，只有两条腿。根据这个故事，这是否意味着人类是鸟类？

SourceText: Is it possible for two types of animals to have a property in common, such as having two legs, and still be different? How much do two things have to have in common to be the same?
text: 两种动物是否可能共有一种特性，比如都有两条腿，但仍然不同？两个事物必须有多大的共同点才能被认为是相同的？

SourceText: One of these animals has four legs, but it is standing on two of them. Which one is it?
text: 这些动物中有一只有四条腿，但它用了两条腿站立。是哪一只？

SourceText:
The last one in the line was Millipede. Maguru asked, "Is there anyone else after you?"

Millipede answered, "No, I am the last one."
text:
队列中的最后一个是蜈蚣。马古鲁问：“你后面还有其他人吗？”

蜈蚣回答：“没有，我是最后一个。”

SourceText: When you are in line and there is no one after you, you are the last one. Where are you in line if there is no one before you?
text: 当你在队列中并且后面没有人时，你就是最后一个。如果在你前面没有人，你在队列中的位置在哪里？

SourceText: Why was it important to Maguru that Millipede is last? Do you think Maguru is tired of giving legs to animals?
text: 为什么对于马古鲁来说蜈蚣是最后一个很重要？你认为马古鲁是否厌倦了给动物赋予腿？

SourceText: What do you think will happen next?
text: 你认为接下来会发生什么？

SourceText:
Maguru thought, "He is the last one. What will I do with the rest of the legs?"

Maguru gave Millipede all the remaining legs.
text:
马古鲁想，"他是最后一个。我该怎么处理剩下的腿呢？"

马古鲁把所有剩下的腿都给了蜈蚣。

SourceText: Millipede looks very happy to have so many legs. Would you like to have that many legs?
text: 蜈蚣看起来非常高兴能拥有这么多的腿。你想要那么多的腿吗？

SourceText: If you had so many legs, think of all the shoes you would need. Tying your shoes in the morning would take forever!
text: 如果你有那么多的腿，想象一下你会需要多少双鞋。在早上系鞋带会花很长时间！

SourceText: Can you count high enough to count all of Millipede's feet? Millipede's name means "thousand feet." The record for a millipede is 750 feet, so the name is not exactly correct.
text: 你能数到足够高的数字来数清蜈蚣所有的腿吗？蜈蚣的名字意味着"千足"。蜈蚣的记录是有750条腿，所以这个名字并不完全准确。

SourceText: Millipede was very happy. He said, "I will move faster than others."
text: 蜈蚣非常高兴。他说：“我会比其他动物走得更快。”

SourceText: Do you think an animal moves faster because it has more feet? Can you think of four-legged animals that move more slowly than people?
text: 你认为一个动物会因为有更多的脚而移动得更快吗？你能想到比人类移动更慢的四条腿的动物吗？

SourceText: Have you ever seen a millipede? They do not move very quickly at all! Why do you suppose they are so slow?
text: 你见过蜈蚣吗？它们移动起来一点也不快！你觉得它们为什么移动那么慢呢？

SourceText: Clouds often look like the clouds in this picture; they have flat bottoms and fluffy tops. Do you have any ideas on why that would be?
text: 云常常看起来像这张图片中的云；它们底部是平的，顶部是蓬松的。你知道为什么会这样吗？

SourceText: After Millipede left, Snake came to Maguru's house. He said to Maguru, "Please give me some legs."
text: 蜈蚣离开后，蛇来到马古鲁的家。他对马古鲁说：“请给我一些腿。”

SourceText: Uh oh! There are no more legs and Snake needs some. How would you solve this problem?
text: 哦！没有多余的腿了，而蛇需要一些。你会怎么解决这个问题？

SourceText: Rectangles are shapes with four straight sides that look like this page. How many rectangles can you find on this page?
text: 长方形是像这一页一样具有四条直边的形状。你能在这一页上找到多少个长方形？

SourceText: Squares are rectangles with four equal sides. Can you find the rectangle on this page that is a square?
text: 正方形是具有四个相等边的长方形。你能找到这页上是正方形的长方形吗？

SourceText:
Maguru said, "I have given out all the legs. Where were you?"

Snake answered, "I overslept."
text:
马古鲁说：“我已经给完了所有的腿。你上哪儿去了？”

蛇回答说：“我睡过头了。”

SourceText: Look at their faces. How do they feel?
text: 看看他们的脸。他们是什么感觉？

SourceText: Have you ever overslept? Was it fun to sleep in, or did you feel guilty about sleeping so long?
text: 你有过睡过头的经历吗？睡懒觉是件快乐的事情吗，还是你会因为睡了这么长时间而内疚？

SourceText: Can you count all the stripes on this page? Can you count that high?
text: 你能数清这一页上的所有条纹吗？你能数到那么多吗？

SourceText:
Maguru looked to see if there were legs remaining.

He did not find any.
text:
马古鲁看看是否有剩下的腿。

他没有找到任何腿。

SourceText: Describe some of the rectangles on this page. Are any of  them squares?
text: 描述一下这页上的一些长方形。其中有一些是正方形吗？

SourceText: When you can only see part of something that has a stripe, it can look like a rectangle. Describe a few of those on this page.
text: 当你只能看到带有条纹的东西的一部分时，它看起来可能像一个长方形。描述一下这页上的其中一些。

SourceText: There are no legs where Maguru looked. When you have none of something, you have 0 of them. Zero is a very useful number for describing not having anything. Name some silly things that you have zero of!
text: 马古鲁找的地方没有腿。当你没有某样东西时，你有0个。零是一个用来描述没有任何东西的非常有用的数字。说一些你没有的傻事吧！

SourceText:
Maguru said to Snake, "Sorry. There are no legs left." Snake crawled home without legs.

From that day, Snake does not sleep much. He is waiting to be first in line to get legs.
text:
马古鲁对蛇说：“对不起。没有多余的腿了。”蛇没有腿只能爬回了家。

从那天起，蛇就不怎么睡觉了。他等着排在第一位得到腿。

SourceText: It is a very sad day for Snake! Have you ever been sad that others got something that you did not? Were you happy for the others, or just sad that you were left out?
text: 这对蛇来说是一个非常悲伤的日子！你曾经因为别人得到了东西而你没有得到感到难过吗？你会为别人感到高兴，还是只是因为自己被遗漏而感到难过？

SourceText: Can you think of some other animals that have zero legs?
text: 你能想到一些其他没有腿的动物吗？

SourceText: There is a cloud next to Maguru that is quite strange! The cloud is between Snake and Maguru's home. It must be a very tiny cloud!
text: 马古鲁旁边有一朵云看起来非常奇怪！这朵云位于蛇和马古鲁的家之间。它一定是一朵非常小的云！

SourceText: My sister's dress is too big for me!
text: 姐姐的衣服对我来说太大了！

SourceText: Do you sometimes wear someone else's clothes? Is it fun to imagine you are that other person when you do it?
text: 你会穿别人的衣服吗？你这样穿的时候，想象自己是另一个人，有趣吗？

SourceText: How can you tell the dress and belt are too big?
text: 你怎么看得出来裙子和腰带太大了？

SourceText: A rectangle is a four-sided shape like this page. Point to rectangles in the picture. Do you see any rectangles where you are?
text: 长方形是像这页纸一样的四边形状。指出图片中的长方形。你看到周围有长方形吗？

SourceText: My brother's jersey is also too big for me.
text: 哥哥的球衣对我来说也太大了。

SourceText: Looking at her face, how does she feel about having a jersey that is too big?
text: 看看她的脸，她对穿太大的球衣有什么感觉？

SourceText: Is the orange dress she has on the right size for her?
text: 她身上的橙色连衣裙尺寸合适吗？

SourceText: Notice the new rectangles in this picture.
text: 注意这张图中的新长方形。

SourceText:
My bag is big.

But not too big!
text:
我的包很大。

但没有太大！

SourceText: Is this bag too big for her?
text: 这个包对她来说太大了吗？

SourceText: Count together the clasps on the bag.
text: 数一数袋子上的扣子。

SourceText: What would you put in this bag if it were yours?
text: 如果这个包是你的，你会在里面放什么？

SourceText: This old belt is too small for me.
text: 这条旧皮带对我来说太小了。

SourceText: Why might this child's old belt from when she was younger be too small for her?
text: 为什么这孩子小时候的旧腰带对她来说太小了？

SourceText: What does the expression on her face tell you about how she is feeling about the belt?
text: 从她脸上的表情可以看出她对腰带的感受怎么样？

SourceText: How many pieces of clothing has she tried on?
text: 她试穿了几件衣服？

SourceText: This is my doll's hat.
text: 这是我的洋娃娃的帽子。

SourceText: This is the fourth piece of clothing that is a bad fit for her. How does she feel about it? Do you think she is feeling discouraged?
text: 这是第四件不合身的衣服。她对这有什么感想？你觉得她会感到沮丧吗？

SourceText: Count together the number of pieces of wood that make up the back of the chair.
text: 数一数构成椅背的木块有几块。

SourceText: She has two eyes, ears, and arms, but only one mouth and nose. Where do the body parts that she has one of line up on her body?
text: 她有两只眼睛、耳朵和手臂，但只有一张嘴和一个鼻子。这两个身体部位在哪里？

SourceText:
My socks are the right size.

But the wrong color!
text:
我的袜子尺寸正好。

但是颜色不对！

SourceText: Including her hair ties, which colors is she wearing?
text: 包括她的发带，她穿着什么颜色的袜子？

SourceText: Do you think her socks are the wrong color?
text: 你觉得她的袜子颜色对不对？

SourceText: The picture of the chair is made up of several rectangles. How many can you find?
text: 椅子的图片是由几个长方形组成的。你能找到几个？

SourceText: These are my new shoes.
text: 这是我的新鞋。

SourceText: After all the other clothes, do you think these shoes will fit?
text: 试了这么多衣服，你觉得这双鞋会合脚吗？

SourceText: Where did she go?
text: 她去哪儿了？

SourceText: These shoes must be in a different room -- the door and windows are a different color. What colors were they before?
text: 这些鞋子一定在不同的房间里——门和窗户的颜色不一样。他们以前是什么颜色的？

SourceText: They fit me very well.
text: 它们非常适脚。

SourceText: Is her hat the same as her doll's hat? Does it seem too small to you?
text: 她的帽子和她娃娃的帽子一样吗？你觉得它太小了吗？

SourceText: Do you think she needs a belt with her dress?
text: 你觉得她的裙子需要一条腰带吗？

SourceText: Is she ready for school now?
text: 她准备好可以去上学了吗？

SourceText: Let me tell you about the palm tree.
text: 让我告诉你关于棕榈树的事情吧。

SourceText: Do you have palm trees where you live? There are many kinds of palm trees -- perhaps yours look different than these.
text: 你居住的地方有棕榈树吗？有许多种类的棕榈树，也许你的棕榈树看起来与这些不同。

SourceText: His necklace has a repeating pattern of yellow and red beads. Count the beads by using the pattern to count by 2's.
text: 他的项链上有一种黄色和红色珠子的重复图案。通过使用图案按2的倍数计数珠子。

SourceText: He has loops for his ears. How many looping pieces of clothing does he have? Be sure to look all over.
text: 他的耳朵上有环。他有多少件环绕式的衣物？一定要仔细看。

SourceText: This tree lives when everything else is dry.
text: 这棵树在其他一切都干燥时生存。

SourceText: Water is needed by most living things. Palm trees are smart about using very little water in a dry place.
text: 大多数生物都需要水。棕榈树在干旱地区非常节约用水。

SourceText: The branches split into two branches as they go up. Count the branches at the top of what we can see before the leaves.
text: 树枝向上分成两支。在我们能看到的叶子之前，数数顶部的树枝。

SourceText: Count the bones and stones on the ground.
text: 数数地面上的骨头和石头。

SourceText: The shade from a palm tree is always cool.
text: 棕榈树的阴影总是很凉快。

SourceText: Is there something special about the shade of a palm tree that makes it cool?
text: 棕榈树的阴影有什么特别之处，使它变得凉爽吗？

SourceText: Is the shade of all trees cool?
text: 所有树的阴影都凉爽吗？

SourceText: This person barely fits inside this shade. Why did he pick such a small tree? Maybe there aren't any other trees nearby?
text: 这个人几乎无法容纳在这个阴影中。他为什么选择了这么小的一棵树？也许附近没有其他树木？

SourceText: We eat fruit from the palm tree.
text: 我们吃棕榈树的果实。

SourceText: Name and count the kinds of fruit you like to eat.
text: 列出并计算你喜欢吃的果实的种类。

SourceText: Their hair is braided into rows. Which one has more rows that you can see? What is the difference between the two numbers -- how many more?
text: 他们的头发编成了一行一行的辫子。哪一个有更多的辫子可以看到？这两个数字之间有什么区别--多了多少？

SourceText: Does it make sense that the bigger person would have the bigger number of hair rows?
text: 体型较大的人有更多的辫子，这是否合理？

SourceText: We use palm leaves to thatch our houses.
text: 我们用棕榈树叶来覆盖我们的房屋。

SourceText: This house has a round shape. Round houses are easier to build and enclose more space.
text: 这个房子是圆形的。圆形的房屋更容易建造，并且可以围合更多的空间。

SourceText: Do you have any round buildings where you live?
text: 你居住的地方有没有圆形的建筑？

SourceText: Balls and light bulbs are usually round. What are some round things around you?
text: 球和灯泡通常是圆的。你周围有一些圆形的东西吗？

SourceText: We make brooms and mats from palm leaves.
text: 我们用棕榈树叶制作扫帚和垫子。

SourceText: Of the things around you, which of them look like they are made directly from trees or other natural materials?
text: 在你周围的东西中，哪些看起来像是直接由树木或其他自然材料制成的？

SourceText: Count together the number of different things in this picture that are made from a palm.
text: 一起数一数这张图片中用棕榈制成的不同物品的数量。

SourceText: Count the number of loops that she is wearing. Is the number more or less than the man had on an earlier page?
text: 数一数她戴着的环。这个数字比先前页面上那个男人戴的多还是少？

SourceText: We use palm tree seeds for fuel.
text: 我们使用棕榈树种子作为燃料。

SourceText: Burning palm tree seeds is one of many possible sources of heat. How do you get heat where you live?
text: 燃烧棕榈树种子是许多可能的加热源之一。在你居住的地方，你是如何获得热量的？

SourceText: What are other uses for heat besides cooking?
text: 除了烹饪之外，热量还有哪些其他用途？

SourceText: An estimate is an educated guess based on partial information. Estimate the number of seeds in that basket. Is it a bigger number than you know?
text: 估计是基于部分信息的一种有根据的猜测。估计一下篮子里有多少颗种子。这个数字是否比你知道的更大？

SourceText: Do you see why the palm tree is important?
text: 你看出棕榈树为什么重要吗？

SourceText: List and count how many ways the palm tree is useful to them.
text: 列出并计算棕榈树对他们有多有用的方式。

SourceText: What are some trees where you live that have important uses?
text: 在你居住的地方，有哪些树木具有重要的用途？

SourceText: Whether useful or not, what are some of your favorite trees near you?
text: 无论是否有用，你附近有没有一些你喜欢的树木？

SourceText: This is Ndalo.
text: 这是达罗。

SourceText: Identify together the kinds of animals you see and count each type.
text: 一起找出你能看到的动物种类并且数出每种动物的数量。

SourceText: Which type of animal in this picture is there the most of?
text: 这张图片上哪种动物最多?

SourceText: Count together the buttons on Ndalo's shirt.
text: 数一数达罗衬衫上纽扣的数量。

SourceText: Ndalo likes to read books.
text: 达罗喜欢读书。

SourceText: Count together the books in front of Ndalo on the table.
text: 数一数达罗面前桌子上书本的数量。

SourceText: You can see on his face how much he likes to read!
text: 你可以从他的脸上知道他有多喜欢读书！

SourceText: Do you like hearing stories from books?
text: 你喜欢听书里的故事吗？

SourceText: This is Pendo.
text: 这是彭多。

SourceText: There are many little details in this picture. Count the animals that you can find.
text: 这张照片里有很多小细节。 数一数你能找到的动物。

SourceText: How many trees and power poles do you see?
text: 你能看到多少树和电线杆？

SourceText: Point at and count the people moving around that you can just barely see.
text: 指出并且数一数那些你几乎看不清的四处走动的人。

SourceText: Pendo likes to eat carrots.
text: 彭多喜欢吃胡萝卜。

SourceText: Can you tell by looking at Pendo that Pendo likes carrots?
text: 你能光看就知道彭多喜欢吃胡萝卜吗？

SourceText: Do you like eating carrots? What is your favorite vegetable?
text: 你喜欢吃胡萝卜吗? 你最喜欢的蔬菜是什么？

SourceText: Pendo is eating two carrots, and Ndalo is holding three more carrots. What is three more than two?
text: 彭多正在吃两根胡萝卜, 达罗正拿着多余的三根胡萝卜。 比二多三是多少？

SourceText: Ndalo grazes Pendo after school.
text: 放学后达罗喂彭多吃草。

SourceText: Count all the different animals in the yard, or just count your favorites.
text: 数一数院子里不同动物的数量, 或者只数你喜欢的动物的数量。

SourceText: Which type of animal is there the most of and which has the least?
text: 哪种动物最多，哪种动物最少？

SourceText: What food are Pendo and the goats eating? Do you suppose you would like eating grass?
text: 彭多和羊们在吃什么? 你认为你会喜欢吃草吗？

SourceText: He gives fresh water to Pendo.
text: 他给彭多新鲜的水。

SourceText: Ndalo is very good about taking care of Pendo. Do you have any animals that you care for?
text: 达罗很会照顾彭多。你有喜欢的动物吗？
